English: Adam, Seth, Enosh
Bahnar: Ađam pơjing Set, Set pơjing Ênos

English: Cainan, Mahalalel, Jared
Bahnar: Ênos pơjing Kênan, Kênan pơjing Mahalale, Mahalale pơjing Jaret

English: Enoch, Methuselah, Lamech
Bahnar: Jêret pơjing Ênok, Ênok pơjing Mêthusêla, Mêthusêla pơjing Lêmek

English: Noah, Shem, Ham, and Japheth.
Bahnar: Lêmek pơjing Nôê, Nôê pơjing Sem, Cham păng Japhet. Adrĕch Japhet

English: The sons of Japheth were Gomer, Magog, Madai, Javan, Tubal, Meshech, and Tiras.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Japhet: Gômer, Magok, Mađai, Jawan, Tubal, Mêsek păng Tiras.

English: The sons of Gomer were Ashkenaz, Diphath, and Togarmah.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Gômer: Askenas, Diphat păng Tôgarma.

English: The sons of Javan were Elishah, Tarshishah, Kittim, and Rodanim.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Jawan: Êlisa, Tarsis, Kittim păng Rôđanim. Adrĕch Cham

English: The sons of Ham were Cush, Mizraim, Put, and Canaan.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Cham: Kus, Misraim, Phut păng Kanaan.

English: The sons of Cush were Seba, Havilah, Sabta, Raama, and Sabtecha. The sons of Raama were Sheba and Dedan.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Kus: Sêba, Hawila, Sapta, Raama păng Saptêka. Kon drŏ-nglo Raama: Seba păng Đêdan.

English: Cush begot Nimrod; he began to be a mighty one on the earth.
Bahnar: Kus kư̆m pơjing Nimrôt bơngai nuih blŭng-a kơpal teh âu.

English: Mizraim begot Ludim, Anamim, Lehabim, Naphtuhim
Bahnar: Misraim pơjing adrĕch Luđit, Anamim, Lêhabit, Naptuhit

English: Pathrusim, Casluhim (from whom came the Philistines and the Caphtorim).
Bahnar: Pathrusit, Kasluhim, păng Kaptôrit. Đơ̆ng Kasluhit đei adrĕch Philistin.

English: Canaan begot Sidon, his firstborn, and Heth
Bahnar: Kanaan pơjing Siđôn kon drŏ-nglo kơdră sư păng adrĕch Hêt

English: the Jebusite, the Amorite, and the Girgashite
Bahnar: Jêbus, Amôrit, Girgasit

English: the Hivite, the Arkite, and the Sinite
Bahnar: Hêwit, Arêkit, Sinit

English: the Arvadite, the Zemarite, and the Hamathite.
Bahnar: Arwadit Sêmarit păng Hamat. Adrĕch Sem

English: The sons of Shem were Elam, Asshur, Arphaxad, Lud, Aram, Uz, Hul, Gether, and Meshech.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Sem: Êlam, Asur, Apaksat, Lut păng Aram. Aram pơjing: Us, Hul, Gêther păng Mêsek.

English: Arphaxad begot Shelah, and Shelah begot Eber.
Bahnar: Apaksat pơjing Sêla; Sêla pơjing Eber.

English: To Eber were born two sons: the name of one was Peleg, for in his days the earth was divided; and his brother’s name was Joktan.
Bahnar: Eber pơjing 'bar 'nu kon drŏ-nglo; minh 'nu anăn sư Pêlek yua kơ lăm jơhnơr sư đe asong băl teh; oh sư anăn Jôktan.

English: Joktan begot Almodad, Sheleph, Hazarmaveth, Jerah
Bahnar: Jôktan pơjing Almodat, Sêlep, Hasamawet, Jêra

English: Hadoram, Uzal, Diklah
Bahnar: Hadôram, Usal, Dikla

English: Ebal, Abimael, Sheba
Bahnar: Êbal, Abimael, Sêba

English: Ophir, Havilah, and Jobab. All these were the sons of Joktan.
Bahnar: Ôphir, Hawila, păng Jôbap. Đĭ-đăng lu bơngai 'nâu kon drŏ-nglo Jôktan.

English: Shem, Arphaxad, Shelah
Bahnar: Sem pơjing Apaksat, Arphasat pơjing Sêla

English: Eber, Peleg, Reu
Bahnar: Sêla pơjing Eber, Eber pơjing Pêlek, Pêlek pơjing kơ Rêu, Rêu pơjing Sêruk

English: Serug, Nahor, Terah
Bahnar: Rêu pơjing Sêruk, pơjing Nahor, Nahor pơjing Thêra

English: and Abram, who is Abraham.
Bahnar: Thêra pơjing Abram, đe krao anăn Abraham. Adrĕch adrung Abraham

English: The sons of Abraham were Isaac and Ishmael.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Abraham: Isăk păng Ismael. Kon sâu đơ̆ng yă Hagar

English: These are their genealogies: The firstborn of Ishmael was Nebajoth; then Kedar, Adbeel, Mibsam
Bahnar: 'Nâu jing adrĕch adrung Ismael: Kon kơdră Ismael noh Nebaiôt; đơ̆ng noh Kêđar, Atbêel, Misam

English: Mishma, Dumah, Massa, Hadad, Tema
Bahnar: Mipma, Đuma, Masa, Hađat, Thêma

English: Jetur, Naphish, and Kedemah. These were the sons of Ishmael.
Bahnar: Jêtur, Naphis păng Kêđema. Noh lu kon drŏ-nglo Ismael. Kon sâu đơ̆ng yă Kêtura

English: Now the sons born to Keturah, Abraham’s concubine, were Zimran, Jokshan, Medan, Midian, Ishbak, and Shuah. The sons of Jokshan were Sheba and Dedan.
Bahnar: Kêtura akăn tuch tuch Abraham, tơpŭ lu kon drŏ-nglo noh: Simran, Jôksan. Mêđan, Miđian, Isbak păng Sua. Jôksan pơjing Sêba păng Đêdan.

English: The sons of Midian were Ephah, Epher, Hanoch, Abida, and Eldaah. All these were the children of Keturah.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Miđian noh: Êpha, Êpher, Hanok, Abida păng Elda. Dôm lu bơngai noh kon sâu Kêtura. Kon sâu đơ̆ng yă Sara

English: And Abraham begot Isaac. The sons of Isaac were Esau and Israel.
Bahnar: Abraham pơjing Isăk. Kon drŏ-nglo Isăk noh: Êsâu păng Isơrael.

English: The sons of Esau were Eliphaz, Reuel, Jeush, Jaalam, and Korah.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Êsâu noh: Êliphas, Rêuel, Jêrus, Jalam păng Kôra.

English: And the sons of Eliphaz were Teman, Omar, Zephi, Gatam, and Kenaz; and by Timna, Amalek.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Êliphas noh: Thêman, Ômar, Sêpho, Gatam, Kênas; Thimna akăn kơnhŏng Êliphas mĕ kơ Amalek.

English: The sons of Reuel were Nahath, Zerah, Shammah, and Mizzah.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Rêuel noh: Nahat, Sêra, Samma păng Misa.

English: The sons of Seir were Lotan, Shobal, Zibeon, Anah, Dishon, Ezer, and Dishan.
Bahnar: Bơngai oei lăm teh đak Sêir char Êdom kon drŏ-nglo Sêir noh: Lôthan, Sôbal, Sibêôn, Ana, Dison, Êser păng Disan.

English: And the sons of Lotan were Hori and Homam; Lotan’s sister was Timna.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Lôthan: Hôri păng Hôman; gah Thimna oh drŏ-kăn Lôthan.

English: The sons of Shobal were Alian, Manahath, Ebal, Shephi, and Onam. The sons of Zibeon were Ajah and Anah.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Sôbal noh: Awan, Manahat, Êbal, Sipho păng Ônam. Kon drŏ-nglo Sibêôn noh: Aiyah păng Ana.

English: The son of Anah was Dishon. The sons of Dishon were Hamran, Eshban, Ithran, and Cheran.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Ana noh: Dison. Kon drŏ-nglo Đisôn noh: Hemran, Êsban, Ithran păng Kêran.

English: The sons of Ezer were Bilhan, Zaavan, and Jaakan. The sons of Dishan were Uz and Aran.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Êser noh: Bilhan, Sawan păng Jaakan. Kon drŏ-nglo Disan noh: Us păng Aran.

English: Now these were the kings who reigned in the land of Edom before a king reigned over the children of Israel: Bela the son of Beor, and the name of his city was Dinhabah.
Bahnar: Adrol kon pơlei Isơrael ưh tam đei pơtao pơgơ̆r, 'nâu boih anăn lu pơtao pơgơ̆r, dêh Eđôm: Bêla kon drŏ-nglo Bêôr; anăn pơlei tih sư Dinhaba.

English: And when Bela died, Jobab the son of Zerah of Bozrah reigned in his place.
Bahnar: Pơtao Bêla lôch, Jôbap, kon drŏ-nglo Sêra, bơngai pơlei Bôsra, iung pơm pơtao.

English: When Jobab died, Husham of the land of the Temanites reigned in his place.
Bahnar: Pơtao Jôbap lôch, Husam, bơngai dêh Thêman, iung pơm pơtao.

English: And when Husham died, Hadad the son of Bedad, who attacked Midian in the field of Moab, reigned in his place. The name of his city was Avith.
Bahnar: Pơtao Husam lôch, Hađat, kon drŏ-nglo Bêđat, iung pơm pơtao; pơtao 'nâu boih mă tơblah kon pơlei Miđian tơ anih tơmăn glă char Môap; anăn pơlei noh Awit.

English: When Hadad died, Samlah of Masrekah reigned in his place.
Bahnar: Pơtao Hađat lôch, Samla, bơngai pơlei Masrêka, iung pơm pơtao.

English: And when Samlah died, Saul of Rehoboth-by-the-River reigned in his place.
Bahnar: Pơtao Samla lôch, Sôl bơngai pơlei Rêhôbôt, oei jih đak krong iung pơm pơtao

English: When Saul died, Baal-Hanan the son of Achbor reigned in his place.
Bahnar: Pơtao Sôl lôch, Baal Hanan, kon drŏ-nglo Akbôr iung pơm pơtao.

English: And when Baal-Hanan died, Hadad reigned in his place; and the name of his city was Pai. His wife’s name was Mehetabel the daughter of Matred, the daughter of Mezahab.
Bahnar: Pơtao Baal Hanan lôch, Hađat iung pơm pơtao; anăn pơlei tih sư Pau; na akăn sư anăn Mêhêtabel, kon drŏ-kăn Matrêt, kon yă Mê Sahap.

English: Hadad died also. And the chiefs of Edom were Chief Timnah, Chief Aliah, Chief Jetheth
Bahnar: Pơtao Hađat kư̆m lôch. Lu kră pơgơ̆r dêh Eđôm noh; Thimna, Alwa, Jêthet

English: Chief Aholibamah, Chief Elah, Chief Pinon
Bahnar: Ôhôlibama, Êlah, Phinôn.

English: Chief Kenaz, Chief Teman, Chief Mibzar
Bahnar: Kênas, Thêman, Mipsar

English: Chief Magdiel, and Chief Iram. These were the chiefs of Edom.
Bahnar: Makđiêl păng Iram 'noh lu kră pơgơ̆r dêh Eđôm.

English: These were the sons of Israel: Reuben, Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar, Zebulun
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Isơrael noh: Rubên, Simêôn, Lêwi, Juđa, Isakar, Sebulôn

English: Dan, Joseph, Benjamin, Naphtali, Gad, and Asher.
Bahnar: Đan, Jôsep, Bênjamin, Neptali, Gat păng Aser.

English: The sons of Judah were Er, Onan, and Shelah. These three were born to him by the daughter of Shua, the Canaanitess. Er, the firstborn of Judah, was wicked in the sight of the LORD; so He killed him.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Juđa: Er, Ônan păng Sêla. Pêng 'nu âu đơ̆ng akăn bơngai Kanaan kon drŏ-kăn Sua. Er, kon kơdră Juđa, pơm tơdrong kơnê̆ 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang, na Kră Yang pơlôch lê̆ sư.

English: And Tamar, his daughter-in-law, bore him Perez and Zerah. All the sons of Judah were five.
Bahnar: Tamar mŏ mai Juđa, tơpŭ ăn kơ sư Phêrês păng Sêra. Juđa đei pơđăm 'nu kon drŏ-nglo.

English: The sons of Perez were Hezron and Hamul.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Phêrês: Hêsrôn păng Hamul.

English: The sons of Zerah were Zimri, Ethan, Heman, Calcol, and Dara—five of them in all.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Sêra: Simri, Êthan, Hêman, Kalkôl păng Dara đei pơđăm 'nu.

English: The son of Carmi was Achar, the troubler of Israel, who transgressed in the accursed thing.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Karmi: Đei Akar,a bơngai pơrŭng lăm Isơrael, pơm glăi kơ tơmam đe pơkăm.

English: The son of Ethan was Azariah.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Êthan: Asaria.

English: Also the sons of Hezron who were born to him were Jerahmeel, Ram, and Chelubai.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Hêsrôn pơjing: Jêrahmêel, Ram păng Kalep.

English: Ram begot Amminadab, and Amminadab begot Nahshon, leader of the children of Judah
Bahnar: Ram pơjing Aminađap, Aminađap pơjing Nahsôn, pơm 'bok pơgơ̆r lu bơngai Juđa.

English: Nahshon begot Salma, and Salma begot Boaz
Bahnar: Nahsôn pơjing Salmôn, Salmôn pơjing 'Bôô

English: Boaz begot Obed, and Obed begot Jesse
Bahnar: 'Bôô pơjing Ôbêt, Ôbêt pơjing Jese.

English: Jesse begot Eliab his firstborn, Abinadab the second, Shimea the third
Bahnar: Jese pơjing Êliap kon kơdră sư, kon mă 'bar sư Abinađap, mă pêng Simêa

English: Nethanel the fourth, Raddai the fifth
Bahnar: mă puăn Nethanel, mă pơđăm Rađai

English: Ozem the sixth, and David the seventh.
Bahnar: mă tơdrâu Ôsem, mă tơpơh Đawit.

English: Now their sisters were Zeruiah and Abigail. And the sons of Zeruiah were Abishai, Joab, and Asahel—three.
Bahnar: Mŏ oh lu sư Sêruia păng Abigail. Sêruia đei pêng 'nu kon drŏ-nglo Abisai, Jôap păng Asahel.

English: Abigail bore Amasa; and the father of Amasa was Jether the Ishmaelite.
Bahnar: Abigail pơjing kơ Amasa; 'bă Amasa noh Jêther bơngai Ismael.

English: Caleb the son of Hezron had children by Azubah, his wife, and by Jerioth. Now these were her sons: Jesher, Shobab, and Ardon.
Bahnar: Kalep kon drŏ-nglo Hêsrôn. Kalep oei kơ Asuba păng Jêriôt kon bre sư noh: Jeser, Sôbap păng Arđôn.

English: When Azubah died, Caleb took Ephrath as his wife, who bore him Hur.
Bahnar: Wă Asuba lôch boih, na Kalep iŏk Êphrat pơjing kơ Hur.

English: And Hur begot Uri, and Uri begot Bezalel.
Bahnar: Hur pơjing Uri, Uri pơjing Bêsalel.

English: Now afterward Hezron went in to the daughter of Machir the father of Gilead, whom he married when he was sixty years old; and she bore him Segub.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ 'noh, Hêsrôn iŏk oei tơdrâu-jĭt sơnăm boih, păng 'bĭch hăm kon adruh Makir, 'bă kơ Gileat; na đei hĭ Sêgup kơplah sư đĭ tơdrâu-jĭt sơnăm boih.

English: Segub begot Jair, who had twenty-three cities in the land of Gilead.
Bahnar: Sêgup pơjing Jair, bơngai mă pơgơ̆r 'bar-jĭt pêng tŏ pơlei lăm dêh Gileat.

English: (Geshur and Syria took from them the towns of Jair, with Kenath and its towns—sixty towns.) All these belonged to the sons of Machir the father of Gilead.
Bahnar: Mă-lei kon pơlei Gêsur păng kon pơlei Aram tơgar iŏk pơlei Hawôt Jar păng Kênat, hăm lu pơlei iĕ jê̆ kiơ̆ 'noh đei tơdrâu-jĭt tŏ pơlei. Đĭ-đăng lu bơngai 'noh kon sâu Makir, 'bă Gileat.

English: After Hezron died in Caleb Ephrathah, Hezron’s wife Abijah bore him Ashhur the father of Tekoa.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ Hêsrôn lôch tơ tơring Kalep Êphratha boih, na akăn sư Abija tơpŭ kơ sư Asur, 'bă Têkôa.

English: The sons of Jerahmeel, the firstborn of Hezron, were Ram, the firstborn, and Bunah, Oren, Ozem, and Ahijah.
Bahnar: Jêrahmêel, kon drŏ-nglo kơdră Hêsrôn: Pơjing Ram kon kơdră, Buna, Ôren, Ôsem păng Ahija.

English: Jerahmeel had another wife, whose name was Atarah; she was the mother of Onam.
Bahnar: Jêrahmêel iŏk akăn plơ̆ng dơ̆ng, anăn sư Atara; mĕ kơ Ônam.

English: The sons of Ram, the firstborn of Jerahmeel, were Maaz, Jamin, and Eker.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Ram, kon kơdră Jêrahmêel: Maas, Jamin păng Êkêr.

English: The sons of Onam were Shammai and Jada. The sons of Shammai were Nadab and Abishur.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Ônam: Sammai păng Jađa. Kon drŏ-nglo Sammai: Nađap păng Abisur.

English: And the name of the wife of Abishur was Abihail, and she bore him Ahban and Molid.
Bahnar: Akăn Abisur anăn Abihai, tơpŭ ăn kơ sư Ahban păng Môlit.

English: The sons of Nadab were Seled and Appaim; Seled died without children.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Nađap: Sêlet păng Appaim. Mă-lei Sêlet lôch ưh tam đei kon.

English: The son of Appaim was Ishi, the son of Ishi was Sheshan, and Sheshan’s son was Ahlai.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Appaim Isi. Kon drŏ-nglo Isi noh Sêsan. Kon drŏ-nglo Sêsan noh Ahlai.

English: The sons of Jada, the brother of Shammai, were Jether and Jonathan; Jether died without children.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Jađa oh Sammai noh: Jêther păng Jônathan; Jêther lôch kư̆m ưh kơ đei kon.

English: The sons of Jonathan were Peleth and Zaza. These were the sons of Jerahmeel.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Jônathan: Phêlêt păng Sasa. Noh kon sâu Jêrahmêel.

English: Now Sheshan had no sons, only daughters. And Sheshan had an Egyptian servant whose name was Jarha.
Bahnar: Na Sêsan ưh kơ đei kon drŏ-nglo, đei kon drŏ-kăn đĕch; kư̆m đei minh 'nu đĭch bơngai Êyiptơ anăn sư Jarha.

English: Sheshan gave his daughter to Jarha his servant as wife, and she bore him Attai.
Bahnar: Sêsan pơgơ̆p ăn kon drŏ-kăn sư oei kơ Jarha đĭch sư na pơjing hĭ kơ Attai ăn kơ sư.

English: Attai begot Nathan, and Nathan begot Zabad
Bahnar: Attai pơjing Nathan, Nathan pơjing Sabat

English: Zabad begot Ephlal, and Ephlal begot Obed
Bahnar: Sabat pơjing Ephal, Ephal pơjing Ôbêt.

English: Obed begot Jehu, and Jehu begot Azariah
Bahnar: Ôbêt pơjing Jêhu. Jêhu pơjing Asaria.

English: Azariah begot Helez, and Helez begot Eleasah
Bahnar: Asaria pơjing Hêles. Hêles pơjing Êlêasa

English: Eleasah begot Sismai, and Sismai begot Shallum
Bahnar: Êlêasa pơjing Sismai. Sismai pơjing Sallum.

English: Shallum begot Jekamiah, and Jekamiah begot Elishama.
Bahnar: Sallum pơjing Jêkamia, păng Jekamia pơjing Êlisama. Adrĕch adrung Kalep

English: The descendants of Caleb the brother of Jerahmeel were Mesha, his firstborn, who was the father of Ziph, and the sons of Mareshah the father of Hebron.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Kalep oh Jêrahmêel: Kon kơdră sư Mêsa, 'bă kơ Sip, păng kon drŏ-nglo Marêsa, 'bă kơ Hêbrôn.

English: The sons of Hebron were Korah, Tappuah, Rekem, and Shema.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Hêbrôn: Kôra, Tappua, Rêkem păng Sêma.

English: Shema begot Raham the father of Jorkoam, and Rekem begot Shammai.
Bahnar: Sêma pơjing Raham păng Raham 'bă kơ Jôrkêam; Rêkem pơjing Sammai.

English: And the son of Shammai was Maon, and Maon was the father of Beth Zur.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Sammai noh Maôn păng Maôn 'bă kơ Bêt Sur.

English: Ephah, Caleb’s concubine, bore Haran, Moza, and Gazez; and Haran begot Gazez.
Bahnar: Êpha akăn kơnhŏng Kalep, mĕ kơ Haran, Môsa păng Gases; Haran pơjing Gases.

English: And the sons of Jahdai were Regem, Jotham, Geshan, Pelet, Ephah, and Shaaph.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Jahdai: Noh Rêgem, Jôtham, Gêsan, Phêlêt, Êpha păng Saap.

English: Maachah, Caleb’s concubine, bore Sheber and Tirhanah.
Bahnar: Maaka akăn kơnhŏng Kalep, pơjing kơ Sêber păng Tirhana.

English: She also bore Shaaph the father of Madmannah, Sheva the father of Machbenah and the father of Gibea. And the daughter of Caleb was Achsah.
Bahnar: Sư kư̆m pơjing kơ Saap, 'bă kơ Matmanna păng Sêwa 'bă kơ Makbêna păng Gibêa. Aksa kon drŏ-kăn Kalep.

English: These were the descendants of Caleb: The sons of Hur, the firstborn of Ephrathah, were Shobal the father of Kirjath Jearim
Bahnar: 'Nâu lu kon sâu Kalep: Lu kon drŏ-nglo Hur, kon drŏ-nglo kơdră Êphratha: Sôbal, 'bă kơ Kiriat Jêarim.

English: Salma the father of Bethlehem, and Hareph the father of Beth Gader.
Bahnar: Salma 'bă kơ Betlehem păng Harep 'bă kơ Bêt Gađer.

English: And Shobal the father of Kirjath Jearim had descendants: Haroeh, and half of the families of Manuhoth.
Bahnar: Sôbal 'bă kơ Kiriat Jêarim kư̆m đei lu kon drŏ-nglo nai: Harôê păng minh puăt kon pơlei Manahathit

English: The families of Kirjath Jearim were the Ithrites, the Puthites, the Shumathites, and the Mishraites. From these came the Zorathites and the Eshtaolites.
Bahnar: lu adrĕch Kiriat Jêarim: Bơngai Ithrit, Phuthit, Sunathit păng Misrait. Đơ̆ng lu adrĕch noh na đei kon pơlei Sôrathit păng kon pơlei Êstaôl.

English: The sons of Salma were Bethlehem, the Netophathites, Atroth Beth Joab, half of the Manahethites, and the Zorites.
Bahnar: Kon sâu Salma: Betlehem, bơngai Nêtôphathit, Atrôt Bêt Jôap, minh puăt kon pơlei Manahathit păng Sôrit

English: And the families of the scribes who dwelt at Jabez were the Tirathites, the Shimeathites, and the Suchathites. These were the Kenites who came from Hammath, the father of the house of Rechab.
Bahnar: păng adrĕch adrung 'bok thây bơtho khôi juăt oei tơ pơlei Jabes noh bơngai Tirathit, Simeathit, păng Sukathit. 'Noh kon pơlei Kênit, đơ̆ng adrĕch Hammat, 'bă kơ adrĕch Rêkap.

English: Now these were the sons of David who were born to him in Hebron: The firstborn was Amnon, by Ahinoam the Jezreelitess; the second, Daniel, by Abigail the Carmelitess
Bahnar: 'Nâu dôm lu kon drŏ-nglo Đawit tơpŭ tơ Hêbrôn: Kon drŏ-nglo kơdră sư Amnôn mĕ sư Ahinôam bơngai Jêsreel; kon mă 'bar noh Đaniel mĕ sư Abigail bơngai Karmel

English: the third, Absalom the son of Maacah, the daughter of Talmai, king of Geshur; the fourth, Adonijah the son of Haggith
Bahnar: mă pêng, Apsalôm kon drŏ-nglo mĕ sư Maaka, kon drŏ-kăn Tanmai pơtao dêh Gêsur; mă puăn Ađônija, kon drŏ-nglo mĕ sư Hagit

English: the fifth, Shephatiah, by Abital; the sixth, Ithream, by his wife Eglah.
Bahnar: mă pơđăm Sêphatia, kon drŏ-nglo mĕ sư Abitan; mă tơdrâu Itrêam kon drŏ-nglo Egla.

English: These six were born to him in Hebron. There he reigned seven years and six months, and in Jerusalem he reigned thirty-three years.
Bahnar: Tơdrâu 'nu kon drŏ-nglo 'nâu tơpŭ ăn kơ Đawit tơ Hêbrôn; sư pơgơ̆r tơpơh sơnăm tơdrâu khei. Đawit pơgơ̆r tơ Jêrusalem pêng-jĭt pêng sơnăm.

English: And these were born to him in Jerusalem: Shimea, Shobab, Nathan, and Solomon—four by Bathshua the daughter of Ammiel.
Bahnar: 'Nâu dôm lu kon drŏ-nglo mă đei tơpŭ ăn kơ Đawit tơ Jêrusalem: Simêa, Sôbap, Nathan păng Sôlômôn, puăn 'nu âu, mĕ lu sư Batsêba, kon drŏ-kăn Ammiel.

English: Also there were Ibhar, Elishama, Eliphelet
Bahnar: Sư đei dơ̆ng kon drŏ-nglo: Iphar, Êlisua, Êliphêlet

English: Nogah, Nepheg, Japhia
Bahnar: Nôga, Nêphet, Japhia

English: Elishama, Eliada, and Eliphelet—nine in all.
Bahnar: Êlisama, Êliađa păng Êliphêlet, đĭ-đăng tơsĭn 'nu.

English: These were all the sons of David, besides the sons of the concubines, and Tamar their sister.
Bahnar: 'Noh dôm lu kon drŏ-nglo Đawit tam mă jô̆ lu kon drŏ-nglo akăn kơ 'nhŏng sư; păng Tamar oh drŏ-kăn lu sư.

English: Solomon’s son was Rehoboam; Abijah was his son, Asa his son, Jehoshaphat his son
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Sôlômôn noh Rêhôbôam; kon drŏ-nglo Rêhôbôam noh Abija, kon drŏ-nglo Abija noh Asa, kon drŏ-nglo Asa noh Jêhôsaphat

English: Joram his son, Ahaziah his son, Joash his son
Bahnar: kon drŏ-nglo Jêhôsaphat noh Jêhôram, kon drŏ-nglo Jêhôram noh Ahasia, kon drŏ-nglo Ahasia noh Jôas

English: Amaziah his son, Azariah his son, Jotham his son
Bahnar: kon drŏ-nglo Jôas noh Amasia, kon drŏ-nglo Amasia noh Asaria

English: Ahaz his son, Hezekiah his son, Manasseh his son
Bahnar: kon drŏ-nglo Asria noh Jôtham, kon drŏ-nglo Jôtham noh Ahas, kon drŏ-nglo Ahas noh Hesekia, kon drŏ-nglo Hesekia noh Manase

English: Amon his son, and Josiah his son.
Bahnar: kon drŏ-nglo Manase noh Ammôn, kon drŏ-nglo Ammôn noh Jôsia.

English: The sons of Josiah were Johanan the firstborn, the second Jehoiakim, the third Zedekiah, and the fourth Shallum.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Jôsia: Kon drŏ-nglo kơdră sư Jôhanan; kon mă 'bar noh Jêhôiakim, mă pêng noh Sêđekia, kon mă puăn noh Sallum.

English: The sons of Jehoiakim were Jeconiah his son and Zedekiah his son.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Jêhôiakim noh: Jêkônia, păng Sêđekia.

English: And the sons of Jeconiah were Assir, Shealtiel his son
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Jêkônia kơplah sư pơm bơnă tơ Babilôn, noh Salathiêl

English: and Malchiram, Pedaiah, Shenazzar, Jecamiah, Hoshama, and Nedabiah.
Bahnar: Malkiram, Phêđaia, Sênasar, Jêkamia, Hôsama păng Nêđabia.

English: The sons of Pedaiah were Zerubbabel and Shimei. The sons of Zerubbabel were Meshullam, Hananiah, Shelomith their sister
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Phêđaia noh: Sêrubabêl păng Simêi. Kon drŏ-nglo Sêrubabêl noh: Mêsulam păng Hanania; Sêlômit oh drŏ-kăn lu sư.

English: and Hashubah, Ohel, Berechiah, Hasadiah, and Jushab-Hesed—five in all.
Bahnar: Kŭm đei pơđăm 'nu kon drŏ-nglo dơ̆ng noh: Hasuba, Ôhêl, Bêrekia, Hasađia, Jusap Hêset.

English: The sons of Hananiah were Pelatiah and Jeshaiah, the sons of Rephaiah, the sons of Arnan, the sons of Obadiah, and the sons of Shechaniah.
Bahnar: Lu kon sâu Hanania noh: Phêlatia păng Jêsaia kư̆m đei lu kon drŏ-nglo Rêphaia, kon drŏ-nglo Arnan, kon drŏ-nglo Ôbađia, păng kon drŏ-nglo Sêkania.

English: The son of Shechaniah was Shemaiah. The sons of Shemaiah were Hattush, Igal, Bariah, Neariah, and Shaphat—six in all.
Bahnar: Kon sâu Sêkani noh: Sêmaia păng lu kon drŏ-nglo sư: Hattus, Igal, Baria, Nêaria păng Saphat, đĭ-đăng tơdrâu 'nu.

English: The sons of Neariah were Elioenai, Hezekiah, and Azrikam—three in all.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Nêaria noh: Êliôenai, Hiskia păng Asrikam, đĭ-đăng pêng 'nu.

English: The sons of Elioenai were Hodaviah, Eliashib, Pelaiah, Akkub, Johanan, Delaiah, and Anani—seven in all.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Êliôenai noh: Hôđawia, Êliasip, Phêlaia, Akup, Jôhanan, Đêlaia, păng Anani, đĭ-đăng tơpơh 'nu.

English: The sons of Judah were Perez, Hezron, Carmi, Hur, and Shobal.
Bahnar: Kon sâu Juđa noh: Phêrês, Hêsrôn, Karmi, Hur păng Sôbal.

English: And Reaiah the son of Shobal begot Jahath, and Jahath begot Ahumai and Lahad. These were the families of the Zorathites.
Bahnar: Rêaja, kon drŏ-nglo Sôbal pơjing Jahat; Jahat pơjing Ahumai păng Lahat. 'Noh boih lu kon pơlei Sôrathit.

English: These were the sons of the father of Etam: Jezreel, Ishma, and Idbash; and the name of their sister was Hazelelponi
Bahnar: 'Nâu kon drŏ-nglo Êtam: Jêsreel Isma păng Ibas; oh drŏ-kăn lu sư anăn Haselepôni

English: and Penuel was the father of Gedor, and Ezer was the father of Hushah. These were the sons of Hur, the firstborn of Ephrathah the father of Bethlehem.
Bahnar: đei dơ̆ng Penuel 'bă kơ Gêđôr, păng Êser 'bă kơ Husa. 'Noh boih, kon sâu Hur, kon drŏ-nglo kơdră Êphratha 'bă kơ Betlehem.

English: And Ashhur the father of Tekoa had two wives, Helah and Naarah.
Bahnar: Asur, 'bă kơ Têkôa, đei 'bar 'nu akăn Hêla păng Naara.

English: Naarah bore him Ahuzzam, Hepher, Temeni, and Haahashtari. These were the sons of Naarah.
Bahnar: Naara tơpŭ kơ Ahusam, Hêpher, Têmeni păng Ahachtari. Noh boih lu kon drŏ-nglo Naara.

English: The sons of Helah were Zereth, Zohar, and Ethnan
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Hêla noh: Sêret, Sôhar, Êtnan

English: and Koz begot Anub, Zobebah, and the families of Aharhel the son of Harum.
Bahnar: Kôs pơjing Anup, Hasôbêba păng adrĕch Aharhel, kon drŏ-nglo Harum.

English: Now Jabez was more honorable than his brothers, and his mother called his name Jabez, saying, “Because I bore him in pain.”
Bahnar: Jabes đe pơyom hloh 'biơ̆ kơ lu 'nhŏng oh sư; mĕ sư krao anăn Jabes sư khan: “Inh tơpŭ kơ sư noh pơmat.”

English: And Jabez called on the God of Israel saying, “Oh, that You would bless me indeed, and enlarge my territory, that Your hand would be with me, and that You would keep me from evil, that I may not cause pain!” So God granted him what he requested.
Bahnar: Jabes krao apinh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Isơrael khan: “Ơ Kră Yang apinh Ih tuh ăn kơ inh pŭn hiôk pơih ăn hơdral teh đak inh mă să! Apinh ti mơsêh Ih oei hơdai inh, wei-lăng inh klaih đơ̆ng tơdrong răm pơmat-tat” Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn hloi thoi tơdrong sư krao apinh.

English: Chelub the brother of Shuhah begot Mehir, who was the father of Eshton.
Bahnar: Kêlup, oh kơ Suha, 'bă kơ Mêhir, Mêhir 'bă kơ Êstôn.

English: And Eshton begot Beth-Rapha, Paseah, and Tehinnah the father of Ir-Nahash. These were the men of Rechah.
Bahnar: Êstôn pơjing Bet Rapha, Phasêa păng Têhina, 'bă kơ Irnahas. 'Noh boih lu bơngai Rêka.

English: The sons of Kenaz were Othniel and Seraiah. The sons of Othniel were Hathath
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Kênas: Ôtniêl păng Sêraja. Kon drŏ-nglo Ôtniêl: Hathat păng Mêônôthai.

English: and Meonothai who begot Ophrah. Seraiah begot Joab the father of Ge Harashim, for they were craftsmen.
Bahnar: Mêônôthai pơjing Ophra. Sêraja pơjing Jôap, 'bă kơ Gê Harasim. Đe krao lu sư thoi noh yua kơ lu sư bơngai jang păng ti gơh hơgei.

English: The sons of Caleb the son of Jephunneh were Iru, Elah, and Naam. The son of Elah was Kenaz.
Bahnar: Lu kon drŏ-nglo Kalep kon drŏ-nglo Jêphunê noh: Iru, Êlah, păng Naam. Kon drŏ-nglo Êlah noh: Kênas.

English: The sons of Jehallelel were Ziph, Ziphah, Tiria, and Asarel.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Jêhalêlel noh: Sip, Sipha, Tiria păng Asarel.

English: The sons of Ezrah were Jether, Mered, Epher, and Jalon. And Mered’s wife bore Miriam, Shammai, and Ishbah the father of Eshtemoa.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Esra noh: Jêther, Mêret, Epher păng Jalôn. Akăn Mêret tơpŭ kơ Miriam, Sammai, păng Isba 'bă kơ Êthemôa.

English: (His wife Jehudijah bore Jered the father of Gedor, Heber the father of Sochoh, and Jekuthiel the father of Zanoah.) And these were the sons of Bithiah the daughter of Pharaoh, whom Mered took.
Bahnar: Akăn sư bơngai Juđa tơpŭ kơ Jêret, 'bă kơ Gêđôr, Hêber, 'bă kơ Sôkô păng Jêkuthiêl 'bă kơ Sanôa. 'Noh boih kon Bithia, kon drŏ-kăn Pharaôn, mă Mêret iŏk pơm akăn.

English: The sons of Hodiah’s wife, the sister of Naham, were the fathers of Keilah the Garmite and of Eshtemoa the Maachathite.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo akăn Hôđia, oh drŏ-kăn Naham, pơjing 'bă kơ Kêila bơngai Garmit, păng Êthemôa, bơngai Maakathit.

English: And the sons of Shimon were Amnon, Rinnah, Ben-Hanan, and Tilon. And the sons of Ishi were Zoheth and Ben-Zoheth.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Simôn noh: Amnôn, Rinna, Bên Hanan păng Tilôn. Lu kon sâu Isi noh: Sôhêt păng Bên Sôhêt.

English: The sons of Shelah the son of Judah were Er the father of Lecah, Laadah the father of Mareshah, and the families of the house of the linen workers of the house of Ashbea
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Sêla, kon drŏ-nglo Juđa noh: Er, 'bă kơ Lêka, Laađa, 'bă kơ Marêsa păng lu adrĕch adrung lu bơngai tanh brai tơ pơlei Bêt Asbêa

English: also Jokim, the men of Chozeba, and Joash; Saraph, who ruled in Moab, and Jashubi-Lehem. Now the records are ancient.
Bahnar: Jôkim lu bơngai pơlei Kôsêba, Jôas păng Sarap, bơngai pơgơ̆r dêh Môap hăm Jasubi Lêhem. 'Noh lu anăn đe chih sơ̆.

English: These were the potters and those who dwell at Netaim and Gederah; there they dwelt with the king for his work.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai 'nâu gơh man ge gŏ, oei 'bơ̆t pơlei Nêtaim păng pơlei Gêđêra; lu sư oei tơ noh bơ̆jang kơ pơtao.

English: The sons of Simeon were Nemuel, Jamin, Jarib, Zerah, and Shaul
Bahnar: Kon sâu Simêôn noh: Nêmuel, Jamin, Jarip, Sêra păng Saul

English: Shallum his son, Mibsam his son, and Mishma his son.
Bahnar: Sallum kon drŏ-nglo Saul, Mipsam kon drŏ-nglo Sallum, păng Misma kon drŏ-nglo Mipsam.

English: And the sons of Mishma were Hamuel his son, Zacchur his son, and Shimei his son.
Bahnar: Kon sâu Misma noh: Hammuel, kon drŏ-nglo Hammuel noh Sakur, kon drŏ-nglo Sakur noh Simêi.

English: Shimei had sixteen sons and six daughters; but his brothers did not have many children, nor did any of their families multiply as much as the children of Judah.
Bahnar: Na Simêi đei mơjĭt-tơdrâu 'nu kon drŏ-nglo păng tơdrâu 'nu kon drŏ-kăn; mă-lei 'nhŏng oh lu sư ưh kơ đei kon hơ'lơ̆p lơ thoi adrĕch bơngai Juđa

English: They dwelt at Beersheba, Moladah, Hazar Shual
Bahnar: Lu sư oei tơ pơlei Bêrsêba, pơlei Molađa pơlei Hasar Sual

English: Bilhah, Ezem, Tolad
Bahnar: pơlei Bila, pơlei Esem, păng pơlei Tôlat

English: Bethuel, Hormah, Ziklag
Bahnar: pơlei Bêthuêl, Horma, Siklak

English: Beth Marcaboth, Hazar Susim, Beth Biri, and at Shaaraim. These were their cities until the reign of David.
Bahnar: pơlei Bêt Makabôt, Hasar Susim, Bêt Biri păng pơlei Saaraim. 'Noh boih pơlei lu sư oei truh tơ chăl pơtao Đawit pơgơ̆r.

English: And their villages were Etam, Ain, Rimmon, Tochen, and Ashan—five cities
Bahnar: Đei pơđăm tŏ pơlei iĕ jum dăr noh pơlei Êtam, Ain, Rimmôn, Tôken, păng Asan

English: and all the villages that were around these cities as far as Baal. These were their dwelling places, and they maintained their genealogy
Bahnar: Đei lu pơlei iĕ oei tăp dăr kơ pơlei tih 'nâu truh tơ Baal noh boih anih lu sư oei păng lu sư đei chih răk đĭ adrĕch adrung lu sư

English: Meshobab, Jamlech, and Joshah the son of Amaziah
Bahnar: Mêsôbap, Jamlek, Jôsa, kon drŏ-nglo Amasia

English: Joel, and Jehu the son of Joshibiah, the son of Seraiah, the son of Asiel
Bahnar: Jôel, Jêhu, noh kon drŏ-nglo Jôsibia, sâu Sêraia, sâu i Asiêl

English: Elioenai, Jaakobah, Jeshohaiah, Asaiah, Adiel, Jesimiel, and Benaiah
Bahnar: Êliôenai, Jakôba, Jêsôhaia, Asaia, Ađiêl, Jêsimiel Bênaia

English: Ziza the son of Shiphi, the son of Allon, the son of Jedaiah, the son of Shimri, the son of Shemaiah
Bahnar: păng Sisa, kon drŏ-nglo Siphi, sâu Alôn sâu i Jêđaia, sâu ach Simri, kon drŏ-nglo Sêmaia.

English: these mentioned by name were leaders in their families, and their father’s house increased greatly.
Bahnar: Dôm lu bơngai đei anăn 'nâu jơ̆ lu bơngai chĕp kơ̆l pơgơ̆r lăm adrĕch lu sư kơdih; adrĕch adrung lu sư rai tŏk kơdrơ̆m lơlang lơlap.

English: So they went to the entrance of Gedor, as far as the east side of the valley, to seek pasture for their flocks.
Bahnar: Lu sư năm tơ tơring Gêđôr, truh tơ gah hơlĕch kơ thŭng dơnă, wă chă tơmăn 'nhĕt ăn kơ sem dơrong lu sư.

English: And they found rich, good pasture, and the land was broad, quiet, and peaceful; for some Hamites formerly lived there.
Bahnar: Lu sư chă 'bôh hloi tơmăn 'nhĕt bluh 'lơ̆ng na teh kư̆m să rơhơi, chơngue, hiôk-hian; adrol kơ noh adrĕch adrung Cham oei tơ noh.

English: These recorded by name came in the days of Hezekiah king of Judah; and they attacked their tents and the Meunites who were found there, and utterly destroyed them, as it is to this day. So they dwelt in their place, because there was pasture for their flocks there.
Bahnar: Dôm lu bơngai đei anăn kơpal 'nâu, lăm chăl Hesekia; pơtao đe Juđa, lu sư blah lu bơngai Hamit hăm lu bơngai Meunit oei tơ noh, lu sư blah pơrăm tơgar iŏk đĭ teh păng oei hloi truh tơ dang ei; yua kơ tơ noh đei tơmăn 'nhĕt wă wei rong lu sem dơrong lu sư.

English: Now some of them, five hundred men of the sons of Simeon, went to Mount Seir, having as their captains Pelatiah, Neariah, Rephaiah, and Uzziel, the sons of Ishi.
Bahnar: Lăm adrĕch Simêôn đei pơđăm-hrĕng 'nu bơngai năm truh tơ tơring Kông Sêir; lu bơngai pơgơ̆r lu sư noh Phêlatia, Nêaria, Rêphaia păng Usiêl; 'noh lu kon drŏ-nglo Isi.

English: And they defeated the rest of the Amalekites who had escaped. They have dwelt there to this day.
Bahnar: Lu sư blah pơlôch bơngai Amalek mă oei đei klaih, na lu sư oei tơ noh hloi truh tơ dang ei.

English: Now the sons of Reuben the firstborn of Israel—he was indeed the firstborn, but because he defiled his father’s bed, his birthright was given to the sons of Joseph, the son of Israel, so that the genealogy is not listed according to the birthright
Bahnar: Rubên, kon drŏ-nglo kơdră Isơrael, yua kơ sư pơm pơ'mê̆ kơ giơng 'bă sư kơdih na krao kon kơdră noh, jing pơjao ăn kơ lu kon drŏ-nglo Jôsep, kon drŏ-nglo Isơrael; yua kơ noh lăm adrĕch adrung ưh kơ đei chih răk anăn sư kon kơdră.

English: yet Judah prevailed over his brothers, and from him came a ruler, although the birthright was Joseph’s
Bahnar: Mă Juđa pran kơtang hloh kơ lu 'nhŏng oh sư păng đơ̆ng sư na đei pơtao pơgơ̆r; mă-lei jing kon kơdră noh tơ Jôsep.

English: the sons of Reuben the firstborn of Israel were Hanoch, Pallu, Hezron, and Carmi.
Bahnar: 'Nâu lu kon drŏ-nglo Rubên, kon kơdră drŏ-nglo Isơrael: Hanok, Palu, Hêsrôn păng Karmi.

English: The sons of Joel were Shemaiah his son, Gog his son, Shimei his son
Bahnar: Kon sâu Jôel: Kon drŏ-nglo Jôel noh: Sêmaia. Kon drŏ-nglo Sêmaia noh: Got. Kon drŏ-nglo Got noh: Simêi.

English: Micah his son, Reaiah his son, Baal his son
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Simêi noh: Mika. Kon drŏ-nglo Mika noh: Rêaia. Kon drŏ-nglo Rêaia noh: Baal.

English: and Beerah his son, whom Tiglath-Pileser king of Assyria carried into captivity. He was leader of the Reubenites.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Baal noh: Beerah, bơngai mă Tiglat Pileser pơtao dêh Asiri rôp pơm bơnă; Beerah bơngai pơgơ̆r lăm adrĕch Rubên.

English: And his brethren by their families, when the genealogy of their generations was registered: the chief, Jeiel, and Zechariah
Bahnar: 'Nhŏng oh kiơ̆ kơ adrĕch sư đe chih jô̆ lăm sơ̆p hla bơar adrĕch adrung: Noh Jêiêl bơngai pơgơ̆r, Sachari

English: and Bela the son of Azaz, the son of Shema, the son of Joel, who dwelt in Aroer, as far as Nebo and Baal Meon.
Bahnar: păng Bêla kon drŏ-nglo Asa, sâu Sêma, sâu i Jôel. Lu sư oei đơ̆ng pơlei Arôe truh tơ Nêbô păng Baal Mêôn

English: Eastward they settled as far as the entrance of the wilderness this side of the River Euphrates, because their cattle had multiplied in the land of Gilead.
Bahnar: Gah hơlĕch sư oei tơ char glă mă să truh tơ đak Krong Ơphrat, yua kơ khŭl sem dơrong lu sư chek hrôh rai lơlap lơlang lăm dêh Gileat.

English: Now in the days of Saul they made war with the Hagrites, who fell by their hand; and they dwelt in their tents throughout the entire area east of Gilead.
Bahnar: Lăm jơhnơr pơtao Sôl, lu sư tơblah hăm kon pơlei Hagrit jei lu sư păng oei hloi lăm jơ̆p kơ tơring gah hơlĕch dêh Gileat.

English: And the children of Gad dwelt next to them in the land of Bashan as far as Salcah
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Gat oei tơklă jê̆ lu sư lăm dêh Basan truh tơ Salêka.

English: Joel was the chief, Shapham the next, then Jaanai and Shaphat in Bashan
Bahnar: Jôel bơngai yŏng kơdră, Sapham bơngai jang đơ̆ng rŏng kơ sư đơ̆ng noh Janai păng Saphat pơgơ̆r lăm char Basan.

English: and their brethren of their father’s house: Michael, Meshullam, Sheba, Jorai, Jachan, Zia, and Eber—seven in all.
Bahnar: 'Nhŏng oh kiơ̆ kơtum kơtŏng adrĕch lu sư, đei tơpơh 'nu: Mikael, Mêsulam, Sêba, Jôrai, Jakan, Siê păng Eber.

English: These were the children of Abihail the son of Huri, the son of Jaroah, the son of Gilead, the son of Michael, the son of Jeshishai, the son of Jahdo, the son of Buz
Bahnar: 'Noh boih lu kon drŏ-nglo Abihai, Abihai kon drŏ-nglo Huri, Huri kon drŏ-nglo Jarôa, Jarôa kon drŏ-nglo Gileat, Gileat kon drŏ-nglo Mikael, Mikael kon drŏ-nglo Jêsisai, Jêsisai kon drŏ-nglo Jađô, Jađô kon drŏ-nglo Bus.

English: Ahi the son of Abdiel, the son of Guni, was chief of their father’s house.
Bahnar: Ahi kon drŏ-nglo Apđiel, Apđiel kon drŏ-nglo Guni; Ahi bơngai yŏng kơdră lăm adrĕch lu sư

English: And the Gadites dwelt in Gilead, in Bashan and in its villages, and in all the common-lands of Sharon within their borders.
Bahnar: Lu sư oei lăm char Gileat, lăm char Basan, dêh lu pơlei iĕ; kư̆m oei lăm tơmăn 'nhĕt thŭng Sarôn truh kơ hơdral dêh char lu sư.

English: All these were registered by genealogies in the days of Jotham king of Judah, and in the days of Jeroboam king of Israel.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai 'nâu đei chih tơmơ̆t boih lăm sơ̆p hla bơar adrĕch adrung chăl Jôtham pơm pơtao dêh char Juđa păng lăm chăl Jêrôbôam pơm pơtao dêh char Isơrael.

English: The sons of Reuben, the Gadites, and half the tribe of Manasseh had forty-four thousand seven hundred and sixty valiant men, men able to bear shield and sword, to shoot with the bow, and skillful in war, who went to war.
Bahnar: Lăm kon sâu Rubên, Gat păng minh puăt adrĕch Manase, lu bơngai pran kơtang, gơh hơgei chĕp khêl đao, hră păng juăt tơblah hơgei; puăn-jĭt puăn-rơbâu tơpơh-hrĕng tơdrâu-jĭt 'nu bơngai hơmet boih wă tơblah.

English: They made war with the Hagrites, Jetur, Naphish, and Nodab.
Bahnar: Lu sư tơblah hăm kon pơlei Hagrit, kon pơlei Jêtur, kon pơlei Naphis, păng kon pơlei Nôđap.

English: And they were helped against them, and the Hagrites were delivered into their hand, and all who were with them, for they cried out to God in the battle. He heeded their prayer, because they put their trust in Him.
Bahnar: Lăm kơplah tơblah băl, lu sư krao apinh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, na Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei tơgŭm lu sư tơblah hăm kon pơlei Hagrit păng đĭ-đăng lu bơngai kiơ̆ sư jei lu sư yua kơ lu sư đei jơhngơ̆m đon lui gơnang kơ Kră Yang.

English: Then they took away their livestock—fifty thousand of their camels, two hundred and fifty thousand of their sheep, and two thousand of their donkeys—also one hundred thousand of their men
Bahnar: Lu sư đei rôp iŏk khŭl sem dơrong lu kon pơlei Hagrit, pơđăm-jĭt rơbâu aseh lăk-đa, 'bar-hrĕng pơđăm-jĭt rơbâu triu, 'bar-rơbâu aseh iĕ păng hăm minh-hrĕng rơbâu 'nu bơngai.

English: for many fell dead, because the war was God’s. And they dwelt in their place until the captivity.
Bahnar: Kŭm đei lơ bơngai lôch, yua kơ đei Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei wang tơblah lăm năr tơblah băl 'nâu. Lu sư oei tơ noh hloi dĭng truh tơ đe rôp chông ba năm pơm bơnă.

English: So the children of the half-tribe of Manasseh dwelt in the land. Their numbers increased from Bashan to Baal Hermon, that is, to Senir, or Mount Hermon.
Bahnar: Đei minh puăt bơngai Manase oei lăm dêh char noh lơ tơpă iŏk đơ̆ng dêh Basan truh tơ Baal Hermôn, tơ Sênir păng Kông Hermôn.

English: These were the heads of their fathers’ houses: Epher, Ishi, Eliel, Azriel, Jeremiah, Hodaviah, and Jahdiel. They were mighty men of valor, famous men, and heads of their fathers’ houses.
Bahnar: 'Nâu boih lu bơngai yŏng pơgơ̆r lăm adrĕch adrung lu sư: Êpher, Isi, Êliel, Asriel, Jêrêmi, Hôđawia păng Jahdiêl. Lu sư bơngai yŏng kơdră lăm adrĕch lu sư, lu sư bơngai nuih kơtang đe ư-ang.

English: And they were unfaithful to the God of their fathers, and played the harlot after the gods of the peoples of the land, whom God had destroyed before them.
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu sư pơm yoch hăm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei 'bok lu sư, lu sư kiơ̆ lu rup yang lu bơngai dêh char noh, mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei đei pơrăm lê̆ boih 'bơ̆t anăp lu sư.

English: So the God of Israel stirred up the spirit of Pul king of Assyria, that is, Tiglath-Pileser king of Assyria. He carried the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh into captivity. He took them to Halah, Habor, Hara, and the river of Gozan to this day.
Bahnar: Na Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Isơrael, pơtrŭt jơhngơ̆m Pul, pơtao dêh char Asiri păng Tiglat Phileser pơtao dêh char Asiri, rôp lu kon pơlei bơngai Rubên, bơngai Gat păng minh puăt bơngai Manase anhăk ba lu sư tơ pơlei Hala, Habôr, Hara, păng tơ tơring đak Krong Gôsan, dĭng truh tơ dang ei.

English: The sons of Levi were Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.
Bahnar: Adrĕch adrung Lêwi kon drŏ-nglo Lêwi noh: Gersôm, Kôhat păng Mêrari.

English: The sons of Kohath were Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Kôhat noh: Amram, Ishar, Hêbrôn păng Usiel.

English: The children of Amram were Aaron, Moses, and Miriam. And the sons of Aaron were Nadab, Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Amram noh: Arôn, Môis păng Miriam. Kon drŏ-nglo Arôn: Nađap, Abihu, Êlêasar păng Ithamar.

English: Eleazar begot Phinehas, and Phinehas begot Abishua
Bahnar: Êlêasar pơjing Phinêhas; Phinêhas pơjing Abisua

English: Abishua begot Bukki, and Bukki begot Uzzi
Bahnar: Abisua pơjing Buki, Buki pơjing Usi

English: Uzzi begot Zerahiah, and Zerahiah begot Meraioth
Bahnar: Usi pơjing Sêrahia; Sêrahia pơjing Mêraiôt

English: Meraioth begot Amariah, and Amariah begot Ahitub
Bahnar: Mêraiôt pơjing Amaria, Amaria pơjing Ahitup

English: Ahitub begot Zadok, and Zadok begot Ahimaaz
Bahnar: Ahitup pơjing Sađôk; Sađôk pơjing Ahimaas.

English: Ahimaaz begot Azariah, and Azariah begot Johanan
Bahnar: Ahimaas pơjing Asaria; Asaria pơjing Jôhanan

English: Johanan begot Azariah (it was he who ministered as priest in the temple that Solomon built in Jerusalem)
Bahnar: Jôhanan pơjing Asaria, bơngai mă pơm 'bok soi lăm hnam akŭm Sôlômôn man tơ pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: Azariah begot Amariah, and Amariah begot Ahitub
Bahnar: Asaria pơjing Amaria; Amaria pơjing Ahitup

English: Ahitub begot Zadok, and Zadok begot Shallum
Bahnar: Ahitup pơjing Sađôk, Sađôk pơjing Sallum

English: Shallum begot Hilkiah, and Hilkiah begot Azariah
Bahnar: Sallum pơjing Hilkia, Hilkia pơjing Asaria

English: Azariah begot Seraiah, and Seraiah begot Jehozadak.
Bahnar: Asaria pơjing Sêraia păng Sêraia pơjing Jêhôsađak

English: Jehozadak went into captivity when the LORD carried Judah and Jerusalem into captivity by the hand of Nebuchadnezzar.
Bahnar: Jêhôsađak đe rôp pơm đĭch đam kơplah Kră Yang ăn kon pơlei Juđa păng Jêrusalem lăm ti Nebukatnessar.

English: The sons of Levi were Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Lêwi noh: Gersôm, Kôhat, păng Mêrari.

English: These are the names of the sons of Gershon: Libni and Shimei.
Bahnar: 'Nâu anăn lu kon drŏ-nglo Gersôm: Lipni păng Simêi.

English: The sons of Kohath were Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Kôhat noh: Amram, Ishar, Hêbrôn, păng Usiel.

English: The sons of Merari were Mahli and Mushi. Now these are the families of the Levites according to their fathers
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Mêrari noh: Mali păng Musi. 'Noh boih lu adrĕch bơngai Lêwi kiơ̆ kơ adrĕch 'bă sư.

English: Of Gershon were Libni his son, Jahath his son, Zimmah his son
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Gersôm noh: Lipni kon drŏ-nglo Lipni noh: Jahat; kon drŏ-nglo Jahat noh: Simma, kon drŏ-nglo Simma noh: Jôa

English: Joah his son, Iddo his son, Zerah his son, and Jeatherai his son.
Bahnar: kon drŏ-nglo Jôa noh: Iđô, kon drŏ-nglo Iđô noh: Sêra, kon drŏ-nglo Sêra noh: Jêatherai.

English: The sons of Kohath were Amminadab his son, Korah his son, Assir his son
Bahnar: Kon sâu Kôhat noh: Aminađap: Kon drŏ-nglo Aminađap noh: Kôra. Kon drŏ-nglo Kôra noh: Assir. Kon drŏ-nglo Assir noh: Êlkana.

English: Elkanah his son, Ebiasaph his son, Assir his son
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Êlkana noh: Êbiasap. Kon drŏ-nglo Êbiasap noh: Assir.

English: Tahath his son, Uriel his son, Uzziah his son, and Shaul his son.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Assir noh: Tahat. Kon drŏ-nglo Tahat noh: Uriel. Kon drŏ-nglo Uriel noh: Usia. Kon drŏ-nglo Usia noh: Saul.

English: The sons of Elkanah were Amasai and Ahimoth.
Bahnar: Kon sâu Êlkana noh: Amasai păng Ahimôt.

English: As for Elkanah, the sons of Elkanah were Zophai his son, Nahath his son
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Êlkana noh: Sôphai. Kon drŏ-nglo Sôphai noh: Nahat.

English: Eliab his son, Jeroham his son, and Elkanah his son.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Nahat noh: Êliap. Kon drŏ-nglo Êliap noh: Jêrôham. Kon drŏ-nglo Jêrôham noh: Êlkana. Kon drŏ-nglo Êlkana noh: Samuel.

English: The sons of Samuel were Joel the firstborn, and Abijah the second.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Samuel: Kon drŏ-nglo kơdră sư Jôel, kon mă 'bar sư Abija.

English: The sons of Merari were Mahli, Libni his son, Shimei his son, Uzzah his son
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Mêrari noh: Mahli. Kon drŏ-nglo Mahli noh: Lipni. Kon drŏ-nglo Lipni noh: Simêi. Kon drŏ-nglo Simêi noh: Usa.

English: Shimea his son, Haggiah his son, and Asaiah his son.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Usa noh: Simêi. Kon drŏ-nglo Simêi noh: Hagia. Kon drŏ-nglo Hagia noh: Asaia.

English: Now these are the men whom David appointed over the service of song in the house of the LORD, after the ark came to rest.
Bahnar: 'Nâu lu khŭl bơngai hơri mă pơtao Đawit đei pôk dan wă hơri bơnê lăm hnam akŭm Kră Yang đơ̆ng rŏng kơ hom pơgơ̆p đe dan lăm noh.

English: They were ministering with music before the dwelling place of the tabernacle of meeting, until Solomon had built the house of the LORD in Jerusalem, and they served in their office according to their order.
Bahnar: Lu sư bơ̆jang hơri bơnê 'bơ̆t anăp anih akŭm dĭng truh tơ pơtao Sôlômôn man keh, hnam akŭm kơkuh Kră Yang tơ Jêrusalem: Rim 'nu kơ lu sư bơ̆jang kiơ̆ tơdrong jang mă đei pơjao.

English: And these are the ones who ministered with their sons: Of the sons of the Kohathites were Heman the singer, the son of Joel, the son of Samuel
Bahnar: 'Nâu lu bơngai bơ̆jang hơdai hăm kon drŏ-nglo lu sư: Lăm kon sâu Kôhat: Đei Hêman bơngai gơh hơri, kon drŏ-nglo Jôel, Jôel kon drŏ-nglo Samuel

English: the son of Elkanah, the son of Jeroham, the son of Eliel, the son of Toah
Bahnar: Samuel kon drŏ-nglo Êlkana, Êlkana kon drŏ-nglo Jêrôham, Jêrôham kon drŏ-nglo Êliel, Êliel kon drŏ-nglo Tôa

English: the son of Zuph, the son of Elkanah, the son of Mahath, the son of Amasai
Bahnar: Tôa kon drŏ-nglo Suphơ, Suphơ kon drŏ-nglo Êlkana, Êlkana kon drŏ-nglo Mahat, Mahat kon drŏ-nglo Amasai

English: the son of Elkanah, the son of Joel, the son of Azariah, the son of Zephaniah
Bahnar: Amasai kon drŏ-nglo Êlkana, Êlkana kon drŏ-nglo Jôel, Jôel kon drŏ-nglo Asaria, Asaria kon drŏ-nglo Sephania

English: the son of Tahath, the son of Assir, the son of Ebiasaph, the son of Korah
Bahnar: Sephania kon drŏ-nglo Tahat, Tahat kon drŏ-nglo Assir, Assir kon drŏ-nglo Êbiasap, Êbiasap kon drŏ-nglo Kôra

English: the son of Izhar, the son of Kohath, the son of Levi, the son of Israel.
Bahnar: Kôra kon drŏ-nglo Ishar, Ishar kon drŏ-nglo Kôhat, Kôhat kon drŏ-nglo Lêwi, Lêwi kon drŏ-nglo Isơrael.

English: And his brother Asaph, who stood at his right hand, was Asaph the son of Berachiah, the son of Shimea
Bahnar: Asap, 'nhŏng oh Hêman, bơ̆jang gah 'ma kơ sư. Asap kon drŏ-nglo Bêrekia, Bêrekia kon drŏ-nglo Simêa

English: the son of Michael, the son of Baaseiah, the son of Malchijah
Bahnar: Simêa kon drŏ-nglo Mikael, Mikael kon drŏ-nglo Baseria, Baseria kon drŏ-nglo Malkija.

English: the son of Ethni, the son of Zerah, the son of Adaiah
Bahnar: Malkija kon drŏ-nglo Etni, Etni kon drŏ-nglo Sêra, Sêra kon drŏ-nglo Ađaia

English: the son of Ethan, the son of Zimmah, the son of Shimei
Bahnar: Ađaia kon drŏ-nglo Êthan, Êthan kon drŏ-nglo Simma, Simma kon drŏ-nglo Simêi

English: the son of Jahath, the son of Gershon, the son of Levi.
Bahnar: Simêi kon drŏ-nglo Jahat, Jahat kon drŏ-nglo Gersôm, Gersôm kon drŏ-nglo Lêwi.

English: Their brethren, the sons of Merari, on the left hand, were Ethan the son of Kishi, the son of Abdi, the son of Malluch
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng lu kon sâu Mêrari, 'nhŏng oh lu sư, bơ̆jang gah 'ngiĕo kơ sư noh: Êthan kon drŏ-nglo Kisi, Kisi kon drŏ-nglo Apđi, Apđi kon drŏ-nglo Maluk

English: the son of Hashabiah, the son of Amaziah, the son of Hilkiah
Bahnar: Maluk kon drŏ-nglo Hasabia, Hasabia kon drŏ-nglo Amasia, Amasia kon drŏ-nglo Hilkia

English: the son of Amzi, the son of Bani, the son of Shamer
Bahnar: Hilkia kon drŏ-nglo Amsi, Amsi kon drŏ-nglo Bani, Bani kon drŏ-nglo Sêmer

English: the son of Mahli, the son of Mushi, the son of Merari, the son of Levi.
Bahnar: Sêmer kon drŏ-nglo Mahli, Mahli kon drŏ-nglo Musi, Musi kon drŏ-nglo Mêrari, Mêrari kon drŏ-nglo Lêwi.

English: And their brethren, the Levites, were appointed to every kind of service of the tabernacle of the house of God.
Bahnar: Lu 'nhŏng oh sư nai bơngai Lêwi, bơ̆jang tơdrong jang lăm anih akŭm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: But Aaron and his sons offered sacrifices on the altar of burnt offering and on the altar of incense, for all the work of the Most Holy Place, and to make atonement for Israel, according to all that Moses the servant of God had commanded.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Arôn păng lu kon sâu sư pơyơ̆r tơmam soi 'buh tơ kơpal chơnang soi, dah tơ kơpal chơnang soh pơgang 'bâu phu, jang tơdrong jang tơ lăm Anih Rơgoh, pơyơ̆r tơmam soi huai đơ̆ng yoch ăn kơ bơngai Isơrael, kiơ̆ thoi tơdrong Môis đĭch đam Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei đei bơtho pơkă.

English: Now these are the sons of Aaron: Eleazar his son, Phinehas his son, Abishua his son
Bahnar: 'Nâu adrĕch adrung Arôn: Êlêasar kon drŏ-nglo Arôn, Phinêhas kon drŏ-nglo Êlêasar, Abisua kon drŏ-nglo Phinêhas

English: Bukki his son, Uzzi his son, Zerahiah his son
Bahnar: Buki kon drŏ-nglo Abisua, Usi kon drŏ-nglo Buki, Sêrahia kon drŏ-nglo Usi

English: Meraioth his son, Amariah his son, Ahitub his son
Bahnar: Mêraiôt kon drŏ-nglo Sêrahia, Amaria kon drŏ-nglo Mêraiôt, Ahitup kon drŏ-nglo Amaria

English: Zadok his son, and Ahimaaz his son.
Bahnar: Sađôk kon drŏ-nglo Ahitup, Ahimaas kon drŏ-nglo Sađôk.

English: Now these are their dwelling places throughout their settlements in their territory, for they were given by lot to the sons of Aaron, of the family of the Kohathites
Bahnar: 'Nâu tơring teh đak kon sâu Arôn oei, kiơ̆ kơ adrĕch Kôhat đei hlang lăng trŏ kơ lu sư.

English: They gave them Hebron in the land of Judah, with its surrounding common-lands.
Bahnar: Pơjao ăn kơ lu sư pơlei Hêbrôn tơ lăm dêh Juđa păng tơ'măn 'nhĕt jum dăr.

English: But the fields of the city and its villages they gave to Caleb the son of Jephunneh.
Bahnar: Mă-lei teh mir na jum dăr pơlei Hêbrôn păng lu pơlei iĕ 'noh pơjao ăn kơ Kalep kon drŏ-nglo Jêphunê.

English: And to the sons of Aaron they gave one of the cities of refuge, Hebron; also Libnah with its common-lands, Jattir, Eshtemoa with its common-lands
Bahnar: Na kon sâu Arôn đei ăn lu pơlei anih ôn kơ'nơp, 'noh pơlei Hêbrôn, Lipna, Jatir Êthemôa

English: Hilen with its common-lands, Debir with its common-lands
Bahnar: Hilen, Đêbir

English: Ashan with its common-lands, and Beth Shemesh with its common-lands.
Bahnar: Asan, Juta, Bêt Sêmes păng dơnih 'nhĕt lu sư.

English: And from the tribe of Benjamin: Geba with its common-lands, Alemeth with its common-lands, and Anathoth with its common-lands. All their cities among their families were thirteen.
Bahnar: Iŏk đơ̆ng adrĕch Bênjamin pơjao ăn kơ lu sư pơlei Gêba, Alêmet, Anahôt, păng dơnih 'nhĕt lu sư. Đĭ-đăng đei mơjĭt-pêng tŏ pơlei tih, ăn kiơ̆ kơ adrĕch adrung lu sư.

English: To the rest of the family of the tribe of the Kohathites they gave by lot ten cities from half the tribe of Manasseh.
Bahnar: Kon sâu Kôhat mă oei đei đơ̆ng rŏng hlang lăng đei mơjĭt tŏ pơlei đơ̆ng lăm minh puăt adrĕch Manase.

English: And to the sons of Gershon, throughout their families, they gave thirteen cities from the tribe of Issachar, from the tribe of Asher, from the tribe of Naphtali, and from the tribe of Manasseh in Bashan.
Bahnar: Kon sâu Gersôm, kiơ̆ kơ adrĕch lu sư đei mơjĭt-pêng tŏ pơlei đơ̆ng lăm adrĕch Isakar, Aser, Neptali, păng minh puăt đơ̆ng adrĕch Manase tơ tơring Basan.

English: To the sons of Merari, throughout their families, they gave twelve cities from the tribe of Reuben, from the tribe of Gad, and from the tribe of Zebulun.
Bahnar: Kon sâu Mêrari, kiơ̆ kơ adrĕch lu sư, dai hlang lăng đei mơjĭt-'bar tŏ pơlei, iŏk đơ̆ng adrĕch Rubên, adrĕch Gat păng adrĕch Sabulôn.

English: So the children of Israel gave these cities with their common-lands to the Levites.
Bahnar: Bơngai Isơrael asong ăn kơ bơngai Lêwi pơlei păng dơnih 'nhĕt teh lu sư

English: And they gave by lot from the tribe of the children of Judah, from the tribe of the children of Simeon, and from the tribe of the children of Benjamin these cities which are called by their names.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng bơngai Juđa bơngai Simêôn, păng bơngai Bênjamin, lu sư đei lu pơlei kơpal noh.

English: Now some of the families of the sons of Kohath were given cities as their territory from the tribe of Ephraim.
Bahnar: Mơ'nah lu bơngai Kôhat đei lu pơlei iŏk đơ̆ng lăm adrĕch Êphraim

English: And they gave them one of the cities of refuge, Shechem with its common-lands, in the mountains of Ephraim, also Gezer with its common-lands
Bahnar: Lu sư đei pơlei ôn kơ'nơp, 'noh Pơlei Sichem hăm dơnih 'nhĕt sư, tơ kơpal kông Êphraim, Geser hăm

English: Jokmeam with its common-lands, Beth Horon with its common-lands
Bahnar: Jôkmêam, Bêt Hôrôn.

English: Aijalon with its common-lands, and Gath Rimmon with its common-lands.
Bahnar: Aijalôn, Gat Rimmôn hăm dơnih 'nhĕt lu sư

English: And from the half-tribe of Manasseh: Aner with its common-lands and Bileam with its common-lands, for the rest of the family of the sons of Kohath.
Bahnar: păng đơ̆ng lăm minh puăt bơngai Manase đei asong pơlei Ane, Bilêam hăm dơnih 'nhĕt sư. Đe asong pơlei 'noh ăn kơ lu bơngai adrĕch Kôhat mă oei ưh tam mă đei.

English: From the family of the half-tribe of Manasseh the sons of Gershon were given Golan in Bashan with its common-lands and Ashtaroth with its common-lands.
Bahnar: Kon sâu Gersôm iŏk đơ̆ng minh puăt adrĕch Manase, pơlei Gôlan tơring Basan hăm dơnih 'nhĕt sư Astarôt hăm dơnih 'nhĕt sư

English: And from the tribe of Issachar: Kedesh with its common-lands, Daberath with its common-lands
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng adrĕch Isakar, lu sư đei pơlei Kêđes, Đabêrat

English: Ramoth with its common-lands, and Anem with its common-lands.
Bahnar: pơlei Ramôt, pơlei Anem hăm dơnih 'nhĕt lu sư

English: And from the tribe of Asher: Mashal with its common-lands, Abdon with its common-lands
Bahnar: đơ̆ng adrĕch Aser, lu sư đei Masal, Apđôn

English: Hukok with its common-lands, and Rehob with its common-lands.
Bahnar: Hukô, Rêhôp hăm dơnih 'nhĕt lu sư

English: And from the tribe of Naphtali: Kedesh in Galilee with its common-lands, Hammon with its common-lands, and Kirjathaim with its common-lands.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng adrĕch Naptali lu sư đei pơlei Kêđes lăm char Galilê, pơlei Hammôn păng pơlei Kiriathaim hăm dơnih 'nhĕt lu sư.

English: From the tribe of Zebulun the rest of the children of Merari were given Rimmon with its common-lands and Tabor with its common-lands.
Bahnar: Kon sâu Mêrari mă oei oei iŏk đơ̆ng adrĕch Sabulôn pơlei Rimônô hăm dơnih 'nhĕt sư; Thabô hăm dơnih 'nhĕt sư

English: And on the other side of the Jordan, across from Jericho, on the east side of the Jordan, they were given from the tribe of Reuben: Bezer in the wilderness with its common-lands, Jahzah with its common-lands
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng adrĕch Rubên paih to kơ đak Krong Jôrđăn gah hơlĕch, jê̆ Jêrikô pơlei Bêser lăm thŭng dơnă hăm dơnih 'nhĕt sư; pơlei Jasa hăm dơnih 'nhĕt sư.

English: Kedemoth with its common-lands, and Mephaath with its common-lands.
Bahnar: Kêđêmôt păng Mêphaat hăm dơnih 'nhĕt sư.

English: And from the tribe of Gad: Ramoth in Gilead with its common-lands, Mahanaim with its common-lands
Bahnar: Păng đơ̆ng adrĕch Gat, lu sư đei pơlei Ramôt lăm tơring Gileat, pơlei Mahanaim

English: Heshbon with its common-lands, and Jazer with its common-lands.
Bahnar: pơlei Hesbôn Jaser, hăm dơnih 'nhĕt sư.

English: The sons of Issachar were Tola, Puah, Jashub, and Shimron—four in all.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Isakar: Tôla, Pua, Jasup păng Simrôn, puăn 'nu.

English: The sons of Tola were Uzzi, Rephaiah, Jeriel, Jahmai, Jibsam, and Shemuel, heads of their father’s house. The sons of Tola were mighty men of valor in their generations; their number in the days of David was twenty-two thousand six hundred.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Tôla: Usi, Rêphaia, Jêriel, Jahmai, Ipsam păng Samuel, bơngai yŏng kơdră lăm adrĕch Tôla lu linh bơngai nuih kơtang lăm adrĕch adrung sư lăm chăl Đawit pơgơ̆r, jô̆ đĭ-đăng lu sư đei 'bar-jĭt 'bar-rơbâu tơdrâu-hrĕng 'nu.

English: The son of Uzzi was Izrahiah, and the sons of Izrahiah were Michael, Obadiah, Joel, and Ishiah. All five of them were chief men.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Usi noh Israhia: Kon drŏ-nglo Israhia noh: Mikael, Obađia, Jôel păng Isia, đĭ-đăng pơđăm 'nu, tă kơ pơm yŏng kơdră ngăl.

English: And with them, by their generations, according to their fathers’ houses, were thirty-six thousand troops ready for war; for they had many wives and sons.
Bahnar: Kiơ̆ kơ adrĕch 'bă lu sư đei pêng-jĭt tơdrâu-rơbâu 'nu linh tơblah, lu sư đei akăn lơ păng đei kon lơ.

English: Now their brethren among all the families of Issachar were mighty men of valor, listed by their genealogies, eighty-seven thousand in all.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai linh nuih kơtang lăm adrĕch Isakar, đĭ-đăng đei tơhngam-jĭt tơpơh-rơbâu 'nu.

English: The sons of Benjamin were Bela, Becher, and Jediael—three in all.
Bahnar: Pêng 'nu kon drŏ-nglo Bênjamin: Bêla, Bêker păng Jêđiael.

English: The sons of Bela were Ezbon, Uzzi, Uzziel, Jerimoth, and Iri—five in all. They were heads of their fathers’ houses, and they were listed by their genealogies, twenty-two thousand and thirty-four mighty men of valor.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Bêla: Êsbon, Usi, Usiel, Jêrimôt păng Iri, pơđăm 'nu; lu sư yŏng kơdră lăm adrĕch ngăl; jô̆ đĭ lu sư đei 'bar-jĭt 'bar-rơbâu pêng-jĭt puăn 'nu linh tơblah.

English: The sons of Becher were Zemirah, Joash, Eliezer, Elioenai, Omri, Jerimoth, Abijah, Anathoth, and Alemeth. All these are the sons of Becher.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Bêker: Sêmira, Jôas, Êliêser, Êliôenai, Ômri, Jêremôt, Abija, Anathôt păng Alêmet, dôm lu sư kon drŏ-nglo Bêker

English: And they were recorded by genealogy according to their generations, heads of their fathers’ houses, twenty thousand two hundred mighty men of valor.
Bahnar: Lu sư lu yŏng kơdră đei chih răk lăm adrĕch păng đei 'bar-jĭt rơbâu 'bar-hrĕng 'nu linh tơblah.

English: The son of Jediael was Bilhan, and the sons of Bilhan were Jeush, Benjamin, Ehud, Chenaanah, Zethan, Tharshish, and Ahishahar.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Jêđiael noh: Bilhan; Kon drŏ-nglo Bilhan: Jêus, Bênjamin, Êhut, Kênaana, Sêthan, Tarsis păng Ahisahar.

English: All these sons of Jediael were heads of their fathers’ houses; there were seventeen thousand two hundred mighty men of valor fit to go out for war and battle.
Bahnar: Dôm lu kon drŏ-nglo Jêđiael, tă yŏng kơdră lăm adrĕch, lu sư đei mơjĭt-tơpơh rơbâu 'bar-hrĕng 'nu, bơngai nuih gơh năm tơblah ngăl.

English: Shuppim and Huppim were the sons of Ir, and Hushim was the son of Aher.
Bahnar: Na đei dơ̆ng Suppit păng Hupim, kon sâu Ir; păng Husim kon sâu Aher.

English: The sons of Naphtali were Jahziel, Guni, Jezer, and Shallum, the sons of Bilhah.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Neptali: Jaseel, Guni, Jeser păng Silem, kon sâu yă Bila.

English: The descendants of Manasseh: his Syrian concubine bore him Machir the father of Gilead, the father of Asriel.
Bahnar: Kon sâu Manase noh: Asriel, kon akăn kơnhŏng Manase bơngai Aram sư tơpŭ kơ Makir 'bă kơ Gileat.

English: Machir took as his wife the sister of Huppim and Shuppim, whose name was Maachah. The name of Gilead’s grandson was Zelophehad, but Zelophehad begot only daughters.
Bahnar: Makir chă akăn oei kơ bơngai Hupim păng Suppit, oh drŏ-kăn sư anăn Maaka. Kon sâu anăn sư Sêlôphêhat; sư đei kon drŏ-kăn ngăl đĕch

English: (Maachah the wife of Machir bore a son, and she called his name Peresh. The name of his brother was Sheresh, and his sons were Ulam and Rakem.
Bahnar: Maaka akăn Makir sư tơpŭ đei minh 'nu kon drŏ-nglo, krao anăn sư Pêres; oh sư anăn Sêres, Sêres pơjing kơ kon drŏ-nglo noh Ulam păng Rakem.

English: The son of Ulam was Bedan.) These were the descendants of Gilead the son of Machir, the son of Manasseh.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Ulam noh: Bêđan. 'Noh boih kon drŏ-nglo Gileat, sâu Makir, sâu i Manase.

English: His sister Hammoleketh bore Ishhod, Abiezer, and Mahlah.
Bahnar: Oh drŏ-kăn Gileat, noh Hammôleket, pơjing Ishôt, Abiêser păng Mahla.

English: And the sons of Shemida were Ahian, Shechem, Likhi, and Aniam.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Sêmiđa noh: Ahian, Sichem, Likhi păng Aniam.

English: The sons of Ephraim were Shuthelah, Bered his son, Tahath his son, Eladah his son, Tahath his son
Bahnar: Kon sâu Êphraim: Suthela. Kon drŏ-nglo Suthela noh: Bêrê. Kon drŏ-nglo Bêrê noh: Tahat. Kon drŏ-nglo Tahat noh: Êlêađa. Kon drŏ-nglo Êlêađa noh: Tahat.

English: Zabad his son, Shuthelah his son, and Ezer and Elead. The men of Gath who were born in that land killed them because they came down to take away their cattle.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Tahat noh: Sabat. Kon drŏ-nglo Sabat noh: Suthêla, Êser păng Êleat; bre âu bơngai teh đak Gat pơlôch, yua kơ lu sư jur tơtông sem dơrong.

English: Then Ephraim their father mourned many days, and his brethren came to comfort him.
Bahnar: Êphraim 'bă lu sư, nhơ̆m hmoi đunh măng năr; đei 'nhŏng oh sư năm ngôi pơlung sư.

English: And when he went in to his wife, she conceived and bore a son; and he called his name Beriah, because tragedy had come upon his house.
Bahnar: Sư oei hơdai hăm akăn sư, akăn sư anăp tơpŭ kơ minh 'nu kon drŏ-nglo, krao anăn sư Bêria, yua kơ hnam dơnŏ sư đei tơdrong răm truh.

English: Now his daughter was Sheerah, who built Lower and Upper Beth Horon and Uzzen Sheerah
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-kăn sư anăn Sêera; sư man pơjing pơlei Bêt Hôrôn tơ kơpơ̆ng păng tơ gah ala, hăm pơlei Usên Sêera.

English: and Rephah was his son, as well as Resheph, and Telah his son, Tahan his son
Bahnar: Na sư tơpŭ dơ̆ng kơ Rêpha; Rêpha pơjing kơ Reslep păng Têla; Têla pơjing kơ Tahan

English: Laadan his son, Ammihud his son, Elishama his son
Bahnar: Tahan pơjing Lađan; Lađan pơjing Ammihut; Ammihut pơjing Êlisama

English: Nun his son, and Joshua his son.
Bahnar: Êlisama pơjing Nun; Nun pơjing Jôsuê.

English: Now their possessions and dwelling places were Bethel and its towns: to the east Naaran, to the west Gezer and its towns, and Shechem and its towns, as far as Ayyah and its towns
Bahnar: Teh jang păng anih lu sư oei noh tơ Bethel păng lu pơlei iĕ jum dăr; Gah hơlĕch đei pơlei Naaran păng gah bơmơ̆t đei pơlei Geser hăm lu pơlei iĕ, đei đơ̆ng Pơlei Sichem păng pơlei sư truh tơ pơlei Aya păng lu pơlei iĕ sư.

English: and by the borders of the children of Manasseh were Beth Shean and its towns, Taanach and its towns, Megiddo and its towns, Dor and its towns. In these dwelt the children of Joseph, the son of Israel.
Bahnar: Pơrok kiơ̆ kơ hơdral Manase đei pơlei Bêt Sêan păng lu pơlei iĕ sư, pơlei Tanak, pơlei Mêgiđô, pơlei Đôr păng lu pơlei iĕ lu sư. Kon sâu Jôsep, kon drŏ-nglo Isơrael oei tơ dôm pơlei 'nâu.

English: The sons of Asher were Imnah, Ishvah, Ishvi, Beriah, and their sister Serah.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Aser: Imna, Iswa, Iswi, Bêria păng Sêra oh drŏ-kăn lu sư.

English: The sons of Beriah were Heber and Malchiel, who was the father of Birzaith.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Bêria: Hêber păng Malkien; Malkien 'bă kơ Birsait.

English: And Heber begot Japhlet, Shomer, Hotham, and their sister Shua.
Bahnar: Hêber pơjing Japhlet, Sơmer, Hôtham păng Sua noh oh drŏ-kăn lu sư.

English: The sons of Japhlet were Pasach, Bimhal, and Ashvath. These were the children of Japhlet.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Japhlet noh: Pasak, Bimhal păng Aswat. 'Noh boih lu kon drŏ-nglo Japhlet.

English: The sons of Shemer were Ahi, Rohgah, Jehubbah, and Aram.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Sômer: Ahi, Rôhga, Jêhuba, păng Aram.

English: And the sons of his brother Helem were Zophah, Imna, Shelesh, and Amal.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Hêlem oh sư noh: Sôpha, Imna, Sêles păng Amal.

English: The sons of Zophah were Suah, Harnepher, Shual, Beri, Imrah
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Sôpha: Sua, Harnêpher, Sual, Bêri, Imra

English: Bezer, Hod, Shamma, Shilshah, Jithran, and Beera.
Bahnar: Bêser, Hôt, Samma, Silsa, Ithran păng Beera.

English: The sons of Jether were Jephunneh, Pispah, and Ara.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Jêther: Jêphunê, Phispa, păng Ara.

English: The sons of Ulla were Arah, Haniel, and Rizia.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Ula: Arah, Haniel păng Risia.

English: All these were the children of Asher, heads of their fathers’ houses, choice men, mighty men of valor, chief leaders. And they were recorded by genealogies among the army fit for battle; their number was twenty-six thousand.
Bahnar: Dôm lu bơngai 'noh kon sâu Aser; pơm yŏng kơdră lăm adrĕch, mă đei rơih iŏk, lu sư linh tơblah nuih kơtang, wei-lăng păng pơm yŏng kơdră pơgơ̆r. Lu bơngai mă pơm linh tơblah, kiơ̆ kơ adrĕch adrung lu sư đei chih jô̆ 'bar-jĭt tơdrâu-rơbâu 'nu.

English: Now Benjamin begot Bela his firstborn, Ashbel the second, Aharah the third
Bahnar: Bênjamin pơjing Bêla, kon drŏ-nglo kơdră, kon mă 'bar noh Asbel, mă pêng Ahara

English: Nohah the fourth, and Rapha the fifth.
Bahnar: mă puăn Nôha păng mă pơđăm noh Rapha.

English: The sons of Bela were Addar, Gera, Abihud
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Bêla noh: Ađar, Gêra, Abihut

English: Abishua, Naaman, Ahoah
Bahnar: Abisua, Naaman, Ahôa

English: Gera, Shephuphan, and Huram.
Bahnar: Gêra, Sêphupha păng Huram.

English: These are the sons of Ehud, who were the heads of the fathers’ houses of the inhabitants of Geba, and who forced them to move to Manahath
Bahnar: 'Nâu boih lu kon sâu Êhut; lu bơngai âu yŏng kơdră lăm adrĕch adrung oei tơ pơlei Gêba, đe rôp chông ba lu sư pơm bơnă tơ pơlei Manahat

English: Naaman, Ahijah, and Gera who forced them to move. He begot Uzza and Ahihud.
Bahnar: Naaman, Ahija păng Gêra đe rôp chông ba, na sư pơjing kơ Usa păng Ahihut.

English: Also Shaharaim had children in the country of Moab, after he had sent away Hushim and Baara his wives.
Bahnar: Saharaim pơjing kon drŏ-nglo tơ lăm dêh Môap, đơ̆ng rŏng kơ sư achăng akăn sư Husim păng Baara.

English: By Hodesh his wife he begot Jobab, Zibia, Mesha, Malcam
Bahnar: Lu kon drŏ-nglo đơ̆ng Hôđes akăn sư pơjing đei Jôbap, Sibia, Mêsa, Malkam

English: Jeuz, Sachiah, and Mirmah. These were his sons, heads of their fathers’ houses.
Bahnar: Jêus, Sakia păng Mirma. 'Nâu lu kon drŏ-nglo sư yŏng kơdră lăm adrĕch.

English: And by Hushim he begot Abitub and Elpaal.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng yă Husim đei pơjing Abitup păng Êlpaal.

English: The sons of Elpaal were Eber, Misham, and Shemed, who built Ono and Lod with its towns
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Êlpaal: Eber, Misam Sêmêt, bơngai mă pơjing pơlei Ônô păng pơlei Lot hăm lu pơlei jum dăr sư

English: and Beriah and Shema, who were heads of their fathers’ houses of the inhabitants of Aijalon, who drove out the inhabitants of Gath.
Bahnar: păng Bêria hăm Sêma; bre sư yŏng kơdră lăm adrĕch adrung kon pơlei oei tơ pơlei Aijalôn păng sư blah puh lê̆ lu kon pơlei oei lăm pơlei Gat.

English: Ahio, Shashak, Jeremoth
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Bêria: Ahiô, Sasak, Jêremôt

English: Zebadiah, Arad, Eder
Bahnar: Sêbađia, Arat, Êder

English: Michael, Ispah, and Joha were the sons of Beriah.
Bahnar: Mikael, Ispa păng Jôha.

English: Zebadiah, Meshullam, Hizki, Heber
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Êlpaal: Sêbađia, Mêsulam Hiski, Hêber

English: Ishmerai, Jizliah, and Jobab were the sons of Elpaal.
Bahnar: Ismêrai, Islia păng Jôbap.

English: Jakim, Zichri, Zabdi
Bahnar: Jakim, Sikri, Sapđi

English: Elienai, Zillethai, Eliel
Bahnar: Êliênai, Silêthai, Êliel

English: Adaiah, Beraiah, and Shimrath were the sons of Shimei.
Bahnar: Ađaia, Bêraia păng Simrat kon drŏ-nglo Simei.

English: Ishpan, Eber, Eliel
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Sasak: Ispan, Eber, Êliel.

English: Abdon, Zichri, Hanan
Bahnar: Apđôn, Sikri, Hanan

English: Hananiah, Elam, Antothijah
Bahnar: Hanania, Êlam, Anthôthija

English: Iphdeiah, and Penuel were the sons of Shashak.
Bahnar: Ipđêia păng Pênuel.

English: Shamsherai, Shehariah, Athaliah
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Jêrôham: Samsêrai, Sêharia, Athalia

English: Jaareshiah, Elijah, and Zichri were the sons of Jeroham.
Bahnar: Jaarêsia, Êli, păng Sikri.

English: These were heads of the fathers’ houses by their generations, chief men. These dwelt in Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Đi lu bơngai noh pơm yŏng kơdră lăm adrĕch adrung, lu sư bơngai oei lăm pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: Now the father of Gibeon, whose wife’s name was Maacah, dwelt at Gibeon.
Bahnar: Jêiêl 'bă kơ Gibeôn oei tơ pơlei Gibeôn anăn akăn sư Maaka.

English: And his firstborn son was Abdon, then Zur, Kish, Baal, Nadab
Bahnar: Kon kơdră drŏ-nglo sư Apđôn; đơ̆ng noh Sur, Kis, Baal, Ner, Nađap

English: Gedor, Ahio, Zecher
Bahnar: Gêđôr, Ahiô Sêker

English: and Mikloth, who begot Shimeah. They also dwelt alongside their relatives in Jerusalem, with their brethren.
Bahnar: păng Miklôt, 'bă kơ Simêa; lu sư kư̆m oei jê̆ lu 'nhŏng oh lu sư tơ pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: Ner begot Kish, Kish begot Saul, and Saul begot Jonathan, Malchishua, Abinadab, and Esh-Baal.
Bahnar: Ner pơjing Kis; Kis 'bă kơ Sôl; Sôl 'bă kơ Jônathan, Malkisua, Abinađap păng Êsbaal.

English: The son of Jonathan was Merib-Baal, and Merib-Baal begot Micah.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Jônathan: Mêri Baal; Mêri Baal 'bă kơ Mika.

English: The sons of Micah were Pithon, Melech, Tarea, and Ahaz.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Mika: Pithon, Mêlek, Tarêa păng Ahas.

English: And Ahaz begot Jehoaddah; Jehoaddah begot Alemeth, Azmaveth, and Zimri; and Zimri begot Moza.
Bahnar: Ahas pơjing Jêhôađa; Jêhôađa pơjing Alêmet, Asmawet păng Simri; Simri pơjing Môsa

English: Moza begot Binea, Raphah his son, Eleasah his son, and Azel his son.
Bahnar: Môsa 'bă kơ Binêa; kon drŏ-nglo Binêa noh: Rapha; Rapha pơjing Êlêasa, Êlêasa pơjing Asêl.

English: Azel had six sons whose names were these: Azrikam, Bocheru, Ishmael, Sheariah, Obadiah, and Hanan. All these were the sons of Azel.
Bahnar: Asêl đei tơdrâu 'nu kon drŏ-nglo, anăn lu sư: Asrikam, Bokêru, Ismael, Sêaria, Ôbađia păng Hanan. Đĭ-đăng lu sư kon drŏ-nglo Asêl ngăl.

English: And the sons of Eshek his brother were Ulam his firstborn, Jeush the second, and Eliphelet the third.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Êsek, 'nhŏng oh Asêl, noh: Ulam kon kơdră drŏ-nglo, mă 'bar Jêrus păng mă pêng noh Êliphêlet.

English: The sons of Ulam were mighty men of valor—archers. They had many sons and grandsons, one hundred and fifty in all. These were all sons of Benjamin.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Ulam tă kơ bơngai nuih kơtang ngăl, prah hră đam. Lu sư đei kon sâu lơ, đei minh-hrĕng pơđăm-jĭt 'nu. Đĭ-đăng lu sư noh kon sâu Bênjamin ngăl.

English: So all Israel was recorded by genealogies, and indeed, they were inscribed in the book of the kings of Israel. But Judah was carried away captive to Babylon because of their unfaithfulness.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng bơngai Isơrael đei năm chih anăn lăm Sơ̆p hla bơar kiơ̆ kơ adrĕch adrung đei chih tơmơ̆t lăm sơ̆p hla bơar tơm lu pơtao Isơrael. Bơngai Juđa, yua kơ đơ̆ng pơm yoch na đe rôp anhăk lu sư tơ char Babilôn.

English: And the first inhabitants who dwelt in their possessions in their cities were Israelites, priests, Levites, and the Nethinim.
Bahnar: 'Nâu, lu bơngai brŏk blŭng-a tơ teh đak tơ pơlei lu sư kơdih bơngai Isơrael, lu 'bok soi, lu bơngai Lêwi păng lu bơngai Nêthirim.

English: Now in Jerusalem the children of Judah dwelt, and some of the children of Benjamin, and of the children of Ephraim and Manasseh
Bahnar: Oei kơtă lăm pơlei Jêrusalem, đei bơngai Juđa, bơngai Bênjamin, bơngai Êphraim păng bơngai Manase.

English: Uthai the son of Ammihud, the son of Omri, the son of Imri, the son of Bani, of the descendants of Perez, the son of Judah.
Bahnar: Noh Uthai, kon drŏ-nglo Amihut, Amihut kon drŏ-nglo Ômri, Ômri kon drŏ-nglo Imri, Imri kon drŏ-nglo Bani, Bani đơ̆ng adrĕch Peres, Peres kon drŏ-nglo Juđa.

English: Of the Shilonites: Asaiah the firstborn and his sons.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng adrĕch bơngai Silôni. Đei Asaia kon drŏ-nglo kơdră păng lu kon drŏ-nglo sư.

English: Of the sons of Zerah: Jeuel, and their brethren—six hundred and ninety.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng kon sâu Sêra, đei Jêuel păng adrĕch Juđa đĭ-đăng đei tơdrâu-hrĕng tơsĭn-jĭt 'nu

English: Of the sons of Benjamin: Sallu the son of Meshullam, the son of Hodaviah, the son of Hassenuah
Bahnar: Gah adrĕch adrung Bênjamin: Salu, kon drŏ-nglo Mêsulam; Mêsulam kon drŏ-nglo Hôđawia; Hôđawia, kon drŏ-nglo Hasenua

English: Ibneiah the son of Jeroham; Elah the son of Uzzi, the son of Michri; Meshullam the son of Shephatiah, the son of Reuel, the son of Ibnijah
Bahnar: đei dơ̆ng Ipnêia, kon drŏ-nglo Jêrôham; Êlah kon drŏ-nglo Usi; Usi noh kon drŏ-nglo Mikri păng Mêsulam, kon drŏ-nglo Sêphatia; Sêphatia noh kon drŏ-nglo Rêuel; Rêuel kon drŏ-nglo Ipnija

English: and their brethren, according to their generations—nine hundred and fifty-six. All these men were heads of a father’s house in their fathers’ houses.
Bahnar: 'Nhŏng oh lu sư kiơ̆ adrĕch đei tơsĭn-hrĕng pơđăm-jĭt tơdrâu 'nu, dôm lu bơngai âu yŏng kơdră lăm adrĕch ngăl.

English: Of the priests: Jedaiah, Jehoiarib, and Jachin
Bahnar: Lăm lu 'bok soi: Jêđaia, Jêhôiarip, Jakin

English: Azariah the son of Hilkiah, the son of Meshullam, the son of Zadok, the son of Meraioth, the son of Ahitub, the officer over the house of God
Bahnar: Asaria, kon drŏ-nglo Hilkia, Hilkia kon drŏ-nglo Mêsulam; Mêsulam kon drŏ-nglo Sađok; Sađok kon drŏ-nglo Mêraiôt, Mêraiôt kon drŏ-nglo Ahitup, mă bơngai wei-lăng hnam akŭm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei

English: Adaiah the son of Jeroham, the son of Pashur, the son of Malchijah; Maasai the son of Adiel, the son of Jahzerah, the son of Meshullam, the son of Meshillemith, the son of Immer
Bahnar: Ađaia, kon drŏ-nglo Jêrôham; Jêrôham, kon drŏ-nglo Phashur; Phashur, kon drŏ-nglo Malkija; Malkija, kon drŏ-nglo Maasai; Maasai kon drŏ-nglo Ađiêl; Ađiêl kon drŏ-nglo Jasêra; Jasêra kon drŏ-nglo Mêsulam; Mêsulam, kon drŏ-nglo Mêsilemit; Mêsilemit, kon drŏ-nglo Immer.

English: and their brethren, heads of their fathers’ houses—one thousand seven hundred and sixty. They were very able men for the work of the service of the house of God.
Bahnar: 'Nhŏng oh 'bok soi jô̆ đĭ-đăng đei minh-rơbâu tơpơh-hrĕng tơdrâu-jĭt 'nu, lu sư pơm yŏng kơdră lăm adrĕch adrung, đei đon gơh hơgei bơ̆jang lăm hnam akŭm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: Of the Levites: Shemaiah the son of Hasshub, the son of Azrikam, the son of Hashabiah, of the sons of Merari
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Lêwi: Sêmaia, kon drŏ-nglo Hasup, sâu Asrikam, sâu i Hasabia lu sư adrĕch adrung Mêrari

English: Bakbakkar, Heresh, Galal, and Mattaniah the son of Micah, the son of Zichri, the son of Asaph
Bahnar: Bakbakar, Hêres, Galal, Matania kon drŏ-nglo Mika, sâu Sikri, sâu i Asap

English: Obadiah the son of Shemaiah, the son of Galal, the son of Jeduthun; and Berechiah the son of Asa, the son of Elkanah, who lived in the villages of the Netophathites.
Bahnar: Ôbađia, kon drŏ-nglo Sêmaia, sâu Galal, sâu i Jêđuthun; Bêrekia, kon drŏ-nglo Asa, sâu Êlkana, bơngai mă oei lăm pơlei Nêtôphathit.

English: And the gatekeepers were Shallum, Akkub, Talmon, Ahiman, and their brethren. Shallum was the chief.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai gak 'măng jang: Sallum, Akup, Tanmôn, Ahiman, păng 'nhŏng oh lu sư Sallum pơm kơ̆l.

English: Until then they had been gatekeepers for the camps of the children of Levi at the King’s Gate on the east.
Bahnar: Lu sư gak 'Măng Jang Pơtao gah hơlĕch truh tơ dang ei lu sư wei gak 'măng jang kơđông bơngai Lêwi.

English: Shallum the son of Kore, the son of Ebiasaph, the son of Korah, and his brethren, from his father’s house, the Korahites, were in charge of the work of the service, gatekeepers of the tabernacle. Their fathers had been keepers of the entrance to the camp of the LORD.
Bahnar: Sallum, kon drŏ-nglo Kôrê, sâu Êbiasap, sâu i Kôra păng lu 'nhŏng oh pôm yă 'bok lu sư lu kon pơlei bơngai Kôrê, wei-lăng bơ̆jang, gak 'măng hnam Anih akŭm; sơ̆ 'bok lu sư kư̆m wei gak 'măng bơsŭn anih akŭm Kră Yang.

English: And Phinehas the son of Eleazar had been the officer over them in time past; the LORD was with him.
Bahnar: Sơ̆ Phinêhas, kon drŏ-nglo Êlêasar, bơngai wei-lăng bơngai gak păng Kră Yang oei hơdai hăm sư.

English: Zechariah the son of Meshelemiah was keeper of the door of the tabernacle of meeting.
Bahnar: Sachari kon drŏ-nglo Mêsêlêmia, bơngai gak 'măng anih akŭm.

English: All those chosen as gatekeepers were two hundred and twelve. They were recorded by their genealogy, in their villages. David and Samuel the seer had appointed them to their trusted office.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai 'nâu mă đei rơih iŏk wă gak lu 'măng jang jô̆ đei 'bar-hrĕng mơjĭt-'bar 'nu. Đe đei chih anăn kiơ̆ kơ adrĕch hăm pơlei lu sư Pơtao Đawit păng Samuel, bơngai băt lê̆ adrol, gơnang pơchĕp ăn kơ lu sư dôm tơdrong jang âu.

English: So they and their children were in charge of the gates of the house of the LORD, the house of the tabernacle, by assignment.
Bahnar: Lu sư păng kon sâu lu sư jang tơdrong wei-lăng gak 'măng jang hnam anih akŭm Kră Yang, wă khan lu bơngai gak anih akŭm.

English: The gatekeepers were assigned to the four directions: the east, west, north, and south.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai gak 'măng jang puăn pah, gah hơlĕch, gah bơmơ̆t, gơal păng gah yă-nơ̆m.

English: And their brethren in their villages had to come with them from time to time for seven days.
Bahnar: 'Nhŏng oh lu sư oei lăm lu pơlei năm rim 'măng giĕng, tơplih băl, năm tơgŭm lu sư.

English: For in this trusted office were four chief gatekeepers; they were Levites. And they had charge over the chambers and treasuries of the house of God.
Bahnar: Na puăn 'nu bơngai Lêwi pơm yŏng wei-lăng lu bơngai gak wei 'măng jang lu sư jao ăn tơdrong jang, păng wei-lăng lăm lu anih păng lu anih tah tơmam lăm anih akŭm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: And they lodged all around the house of God because they had the responsibility, and they were in charge of opening it every morning.
Bahnar: Tơ kơmăng lu sư wei gak jum dăr anih akŭm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei; rim pơgê hrôih lu sư pơih 'măng jang.

English: Now some of them were in charge of the serving vessels, for they brought them in and took them out by count.
Bahnar: Lăm lu sư kư̆m đei lu bơngai jang wei-lăng tơmam yua lăm anih akŭm; lu sư jô̆ Êmưh yua chĕp tơlĕch dah chĕp tơmơ̆t lu pơnhan kơchŏk.

English: Some of them were appointed over the furnishings and over all the implements of the sanctuary, and over the fine flour and the wine and the oil and the incense and the spices.
Bahnar: Đei lu mơ'nah dơ̆ng pơjao kơ lu sư wei-lăng tơmam yua lăm anih rơgoh, thoi tơpŭng sik, đak rơmă, 'long 'bâu phu, păng pơgang 'bâu phu.

English: And some of the sons of the priests made the ointment of the spices.
Bahnar: Đei mơ'nah lu 'bok soi pơm jrâu lu pơgang 'bâu phu.

English: Mattithiah of the Levites, the firstborn of Shallum the Korahite, had the trusted office over the things that were baked in the pans.
Bahnar: Matithia, bơngai Lêwi, kon drŏ-nglo kơdră Sallum, sư adrĕch adrung Kôrê, pơjao tơdrong jang pơm 'buh 'bĕng

English: And some of their brethren of the sons of the Kohathites were in charge of preparing the showbread for every Sabbath.
Bahnar: Đei mơ'nah 'nhŏng oh lu sư adrĕch Kôhat lu sư pơm hơmet 'bĕng tơ gơ'bang rim năr pơdơh Sa'bat.

English: These are the singers, heads of the fathers’ houses of the Levites, who lodged in the chambers, and were free from other duties; for they were employed in that work day and night.
Bahnar: 'Nâu lu bơngai hơri, lu yŏng kơdră lăm adrĕch bơngai Lêwi lu sư oei rim anih lăm anih akŭm, yua kơ lu sư bơ̆jang măng păng năr na pơdơh tơdrong jang nai.

English: These heads of the fathers’ houses of the Levites were heads throughout their generations. They dwelt at Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Dôm lu bơngai 'noh, yŏng kơdră lăm adrĕch bơngai Lêwi, kiơ̆ kơ adrĕch adrung lu sư păng oei tơ lăm pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: Jeiel the father of Gibeon, whose wife’s name was Maacah, dwelt at Gibeon.
Bahnar: Jêiêl, 'bă kơ Gibeôn oei tơ pơlei Gibeôn; akăn sư anăn Maaka.
