English: His firstborn son was Abdon, then Zur, Kish, Baal, Ner, Nadab
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo kơdră sư noh Apđôn; đơ̆ng noh Sur, Kis, Baal, Ner, Nađap

English: Gedor, Ahio, Zechariah, and Mikloth.
Bahnar: Gêđôr, Ahiô, Sacharia păng Miklôt.

English: And Mikloth begot Shimeam. They also dwelt alongside their relatives in Jerusalem, with their brethren.
Bahnar: Miklôt pơjing Sêmêam. Lu sư kư̆m oei hơdai tơ jê̆ hăm 'nhŏng oh lu sư lăm pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: Ner begot Kish, Kish begot Saul, and Saul begot Jonathan, Malchishua, Abinadab, and Esh-Baal.
Bahnar: Ner pơjing Kis; Kis pơjing Sôl; Sôl pơjing Jônathan, Malkissua, Abinađap, păng Êsbaal.

English: The son of Jonathan was Merib-Baal, and Merib-Baal begot Micah.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Jônathan: Mêri Baal; Mêri Baal pơjing Mika.

English: The sons of Micah were Pithon, Melech, Tahrea, and Ahaz.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Mika noh: Pithon, Mêlek, Tahrea păng Ahas.

English: And Ahaz begot Jarah; Jarah begot Alemeth, Azmaveth, and Zimri; and Zimri begot Moza
Bahnar: Ahas pơjing Jadra; Jadra pơjing Alêmet, Asmawet păng Simri; Simri pơjing Môsa

English: Moza begot Binea, Rephaiah his son, Eleasah his son, and Azel his son.
Bahnar: Môsa pơjing Binêa, kon drŏ-nglo Binêa noh Rêphaia, Rêphaia pơjing Êlêasa păng Êlêasa pơjing kơ Asêl

English: And Azel had six sons whose names were these: Azrikam, Bocheru, Ishmael, Sheariah, Obadiah, and Hanan; these were the sons of Azel.
Bahnar: Asêl đei tơdrâu 'nu kon drŏ-nglo, anăn: Asrikam, Bokêru, Ismael, Sêaria, Ôbađia păng Hanan; 'noh kon drŏ-nglo Asêl.

English: Now the Philistines fought against Israel; and the men of Israel fled from before the Philistines, and fell slain on Mount Gilboa.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Philistin tơblah hăm bơngai Isơrael. Kon pơlei Isơrael kơdâu đơ̆ng anăp kon pơlei Philistin, đei lơ bơngai jĭ rơka, pơ̆k lôch tơ kơpal Kông Gilbôa.

English: Then the Philistines followed hard after Saul and his sons. And the Philistines killed Jonathan, Abinadab, and Malchishua, Saul’s sons.
Bahnar: Kon pơlei Philistin, druh Sôl păng lu kon drŏ-nglo sư, pơlôch lu kon drŏ-nglo sư Jônathan, Abinađap păng Malkissua.

English: The battle became fierce against Saul. The archers hit him, and he was wounded by the archers.
Bahnar: Tơdrong tơblah băl tih dêh tơpă tăp kơ Sôl, lu linh chĕp hră druh prah 'bơm hloi sư rơka.

English: Then Saul said to his armorbearer, “Draw your sword, and thrust me through with it, lest these uncircumcised men come and abuse me.” But his armorbearer would not, for he was greatly afraid. Therefore Saul took a sword and fell on it.
Bahnar: Sôl athei bơngai mă chĕp tơmam tơblah sư khan: “Ih athei toh đao ih 'bet pơlôch inh, kơnh lu bơngai mă ưh kơ chu kăt tơdra akar 'noh truh pơm kơnê̆ kơ inh.” Mă-lei bơngai chĕp mă wei sư 'noh ưh kơ pơ̆n yua kơ sư hli dêh. Na Sôl iŏk đao sư glơ̆m kơdih sư.

English: And when his armorbearer saw that Saul was dead, he also fell on his sword and died.
Bahnar: Na lăp bơngai chĕp wei sư 'noh 'bôh Sôl lôch boih, na sư kư̆m iŏk đao glơ̆m sư kơdih mơ̆n.

English: So Saul and his three sons died, and all his house died together.
Bahnar: Na Sôl păng pêng 'nu kon drŏ-nglo sư lôch păng đĭ-đăng hnam dơnŏ sư kư̆m lôch.

English: And when all the men of Israel who were in the valley saw that they had fled and that Saul and his sons were dead, they forsook their cities and fled; then the Philistines came and dwelt in them.
Bahnar: Kon pơlei Isơrael bơngai lăm anih thŭng glă 'bôh lu linh kơdâu, Sôl hăm lu kon drŏ-nglo sư lôch boih, lu sư achăng lê̆ pơlei sư na kơdâu ôn; kon pơlei Philistin mơ̆t blah iŏk oei tơ lăm lu pơlei noh.

English: So it happened the next day, when the Philistines came to strip the slain, that they found Saul and his sons fallen on Mount Gilboa.
Bahnar: Năr đơ̆ng rŏng, kon pơlei Philistin năm iŏk mŭk tơmam lu bơngai lôch, na 'bôh Sôl păng lu kon drŏ-nglo sư lôch tơ Kông Gilbôa.

English: And they stripped him and took his head and his armor, and sent word throughout the land of the Philistines to proclaim the news in the temple of their idols and among the people.
Bahnar: Lu sư iŏk tơmam Sôl, chơ̆ng iŏk kơ̆l sư, iŏk tơmam tơblah sư, na lu sư wơh bơngai năm jơ̆p-jang dêh Philistin, roi tơbăt ăn kơ lu rup yang păng kon pơlei sư.

English: Then they put his armor in the temple of their gods, and fastened his head in the temple of Dagon.
Bahnar: Lu sư 'măn lê̆ tơmam tơblah Sôl tơ lăm anih kơkuh kơ rup yang lu sư, na kơ̆l sư hơtol lê̆ tơ lăm hnam yang Dagôn.

English: And when all Jabesh Gilead heard all that the Philistines had done to Saul
Bahnar: Lăp kon pơlei Jabes Gileat kơtơ̆ng dôm tơdrong kon pơlei Philistin pơm kơ Sôl

English: all the valiant men arose and took the body of Saul and the bodies of his sons; and they brought them to Jabesh, and buried their bones under the tamarisk tree at Jabesh, and fasted seven days.
Bahnar: na lu sư minh jơhngơ̆m minh đon hơdai iung năm tŏk tơtông iŏk akâu pơtao Sôl păng akâu lu kon drŏ-nglo sư chĕp wih tơ Jabes, 'bŭ kơting lu sư tơ ala tơm 'long kôih tơ Jabes, lu sư grong ơ̆t kơ sŏng sa tơpơh năr.

English: So Saul died for his unfaithfulness which he had committed against the LORD, because he did not keep the word of the LORD, and also because he consulted a medium for guidance.
Bahnar: Pơtao Sôl lôch, yua kơ sư pơm yoch ưh kơ hli gơnang kơ Kră Yang; sư ưh kơ kiơ̆ nơ̆r Kră Yang bơtho pơkă păng kư̆m kiơ̆ bơngai krao apinh yang atâu

English: But he did not inquire of the LORD; therefore He killed him, and turned the kingdom over to David the son of Jesse.
Bahnar: Sôl ưh kơ krao apinh Kră Yang; na Kră Yang pơlôch sư, teh đak sư ăn kơ Đawit, kon drŏ-nglo Jese.

English: Then all Israel came together to David at Hebron, saying, “Indeed we are your bone and your flesh.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng bơngai Isơrael akŭm hơdai hăm Đawit tơ Hêbrôn păng khan: “Lu nhôn âu jơ̆ kơting sĕch akar ih.

English: Also, in time past, even when Saul was king, you were the one who led Israel out and brought them in; and the LORD your God said to you, ‘You shall shepherd My people Israel, and be ruler over My people Israel.’ ”
Bahnar: Adrol sơ̆ mă kơplah Sôl oei pơm pơtao, ih boih pơgơ̆r chông kon pơlei Isơrael lĕch; dah wih brŏk. Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ih đei khan: ‘Ih gô wei rong kon pơlei Isơrael Inh; păng ih gô pơm yŏng pơgơ̆r lu sư.’ ”

English: Therefore all the elders of Israel came to the king at Hebron, and David made a covenant with them at Hebron before the LORD. And they anointed David king over Israel, according to the word of the LORD by Samuel.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh đĭ-đăng lu kră bơngai Isơrael năm tơ pơtao Đawit tơ Hêbrôn; na Đawit pơgơ̆p hloi hăm lu sư tơ Hêbrôn 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang; klaih kơ noh lu sư tuh đak rơmă 'bâu phu pôk Đawit pơm pơtao bơngai Isơrael thoi nơ̆r Kră Yang pơkă hăm Samuel.

English: And David and all Israel went to Jerusalem, which is Jebus, where the Jebusites were, the inhabitants of the land.
Bahnar: Đawit păng đĭ-đăng kon pơlei Isơrael năm tơ pơlei Jêrusalem, 'noh pơlei Jêbus; tơ noh đei lu bơngai Jêbus oei.

English: But the inhabitants of Jebus said to David, “You shall not come in here!” Nevertheless David took the stronghold of Zion (that is, the City of David).
Bahnar: Khan kơ Đawit: “Ih ưh kơ gơh mơ̆t tơ âu ôh.” Mă-lei Đawit blah iŏk kơđông kơjăp pơlei Siôn, noh boih pơlei Đawit.

English: Now David said, “Whoever attacks the Jebusites first shall be chief and captain.” And Joab the son of Zeruiah went up first, and became chief.
Bahnar: Đawit khan: “Bơngai bu blah kon pơlei Jêbus adrol, sư gô pơm yŏng pơm bơngai pơgơ̆r.” Na Jôap, kon drŏ-nglo Sêruia, năm tŏk blah adrol, na sư pơm yŏng pơgơ̆r.

English: Then David dwelt in the stronghold; therefore they called it the City of David.
Bahnar: Đawit oei lăm kơđông 'noh; na đe krao pơlei Đawit.

English: And he built the city around it, from the Millo to the surrounding area. Joab repaired the rest of the city.
Bahnar: Sư pơm pơlei jum dăr, đơ̆ng Milô; na Jôap sư pơm pơkeh lu pơlei tam mă pơm.

English: So David went on and became great, and the LORD of hosts was with him.
Bahnar: Đawit rai đunh rai pran kơtang; yua kơ Kră Yang Tih Hloh oei hơdai sư.

English: Now these were the heads of the mighty men whom David had, who strengthened themselves with him in his kingdom, with all Israel, to make him king, according to the word of the LORD concerning Israel.
Bahnar: 'Nâu boih lu yŏng bơngai nuih pran kơtang, pơgơ̆r lu linh Đawit, tơgŭm hơdai hăm đĭ-đăng bơngai Isơrael, wă pơm kơ dêh char pơtao Đawit pran kơjăp, thoi nơ̆r Kră Yang đei pơkă.

English: And this is the number of the mighty men whom David had: Jashobeam the son of a Hachmonite, chief of the captains; he had lifted up his spear against three hundred, killed by him at one time.
Bahnar: 'Nâu anăn dôm lu linh nuih pran kơtang kiơ̆ Đawit: Jahôbêam, kon drŏ-nglo Hakmôni, pơm yŏng kơ lu bơngai pơgơ̆r; 'noh bơngai yua đao tơju sư kơdih mă pơlôch pêng-hrĕng 'nu bơngai lăm minh 'măng.

English: After him was Eleazar the son of Dodo, the Ahohite, who was one of the three mighty men.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ sư Êlêasar kon drŏ-nglo Đôđô bơngai Ahôbit, minh 'nu lăm pêng 'nu, sư bơngai nuih pran kơtang hloh.

English: He was with David at Pasdammim. Now there the Philistines were gathered for battle, and there was a piece of ground full of barley. So the people fled from the Philistines.
Bahnar: Sư oei hơdai hăm Đawit tơ Pas Đammim, lăp lu linh Philistin akŭm băl wă tơblah. Tơ noh đei na chŭn 'ba tơ'bâu, anih mă lu linh kơdâu kơ linh Philistin.

English: But they stationed themselves in the middle of that field, defended it, and killed the Philistines. So the LORD brought about a great victory.
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu sư dơ̆ng lăm na chŭn blah drŭt lu linh Philistin kơdâu đĭ thoi noh Kră Yang ăn kĕ jei lu sư tih dêh tơpă.

English: Now three of the thirty chief men went down to the rock to David, into the cave of Adullam; and the army of the Philistines encamped in the Valley of Rephaim.
Bahnar: Lăm pêng-jĭt 'nu bơngai pơgơ̆r đei pêng 'nu bơngai năm jur tơ'bơ̆p Đawit lăm hơgơp tơmo tơ Ađulam, kơplah noh lu linh Philistin oei dơ̆ng pơm anih tơ lăm Thŭng Rêphaim.

English: David was then in the stronghold, and the garrison of the Philistines was then in Bethlehem.
Bahnar: Kơplah 'noh Đawit oei lăm kơđông kơjăp, păng lu linh Philistin oei răp tơ pơlei Betlehem.

English: And David said with longing, “Oh, that someone would give me a drink of water from the well of Bethlehem, which is by the gate!”
Bahnar: Đawit rơhing kơ đak na khan: “Ơ rŏ kơ đei bu năm ba kơ inh đak nhă đơ̆ng đak sơlŭng jê̆ 'măng jang pơlei Betlehem!”

English: So the three broke through the camp of the Philistines, drew water from the well of Bethlehem that was by the gate, and took it and brought it to David. Nevertheless David would not drink it, but poured it out to the LORD.
Bahnar: Na pêng 'nu bơngai 'nâu năm mơ̆t tơpăt kơđông linh Philistin sŏ iŏk đak đơ̆ng lăm sơlŭng jê̆ 'măng jang pơlei Betlehem, chĕp ba ăn kơ Đawit nhă mă-lei sư ưh kơ wă nhă, sư tuh hloi đak 'noh 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang

English: And he said, “Far be it from me, O my God, that I should do this! Shall I drink the blood of these men who have put their lives in jeopardy? For at the risk of their lives they brought it.” Therefore he would not drink it. These things were done by the three mighty men.
Bahnar: na khan: “Apinh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei wei inh ưh kơ pơm tơdrong 'nâu; liơ Inh gơh huch pham lu bơngai 'nâu, yua kơ lu sư hŭt akâu kơdih wă kơ iŏk đak âu.” Thoi noh, na Đawit ưh kơ chu nhă đak. Noh mă lu tơdrong jang pêng 'nu bơngai nuih kơtang đei pơm.

English: Abishai the brother of Joab was chief of another three. He had lifted up his spear against three hundred men, killed them, and won a name among these three.
Bahnar: Abisai, oh Jôap pơm yŏng kơ pêng 'nu bơngai nuih kơtang; sư yua tơju na blah pơlôch pêng-hrĕng 'nu bơngai, na đe ư-ang anăn sư thoi pêng 'nu 'noh.

English: Of the three he was more honored than the other two men. Therefore he became their captain. However he did not attain to the first three.
Bahnar: Lăm pêng 'nu bơngai nuih kơtang 'noh sư đe ư-ang hloh na pơm kơ̆l wei-lăng lu sư, mă-lei ưh kơ đei dang pêng 'nu bơngai adrol noh.

English: Benaiah was the son of Jehoiada, the son of a valiant man from Kabzeel, who had done many deeds. He had killed two lion-like heroes of Moab. He also had gone down and killed a lion in the midst of a pit on a snowy day.
Bahnar: Bênaia, kon drŏ-nglo Jêhôiada bơngai Kapsel, minh 'nu bơngai linh nuih kơtang đei pơm lơ tơdrong jang tih; sư pơlôch 'bar 'nu bơngai Môap mă pran kơtang hloh; lăm minh năr prĕl jruh sư jur năm tơ minh pôm sơlŭng pơlôch Dăm-brang.

English: And he killed an Egyptian, a man of great height, five cubits tall. In the Egyptian’s hand there was a spear like a weaver’s beam; and he went down to him with a staff, wrested the spear out of the Egyptian’s hand, and killed him with his own spear.
Bahnar: Sư kư̆m pơlôch minh 'nu bơngai Êyiptơ kơjung 'bar hlok minh hơgăt mă bơngai Êyiptơ ti sư chĕp tơju tih tŏ 'long hơtơ̆ng brai, Bênaia năm tơblah sư chĕp minh pôm 'long tơnôn, na tơgar iŏk tơju đơ̆ng ti bơngai Êyiptơ na 'bet pơlôch bơngai noh.

English: These things Benaiah the son of Jehoiada did, and won a name among three mighty men.
Bahnar: 'Noh jơ̆ tơdrong Bênaia, kon drŏ-nglo Jêhôiada đei pơm đe kư̆m ư-ang kơ sư thoi pêng 'nu bơngai nuih kơtang noh.

English: Indeed he was more honored than the thirty, but he did not attain to the first three. And David appointed him over his guard.
Bahnar: Lăm pêng-jĭt 'nu bơngai nuih kơtang, sư đe kư̆m ư-ang hloh, mă-lei ưh kơ gơh jô̆ mơ̆t lăm pêng 'nu noh. Đawit iŏk sư mơ̆t pơgơ̆r wei-lăng linh mă wei sư.

English: Also the mighty warriors were Asahel the brother of Joab, Elhanan the son of Dodo of Bethlehem
Bahnar: Lu bơngai nuih kơtang 'noh: Asahel oh Jôap; Êlhanan kon drŏ-nglo Đôđô đơ̆ng pơlei Betlehem

English: Shammoth the Harorite, Helez the Pelonite
Bahnar: Sammôt bơngai Harôt; Hêlês bơngai Pelônit

English: Ira the son of Ikkesh the Tekoite, Abiezer the Anathothite
Bahnar: Ira kon drŏ-nglo Ikês đơ̆ng pơlei Têkôa; Abiêser đơ̆ng pơlei Anothôt.

English: Sibbechai the Hushathite, Ilai the Ahohite
Bahnar: Sibêkai bơngai Husatit; Ilai bơngai Ahôhit

English: Maharai the Netophathite, Heled the son of Baanah the Netophathite
Bahnar: Maharai bơngai Nêtôphatit; Hêlêt, kon drŏ-nglo Baana bơngai Nêtôphatit

English: Ithai the son of Ribai of Gibeah, of the sons of Benjamin, Benaiah the Pirathonite
Bahnar: Ithai, kon drŏ-nglo Ribai đơ̆ng pơlei Gibêah, kon Sâu, Bênjamin, Bênaia bơngai Phirathônit

English: Hurai of the brooks of Gaash, Abiel the Arbathite
Bahnar: Hurai đơ̆ng thong đak Gaas; Abiel bơngai Arba

English: Azmaveth the Baharumite, Eliahba the Shaalbonite
Bahnar: Asmawet bơngai Baharum; Êliahba bơngai Saalbônit

English: the sons of Hashem the Gizonite, Jonathan the son of Shageh the Hararite
Bahnar: lu kon drŏ-nglo Hasem bơngai Gisônit; Jônathan, kon drŏ-nglo Sage bơngai Hararit

English: Ahiam the son of Sacar the Hararite, Eliphal the son of Ur
Bahnar: Ahiam, kon drŏ-nglo Sakar bơngai Hararit; Eliphal, kon drŏ-nglo Ur

English: Hepher the Mecherathite, Ahijah the Pelonite
Bahnar: Hêpher bơngai Mêkêrathit; Ahija bơngai Phelônit

English: Hezro the Carmelite, Naarai the son of Ezbai
Bahnar: Hêsrô bơngai Karmel, Naarai kon drŏ-nglo Êsbai.

English: Joel the brother of Nathan, Mibhar the son of Hagri
Bahnar: Jôel oh Nathan; Miphar, kon drŏ-nglo Hagri

English: Zelek the Ammonite, Naharai the Berothite (the armorbearer of Joab the son of Zeruiah)
Bahnar: Sêlek bơngai Ammôn; Naharai bơngai Bêrôt, bơngai chĕp tơmam tơblah Jôap, kon drŏ-nglo Sêruia

English: Ira the Ithrite, Gareb the Ithrite
Bahnar: Ira bơngai Ithrit; Garep kư̆m bơngai Ithrit

English: Uriah the Hittite, Zabad the son of Ahlai
Bahnar: Uri bơngai Hêtit; Sabat, kon drŏ-nglo Ahlai

English: Adina the son of Shiza the Reubenite (a chief of the Reubenites) and thirty with him
Bahnar: Ađina kon drŏ-nglo Sisa, bơngai Rubên, yŏng kơdră adrĕch Rubên, păng đei pêng-jĭt 'nu linh kiơ̆ sư

English: Hanan the son of Maachah, Joshaphat the Mithnite
Bahnar: Hanan, kon drŏ-nglo Maaka; Jôsaphat bơngai Mitnit

English: Uzzia the Ashterathite, Shama and Jeiel the sons of Hotham the Aroerite
Bahnar: Usia bơngai Asterathit. Sama păng Jêiêl, kon drŏ-nglo Hôtham bơngai Arôe

English: Jediael the son of Shimri, and Joha his brother, the Tizite
Bahnar: Jêđiael, kon drŏ-nglo Simri; Jôha, oh sư bơngai Thisit

English: Eliel the Mahavite, Jeribai and Joshaviah the sons of Elnaam, Ithmah the Moabite
Bahnar: Êliel bơngai Mahawit, Jêribai păng Jôsawia, kon drŏ-nglo Êlnaam; Itma bơngai Môap

English: Eliel, Obed, and Jaasiel the Mezobaite.
Bahnar: Êliel, Ôbêt, păng Jaasiel bơngai Mêtsôbait.

English: Now these were the men who came to David at Ziklag while he was still a fugitive from Saul the son of Kish; and they were among the mighty men, helpers in the war
Bahnar: 'Nâu lu bơngai mă kiơ̆ Đawit tơ Siklak sư weh kơ Sôl, kon drŏ-nglo Kis, pơpuh Lu sư lu bơngai linh nuih kơtang mă đei tơgŭm Đawit tơblah wang.

English: armed with bows, using both the right hand and the left in hurling stones and shooting arrows with the bow. They were of Benjamin, Saul’s brethren.
Bahnar: Lu sư tă hơgei prah hră ngăl, gơh yua tơlei hơwơ̆t tơmo, chĕp hră prah 'brơ̆m ti gah 'ma thoi gah 'ngiĕo; đĭ-đăng lu sư adrĕch adrung Sôl, bơngai Bênjamin.

English: The chief was Ahiezer, then Joash, the sons of Shemaah the Gibeathite; Jeziel and Pelet the sons of Azmaveth; Berachah, and Jehu the Anathothite
Bahnar: Ahiser pơm yŏng păng Jôas kon drŏ-nglo Sêma bơngai Gibêah, Jêsiel păng Pêlêt, kon drŏ-nglo Asmawet; Bêraka, Jêhu bơngai Anathôt

English: Ishmaiah the Gibeonite, a mighty man among the thirty, and over the thirty; Jeremiah, Jahaziel, Johanan, and Jozabad the Gederathite
Bahnar: Ismaia đơ̆ng pơlei Gibeôn, bơngai mă nuih pran kơtang pơm yŏng lăm pêng-jĭt 'nu bơngai 'noh, Jêrêmi; Jahasiêl; Jôhanan; Jôsabat bơngai Gêđêra

English: Eluzai, Jerimoth, Bealiah, Shemariah, and Shephatiah the Haruphite
Bahnar: Êlusai, Jêrimôt, Bêalia, Sêmaria, Sêphatia bơngai Haruphit

English: Elkanah, Jisshiah, Azarel, Joezer, and Jashobeam, the Korahites
Bahnar: Êlkana, Isia, Asarel, Jôêser păng Jahôbêam, bơngai Kôrahit

English: and Joelah and Zebadiah the sons of Jeroham of Gedor.
Bahnar: Jôêla păng Sêbađia, kon drŏ-nglo Jêrôham đơ̆ng pơlei Gêđôr

English: Some Gadites joined David at the stronghold in the wilderness, mighty men of valor, men trained for battle, who could handle shield and spear, whose faces were like the faces of lions, and were as swift as gazelles on the mountains
Bahnar: Lăm adrĕch adrung Gat đei lu bơngai năm kiơ̆ Đawit tơ anih kơjăp lăm tơmăn glă; lu sư bơngai nuih pran kơtang, gơh hơgei tơblah, chĕp khêl chĕp tơju. Muh măt lu sư nhen dăm-brang, hơbĕch hơbal nhen thoi juei kơpal kông.

English: Ezer the first, Obadiah the second, Eliab the third
Bahnar: Êser pơm yŏng; Ôbađia pơm yŏng mă 'bar, Êliap pơm yŏng mă pêng

English: Mishmannah the fourth, Jeremiah the fifth
Bahnar: Mismanna pơm yŏng mă puăn, Jêrêmi pơm yŏng mă pơđăm

English: Attai the sixth, Eliel the seventh
Bahnar: Attai pơm yŏng mă tơdrâu, Êliel pơm yŏng mă tơpơh

English: Johanan the eighth, Elzabad the ninth
Bahnar: Jôhanan pơm yŏng mă tơhngam, Êlsabat pơm yŏng mă tơsĭn

English: Jeremiah the tenth, and Machbanai the eleventh.
Bahnar: Jêrêmi pơm yŏng mă mơjĭt, Makbanai pơm yŏng mă mơjĭt-mônh.

English: These were from the sons of Gad, captains of the army; the least was over a hundred, and the greatest was over a thousand.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai âu kon sâu Gat ngăl, păng pơm yŏng pơgơ̆r lu linh; bơngai pơm iĕ pran dang minh-hrĕng 'nu, bơngai pơm tih pran dang minh-rơbâu 'nu bơngai.

English: These are the ones who crossed the Jordan in the first month, when it had overflowed all its banks; and they put to flight all those in the valleys, to the east and to the west.
Bahnar: 'Nâu boih lu bơngai mă tŏk kơ đak Krong Jôrđăn lăm khei mônh, kơplah đak tih lơ̆p blai kơ 'bar pah jih bơnơ̆, blah puh đĭ lu kon pơlei oei lăm thŭng dơnă gah hơlĕch păng gah bơmơ̆t.

English: Then some of the sons of Benjamin and Judah came to David at the stronghold.
Bahnar: Đei mơ'nah bơngai Bênjamin păng Juđa kư̆m năm truh tơ kơđông kơjăp kiơ̆ Đawit.

English: And David went out to meet them, and answered and said to them, “If you have come peaceably to me to help me, my heart will be united with you; but if to betray me to my enemies, since there is no wrong in my hands, may the God of our fathers look and bring judgment.”
Bahnar: Đawit lĕch sơng lu sư păng khan: “Tơdah lu iĕm năm hăm tơdrong hiôk-hian păng wă tơgŭm inh lei jơhngơ̆m inh gô pơgơ̆p hăm lu iĕm; tơdah lu iĕm hơlĕnh blah inh wă tơgŭm kơ lu bơngai ayăt, lei apinh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei 'bok bơ̆n sek lăng păng phak lu iĕm; yua kơ ti inh ưh kơ đei pơm tơdrong kơnê̆ kiơ.”

English: Then the Spirit came upon Amasai, chief of the captains, and he said: “We are yours, O David; We are on your side, O son of Jesse! Peace, peace to you, And peace to your helpers! For your God helps you.” So David received them, and made them captains of the troop.
Bahnar: Na Yang Bơhngol 'lơ̆ng jur tơ Amasai pơm yŏng kơ pêng-jĭt 'nu bơngai, na sư khan: “Ơ Đawit, lu nhôn gah ih ngăl! Ơ kon drŏ-nglo Jese, lu nhôn oei hăm ih! Hiôk-hian, hiôk-hian bĕ kơ ih; hiôk-hian kơ bơngai bu tơgŭm ih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei gô tơgŭm ih!” Na Đawit sơng iŏk lu sư, pơchĕp ăn kơ lu sư pơm yŏng pơgơ̆r linh.

English: And some from Manasseh defected to David when he was going with the Philistines to battle against Saul; but they did not help them, for the lords of the Philistines sent him away by agreement, saying, “He may defect to his master Saul and endanger our heads.”
Bahnar: Kŭm đei lu bơngai khŭl Manase năm kiơ̆ Đawit kơplah sư năm hơdai hăm linh Philistin tơblah hăm Sôl, mă-lei sư hăm lu linh sư ưh kơ đei tơgŭm linh Philistin yua kơ lu bơngai Philistin tơweh Đawit khan: “Hli kơ sư wih hơlơ̆k hăm Sôl, yŏng tơ'ngla sư, pơm kơnê̆ chơ̆ng kơ̆l lu bơ̆n dơ̆ng.

English: When he went to Ziklag, those of Manasseh who defected to him were Adnah, Jozabad, Jediael, Michael, Jozabad, Elihu, and Zillethai, captains of the thousands who were from Manasseh.
Bahnar: Lăp Đawit wih hơlơ̆k tơ Siklak, đei lu bơngai Manase năm kiơ̆ sư: Atnah, Jôsabat, Jêđiael, Mikael, Jôsabat, Êlihu păng Sillethai, lu sư tă kơ pơm yŏng kơ rơbâu 'nu linh lăm adrĕch adrung Manase.”

English: And they helped David against the bands of raiders, for they were all mighty men of valor, and they were captains in the army.
Bahnar: Đei lu sư bơngai tơgŭm Đawit tơblah hăm linh chă iŏk blah tơgar, yua kơ lu sư bơngai nuih pran kơtang păng pơm yŏng pơgơ̆r lu linh.

English: For at that time they came to David day by day to help him, until it was a great army, like the army of God.
Bahnar: Rim năr đei bơngai năm kiơ̆ păng tơgŭm Đawit truh tơ sư đei lu linh lơ tih, nhen thoi linh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: Now these were the numbers of the divisions that were equipped for war, and came to David at Hebron to turn over the kingdom of Saul to him, according to the word of the LORD
Bahnar: 'Nâu lu bơngai linh năm tơ Hêbrôn, wă ăn teh đak Sôl kơ Đawit, kiơ̆ thoi nơ̆r Kră Yang.

English: of the sons of Judah bearing shield and spear, six thousand eight hundred armed for war
Bahnar: Lăm kon sâu Juđa đei tơdrâu-rơbâu tơhngam-hrĕng 'nu bơngai hơmet lê̆ khêl, tơju, wă tơblah.

English: of the sons of Simeon, mighty men of valor fit for war, seven thousand one hundred
Bahnar: Kon sâu Simêôn, đei tơpơh-rơbâu minh-hrĕng 'nu bơngai nuih pran kơtang gơh năm tơblah.

English: of the sons of Levi four thousand six hundred
Bahnar: Kon sâu Lêwi, đei puăn-rơbâu tơdrâu-hrĕng 'nu.

English: Jehoiada, the leader of the Aaronites, and with him three thousand seven hundred
Bahnar: Lăm noh đei Jêhôiada yŏng kơdră adrĕch Arôn păng hăm sư đei pêng-rơbâu tơpơh-hrĕng 'nu bơngai.

English: Zadok, a young man, a valiant warrior, and from his father’s house twenty-two captains
Bahnar: Kŭm đei Sađok, bơngai drŏ-nglo hơ'lơ̆p nuih pran kơtang păng hăm sư đei 'bar-jĭt 'bar 'nu bơngai pơgơ̆r đơ̆ng hnam 'bă sư.

English: of the sons of Benjamin, relatives of Saul, three thousand (until then the greatest part of them had remained loyal to the house of Saul)
Bahnar: Kon sâu Bênjamin, adrĕch Sôl, đei pêng-rơbâu 'nu bơngai mă truh tơ dang ei, đei lơ bơngai lăm lu sư oei kiơ̆ Sôl.

English: of the sons of Ephraim twenty thousand eight hundred, mighty men of valor, famous men throughout their father’s house
Bahnar: Kon sâu Êphraim, đei 'bar-jĭt rơbâu tơhngam-hrĕng 'nu bơngai, tă kơ lu bơngai nuih pran kơtang ngăl đei đe ư-ang lăm adrĕch hnam 'bă sư kơdih.

English: of the half-tribe of Manasseh eighteen thousand, who were designated by name to come and make David king
Bahnar: Minh puăt adrĕch adrung Manase đei mơjĭt-tơhngam rơbâu 'nu bơngai, lu sư đe rơih đei anăn lu sư năm wă pôk Đawit pơm pơtao.

English: of the sons of Issachar who had understanding of the times, to know what Israel ought to do, their chiefs were two hundred; and all their brethren were at their command
Bahnar: Kon sâu Isakar đei lu bơngai băt hlôh khei 'năr păng tơdrong jang kon pơlei Isơrael wă pơm; lu sư đei 'bar-hrĕng 'nu bơngai yŏng pơgơ̆r; na đĭ-đăng lu 'nhŏng oh sư lăm ala kơ lu sư pơgơ̆r.

English: of Zebulun there were fifty thousand who went out to battle, expert in war with all weapons of war, stouthearted men who could keep ranks
Bahnar: Kon sâu Sabulôn đei pơđăm-jĭt rơbâu 'nu bơngai gơh tơblah, chĕp lu tơmam tơblah, hơmet lê̆ wă tơblah, lu sư minh jơhngơ̆m đon hăm Đawit.

English: of Naphtali one thousand captains, and with them thirty-seven thousand with shield and spear
Bahnar: Kon sâu Neptali, đei minh-rơbâu 'nu bơngai yŏng pơgơ̆r lu linh, hăm pêng-jĭt tơpơh-rơbâu 'nu bơngai chĕp khêl păng tơju

English: of the Danites who could keep battle formation, twenty-eight thousand six hundred
Bahnar: Kon sâu Đan, đei 'bar-jĭt tơhngam-rơbâu tơdrâu-hrĕng 'nu bơngai đei đon gơh hơgei kơ tơblah.

English: of Asher, those who could go out to war, able to keep battle formation, forty thousand
Bahnar: Kon sâu Aser, đei puăn-jĭt rơbâu 'nu bơngai gơh hơgei tơblah.

English: of the Reubenites and the Gadites and the half-tribe of Manasseh, from the other side of the Jordan, one hundred and twenty thousand armed for battle with every kind of weapon of war.
Bahnar: Na mă gah Rubên, Gat păng gah minh puăt adrĕch adrung Manase oei gah to đak Krong Jôrđăn, đei minh-hrĕng 'bar-jĭt rơbâu 'nu bơngai chĕp dôm lu tơmam wă tơblah.

English: All these men of war, who could keep ranks, came to Hebron with a loyal heart, to make David king over all Israel; and all the rest of Israel were of one mind to make David king.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai 'nâu lu linh đei đon gơh hơgei kơ tơblah, đei jơhngơ̆m kơjăp nuih năm tơ Hêbrôn wă pôk Đawit pơm pơtao pơgơ̆r đĭ-đăng dêh char Isơrael. Đĭ-đăng lu bơngai Isơrael nai kư̆m dai minh jơhngơ̆m pôk Đawit pơm pơtao.

English: And they were there with David three days, eating and drinking, for their brethren had prepared for them.
Bahnar: Lu sư oei hăm pơtao Đawit pêng năr păng sŏng sa hơdai tơ noh yua kơ 'nhŏng oh lu sư hơmet ăn.

English: Moreover those who were near to them, from as far away as Issachar and Zebulun and Naphtali, were bringing food on donkeys and camels, on mules and oxen—provisions of flour and cakes of figs and cakes of raisins, wine and oil and oxen and sheep abundantly, for there was joy in Israel.
Bahnar: Na lu 'nhŏng oh đơ̆ng ataih truh, đơ̆ng teh đak Isakar, Sabulôn păng Neptali lu sư chơ tơmam sa păng aseh iĕ, lăk-đa, aseh lai păng rơmo, lu sư ba lơ tơpŭng 'bĕng mi, 'bĕng pơlei hơra, hơmu kro, sik, đak rơmă, hăm dui ba rơmo păng triu lơlap lơlang, yua kơ đei tơdrong chơt hiôk lăm dêh char Isơrael.

English: Then David consulted with the captains of thousands and hundreds, and with every leader.
Bahnar: Đawit pơđâu hăm yŏng pơgơ̆r minh-rơbâu linh, yŏng pơgơ̆r minh-hrĕng linh, hăm rim kră pơgơ̆r.

English: And David said to all the assembly of Israel, “If it seems good to you, and if it is of the LORD our God, let us send out to our brethren everywhere who are left in all the land of Israel, and with them to the priests and Levites who are in their cities and their common-lands, that they may gather together to us
Bahnar: Đawit khan kơ đĭ-đăng lu kon pơlei Isơrael: “Tơdah lu iĕm 'bôh tơdrong 'nâu 'lơ̆ng păng lăp đon Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu bơ̆n, lei bơ̆n wơh bơngai năm jơ̆p anih, tơ 'nhŏng oh lu bơ̆n mă oei tơ jơ̆p-jang dêh Isơrael, pơtơm lu 'bok soi păng bơngai Lêwi lăm rim pơlei tơring lu sư wă akŭm hơdai hăm lu bơ̆n.

English: and let us bring the ark of our God back to us, for we have not inquired at it since the days of Saul.”
Bahnar: Na bơ̆n athei tung ba Hom Pơgơ̆p Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei wih tơ lu bơ̆n; yua kơ lăm chăl Sôl, lu bơ̆n ưh kơ đei krao apinh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.”

English: Then all the assembly said that they would do so, for the thing was right in the eyes of all the people.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng tơpôl lu sư lăp đon kơ pơm thoi noh; yua kơ lu sư 'bôh tơdrong noh trŏ 'lơ̆ng.

English: So David gathered all Israel together, from Shihor in Egypt to as far as the entrance of Hamath, to bring the ark of God from Kirjath Jearim.
Bahnar: Na Đawit krao akŭm hloi đĭ-đăng bơngai Isơrael, đơ̆ng Sihô lăm char Êyiptơ truh tơ 'măng jang Hamat, wă năm iŏk Hom Pơgơ̆p Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei đơ̆ng Kiriat Jêarim wih.

English: And David and all Israel went up to Baalah, to Kirjath Jearim, which belonged to Judah, to bring up from there the ark of God the LORD, who dwells between the cherubim, where His name is proclaimed.
Bahnar: Đawit păng đĭ-đăng bơngai Isơrael năm hơdai sư tŏk tơ Baala noh Kiriat Jêarim, lăm dêh Juđa, wă kơ năm iŏk hom pơgơ̆p krao Anăn noh Kră Yang Tih Hloh Tơ'ngla dan tang-dŏ Sư sơlam kơ chêrubim.

English: So they carried the ark of God on a new cart from the house of Abinadab, and Uzza and Ahio drove the cart.
Bahnar: Lu sư tung iŏk Hom Pơgơ̆p Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei đơ̆ng hnam Abinađap, tah atŏk tơ kơpal gre rơmo 'nao; na Usa păng Ahiô dui rơmo hor gre.

English: Then David and all Israel played music before God with all their might, with singing, on harps, on stringed instruments, on tambourines, on cymbals, and with trumpets.
Bahnar: Pơtao Đawit păng đĭ-đăng bơngai Isơrael đĭ jơhngơ̆m chơt hiôk 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, hơri, reh brŏ, ot brŏ, teh hơgơ̆r iĕ, preh chhar păng hlôm keng hiôk chơt.

English: And when they came to Chidon’s threshing floor, Uzza put out his hand to hold the ark, for the oxen stumbled.
Bahnar: Lăp lu sư truh tơ cham pơjuă 'ba Kiđôn, Usa hiŏng ti sư rôp hom pơgơ̆p, yua kơ rơmo kơtơih tơsĕr.

English: Then the anger of the LORD was aroused against Uzza, and He struck him because he put his hand to the ark; and he died there before God.
Bahnar: Kră Yang hil dêh kơ Usa păng Kră Yang pơlôch hloi sư, yua kơ sư rôp 'bơm hom pơgơ̆p; na sư lôch hloi tơ noh 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: And David became angry because of the LORD’s outbreak against Uzza; therefore that place is called Perez Uzza to this day.
Bahnar: Na Đawit ưh kơ lăp đon, yua kơ Kră Yang pơlôch Usa; sư krao anih noh Pêrês Usa, mă truh dang ei oei krao anăn 'noh.

English: David was afraid of God that day, saying, “How can I bring the ark of God to me?”
Bahnar: Lăm 'năr 'noh, Đawit hli kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei na apinh khan: “Lơliơ Inh gơh iŏk Hom Pơgơ̆p Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei tơmơ̆t tơ hnam inh?”

English: So David would not move the ark with him into the City of David, but took it aside into the house of Obed-Edom the Gittite.
Bahnar: Na Đawit ưh kơ tung iŏk Hom Pơgơ̆p Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei tơmơ̆t tơ lăm hnam sư tơ lăm pơlei Đawit, mă-lei tung ba Hom Pơgơ̆p Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei tơ lăm hnam Ôbêt Eđôm, bơngai Gitit.

English: The ark of God remained with the family of Obed-Edom in his house three months. And the LORD blessed the house of Obed-Edom and all that he had.
Bahnar: Hom pơgơ̆p Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lăm hnam Ôbêt Eđôm pêng khei Kră Yang tuh tơdrong pŭn hiôk lăm hnam Ôbêt Eđôm păng dôm tơmam sư đei.

English: Now Hiram king of Tyre sent messengers to David, and cedar trees, with masons and carpenters, to build him a house.
Bahnar: Hiram, pơtao Tirơ, wơh bơngai năm tơ pơtao Đawit, hăm gơih ăn kơ sư 'long hơngo, bơngai man, bơngai jang 'long, wă pơm hnam pơtao ăn kơ sư.

English: So David knew that the LORD had established him as king over Israel, for his kingdom was highly exalted for the sake of His people Israel.
Bahnar: Đawit băt kơ Kră Yang ăn kơ sư pơm pơtao lu bơngai Isơrael. Teh đak sư rai tih rai să yua kơ Isơrael kon pơlei Kră Yang.

English: Then David took more wives in Jerusalem, and David begot more sons and daughters.
Bahnar: Lăm Jêrusalem Đawit đei iŏk lơ akăn plơ̆ng, păng pơjing kơ lơ kon drŏ-nglo kon drŏ-kăn.

English: And these are the names of his children whom he had in Jerusalem: Shammua, Shobab, Nathan, Solomon
Bahnar: 'Nâu anăn lu kon sư pơjing tơ Jêrusalem: Sammua, Sôbap, Nathan, Sôlômôn

English: Ibhar, Elishua, Elpelet
Bahnar: Iphar, Êlisua, Êlpêlek

English: Nogah, Nepheg, Japhia
Bahnar: Nôga, Nêphet, Japhia

English: Elishama, Beeliada, and Eliphelet.
Bahnar: Êlisama, Bêeliađa păng Êliphêlet.

English: Now when the Philistines heard that David had been anointed king over all Israel, all the Philistines went up to search for David. And David heard of it and went out against them.
Bahnar: Lăp kon pơlei Philistin kơtơ̆ng Đawit đe tuh pơgang 'bâu phu pôk pơm pơtao kơ đĭ-đăng lu bơngai Isơrael, na đĭ-đăng bơngai Philistin năm chă sư; pơtao Đawit kơtơ̆ng tơdrong noh, sư năm sơng hloi lu sư.

English: Then the Philistines went and made a raid on the Valley of Rephaim.
Bahnar: Kon pơlei Philistin năm truh, blah pơrăm Thŭng Rêphaim.

English: And David inquired of God, saying, “Shall I go up against the Philistines? Will You deliver them into my hand?” The LORD said to him, “Go up, for I will deliver them into your hand.”
Bahnar: Đawit krao apinh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei khan: “Inh hăm gơh năm blah kon pơlei Philistin ưh? Ih hăm pơjao lu sư lăm ti inh ưh?” Kră Yang tơl nơ̆r sư: “Năm bĕ; Inh gô pơjao lu sư lăm ti ih.”

English: So they went up to Baal Perazim, and David defeated them there. Then David said, “God has broken through my enemies by my hand like a breakthrough of water.” Therefore they called the name of that place Baal Perazim.
Bahnar: Na Đawit hăm lu buăl sư tŏk năm tơ Baal Phêrasim, na tơ noh Đawit blah lu linh Philistin jei sư; Đawit khan: “Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei đei yua ti inh blah pơchah lê̆ lu bơngai ayăt kơ inh, nhen thoi đak blŭng kơ bơnơ̆ pơchah.” Thoi noh na đe krao anih noh Baal Pêrasim.

English: And when they left their gods there, David gave a commandment, and they were burned with fire.
Bahnar: Bơngai Philistin achăng hŭt lê̆ lu rup yang lu sư tơ anih 'noh; na Đawit athei soh pơđĭ lê̆ lăm ŭnh.

English: Then the Philistines once again made a raid on the valley.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Philistin năm pơrăm lăm thŭng dơnă.

English: Therefore David inquired again of God, and God said to him, “You shall not go up after them; circle around them, and come upon them in front of the mulberry trees.
Bahnar: Na Đawit krao apinh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei dơ̆ng; Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei tơl nơ̆r sư: “Ih 'nĕ kơ năm tơpăt lu sư, athei năm dăr đơ̆ng rŏng na blah lu sư tơ anăp kơdrơ̆ng 'long hơngo bri.

English: And it shall be, when you hear a sound of marching in the tops of the mulberry trees, then you shall go out to battle, for God has gone out before you to strike the camp of the Philistines.”
Bahnar: Lăp ih kơtơ̆ng jơ̆ng sư nơnăm yak lăm kơdrơ̆ng 'long hơngo bri, lei ih năm blah hloi, yua kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei năm adrol kơ ih wă tơblah lu linh Philistin.”

English: So David did as God commanded him, and they drove back the army of the Philistines from Gibeon as far as Gezer.
Bahnar: Na Đawit pơm thoi nơ̆r Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă ăn; păng lu sư blah pơrăm lu linh Philistin đơ̆ng Gibeôn truh tơ Geser.

English: Then the fame of David went out into all lands, and the LORD brought the fear of him upon all nations.
Bahnar: Anăn Đawit kơtơ̆ng ư-ang jơ̆p-jang kơ teh đak; Kră Yang pơm ăn kơ lu khŭl kon pơlei pơla hli kơ Đawit.

English: David built houses for himself in the City of David; and he prepared a place for the ark of God, and pitched a tent for it.
Bahnar: Đawit pơm hnam pơtao kơ sư kơdih lăm pơlei Đawit păng hơmet lê̆ minh anih wă 'măn Hom Pơgơ̆p Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: Then David said, “No one may carry the ark of God but the Levites, for the LORD has chosen them to carry the ark of God and to minister before Him forever.”
Bahnar: Kơplah noh Đawit khan 'nguaih kơ bơngai Lêwi, ưh kơ đei bơngai bu gơh tung Hom Pơgơ̆p Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, yua kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei rơih iŏk boih lu sư wă tung Hom Pơgơ̆p Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei păng bơ̆jang kơ Kră Yang ling-lang.

English: And David gathered all Israel together at Jerusalem, to bring up the ark of the LORD to its place, which he had prepared for it.
Bahnar: Đawit krao akŭm đĭ-đăng bơngai Isơrael brŏk tơ pơlei Jêrusalem, wă iŏk Hom Pơgơ̆p Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei 'măn tơ anih mă sư hơmet boih.

English: Then David assembled the children of Aaron and the Levites
Bahnar: Đawit krao akŭm lu kon sâu Arôn păng Lêwi.

English: of the sons of Kohath, Uriel the chief, and one hundred and twenty of his brethren
Bahnar: Gah adrĕch adrung Kôhat đei Uriel, pơm yŏng pơgơ̆r păng lu 'nhŏng oh sư, đei minh-hrĕng 'bar-jĭt 'nu

English: of the sons of Merari, Asaiah the chief, and two hundred and twenty of his brethren
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng adrĕch adrung Mêrari đei Asaia, bơngai pơgơ̆r păng lu 'nhŏng oh sư, đei 'bar-hrĕng 'bar-jĭt 'nu.

English: of the sons of Gershom, Joel the chief, and one hundred and thirty of his brethren
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng adrĕch adrung Gersôm đei Jôel, yŏng pơgơ̆r păng lu 'nhŏng oh sư, đei minh-hrĕng pêng-jĭt 'nu.

English: of the sons of Elizaphan, Shemaiah the chief, and two hundred of his brethren
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng adrĕch adrung Êlisaphan đei Sêmaia, yŏng pơgơ̆r păng lu 'nhŏng oh sư, đei 'bar-hrĕng 'nu.

English: of the sons of Hebron, Eliel the chief, and eighty of his brethren
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng adrĕch adrung Hêbrôn đei Êliel, yŏng pơgơ̆r păng lu 'nhŏng oh sư đei tơhngam-jĭt 'nu

English: of the sons of Uzziel, Amminadab the chief, and one hundred and twelve of his brethren.
Bahnar: đơ̆ng adrĕch adrung Usiel đei Aminađap, yŏng pơgơ̆r păng lu 'nhŏng oh sư đei minh-hrĕng mơjĭt-'bar 'nu.

English: And David called for Zadok and Abiathar the priests, and for the Levites: for Uriel, Asaiah, Joel, Shemaiah, Eliel, and Amminadab.
Bahnar: Đawit krao 'bok soi Sađok, Abiathar păng lu bơngai Lêwi đei Uriel, Asaia, Jôel, Sêmaia, Êliel păng Aminađap.

English: He said to them, “You are the heads of the fathers’ houses of the Levites; sanctify yourselves, you and your brethren, that you may bring up the ark of the LORD God of Israel to the place I have prepared for it.
Bahnar: Sư khan kơ đe noh: “Lu iĕm bơngai yŏng pơgơ̆r lăm adrĕch adrung Lêwi; iĕm athei hơmet akâu iĕm hăm lu 'nhŏng oh iĕm mă 'lơ̆ng rơgoh wă tung Hom Pơgơ̆p Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Isơrael ba tơ anih mă inh đei hơmet lê̆ boih.

English: For because you did not do it the first time, the LORD our God broke out against us, because we did not consult Him about the proper order.”
Bahnar: Yua kơ adrol ki, lu iĕm ưh kơ tung ba hom Kră Yang yua kơ lu bơ̆n ưh kơ đei krao apinh Sư thoi Sư đei pơkă, na Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei hil mĭl pơrăm lê̆ lu bơ̆n.”

English: So the priests and the Levites sanctified themselves to bring up the ark of the LORD God of Israel.
Bahnar: Na lu 'bok soi păng bơngai Lêwi hơmet akâu kơdih 'lơ̆ng rơgoh na tung ba Hom Pơgơ̆p Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Isơrael.

English: And the children of the Levites bore the ark of God on their shoulders, by its poles, as Moses had commanded according to the word of the LORD.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Lêwi iŏk 'long tơnung tung Hom Pơgơ̆p Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei tơ kơpal hơngiĕng, thoi Môis bơtho khan kiơ̆ kơ nơ̆r Kră Yang.

English: Then David spoke to the leaders of the Levites to appoint their brethren to be the singers accompanied by instruments of music, stringed instruments, harps, and cymbals, by raising the voice with resounding joy.
Bahnar: Đawit pơkă ăn kơ lu bơngai pơgơ̆r lăm lu bơngai Lêwi, athei rơih iŏk lăm 'nhŏng oh lu sư, lu bơngai hơri, reh brŏ dung, tĭng-nĭng, preh chhar hơri chơt hiôk.

English: So the Levites appointed Heman the son of Joel; and of his brethren, Asaph the son of Berechiah; and of their brethren, the sons of Merari, Ethan the son of Kushaiah
Bahnar: Na bơngai Lêwi athei hloi Hêman kon drŏ-nglo Jôel đơ̆ng lăm lu 'nhŏng oh sư, Asap, kon drŏ-nglo Bêrekia, đơ̆ng lu bơngai Mêrari, iŏk Êthan, kon drŏ-nglo Kusaia

English: and with them their brethren of the second rank: Zechariah, Ben, Jaaziel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Unni, Eliab, Benaiah, Maaseiah, Mattithiah, Elipheleh, Mikneiah, Obed-Edom, and Jeiel, the gatekeepers
Bahnar: hơdai hăm lu sư kư̆m đei lu 'nhŏng oh sư lăm khŭl mă 'bar, Sachari, Jaasiêl, Sêmiramôt, Jêhiêl, Unni, Êliap, Bênaia, Maasêia, Matithia, Êliphêlêhu, Miknêia, Ôbêt Eđôm păng Jêiêl, mă bơngai gak 'măng jang.

English: the singers, Heman, Asaph, and Ethan, were to sound the cymbals of bronze
Bahnar: Lu bơngai hơri, Hêman, Asap păng Êthan, preh chhar kong.

English: Zechariah, Aziel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Unni, Eliab, Maaseiah, and Benaiah, with strings according to Alamoth
Bahnar: Sachari, Asiêl, Sêmiramôt, Jêhiêl, Unni, Êliap, Maasêia păng Bênaia, yua tĭng-nĭng reh kiơ̆ kơ tơ'nguơ̆ Alamôt

English: Mattithiah, Elipheleh, Mikneiah, Obed-Edom, Jeiel, and Azaziah, to direct with harps on the Sheminith
Bahnar: Matithia, Êliphêlêhu, Miknêia, Ôbêt Eđôm, Jêiêl păng Asasia, lu sư yua reh brŏ dung kiơ̆ kơ tơ'nguơ̆ Semini.

English: Chenaniah, leader of the Levites, was instructor in charge of the music, because he was skillful
Bahnar: Kênania yŏng pơgơ̆r bơngai Lêwi, wei-lăng tơdrong hơri păng noh tơdrong jang sư, yua kơ sư gơh hơgei gah tơdrong noh.

English: Berechiah and Elkanah were doorkeepers for the ark
Bahnar: Bêrekia păng Êlkana, gak 'măng anăp kơ hom pơgơ̆p.

English: Shebaniah, Joshaphat, Nethanel, Amasai, Zechariah, Benaiah, and Eliezer, the priests, were to blow the trumpets before the ark of God; and Obed-Edom and Jehiah, doorkeepers for the ark.
Bahnar: Sêbania, Jôsaphat, Nêthanêl, Amasai, Sachari, Bênaia, păng Êliêser, lu 'bok soi, hlôm keng 'bơ̆t anăp Hom Pơgơ̆p Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei. Ôbêt Eđôm păng Jêhiia gak 'măng 'bơ̆t anăp hom pơgơ̆p.

English: So David, the elders of Israel, and the captains over thousands went to bring up the ark of the covenant of the LORD from the house of Obed-Edom with joy.
Bahnar: Na, Đawit, lu kră bơngai Isơrael păng lu yŏng pơgơ̆r minh-rơbâu linh, năm tung ba Hom Pơgơ̆p Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei đơ̆ng hnam Ôbêt Eđôm hăm tơdrong hiôk chơt.

English: And so it was, when God helped the Levites who bore the ark of the covenant of the LORD, that they offered seven bulls and seven rams.
Bahnar: Yua kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei tơgŭm lu bơngai Lêwi tung ba Hom Pơgơ̆p Kră Yang, na pơyơ̆r tơmam soi tơpơh tŏ rơmo tơno, păng tơpơh tŏ triu tơno.

English: David was clothed with a robe of fine linen, as were all the Levites who bore the ark, the singers, and Chenaniah the music master with the singers. David also wore a linen ephod.
Bahnar: Đawit păng lu bơngai Lêwi tung hom pơgơ̆p, lu bơngai hơri, Kênania, yŏng pơgơ̆r lu bơngai hơri, tă kơ hrŭk ao tai che 'bui ngăl; Đawit kư̆m hrŭk tơ akâu sư minh blah ao êphot păng che 'bui.

English: Thus all Israel brought up the ark of the covenant of the LORD with shouting and with the sound of the horn, with trumpets and with cymbals, making music with stringed instruments and harps.
Bahnar: Na đĭ-đăng bơngai Isơrael năm tung Hom Pơgơ̆p Kră Yang hăm nơ̆r jreo tơkĕch hiôk chơt, kơtơ̆ng jơwa hlôm keng păng jơwa tơgiĕp preh chhar reh tĭng-nĭng păng brŏ dung.

English: And it happened, as the ark of the covenant of the LORD came to the City of David, that Michal, Saul’s daughter, looked through a window and saw King David whirling and playing music; and she despised him in her heart.
Bahnar: Lăp Hom Pơgơ̆p Kră Yang truh mơ̆t tơ lăm pơlei Đawit, na Mikal, kon drŏ-kăn Sôl, lăng đơ̆ng 'măng-'mŏk, 'bôh pơtao Đawit yŭn suang hiôk chơt, na lăm jơhngơ̆m sư areh ưh kơ lăp đon.

English: So they brought the ark of God, and set it in the midst of the tabernacle that David had erected for it. Then they offered burnt offerings and peace offerings before God.
Bahnar: Lu sư tung ba Hom Pơgơ̆p Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei păng dan 'măn sư lăm bơsŭn mă Đawit pơdơ̆ng. Lu sư kư̆m pơyơ̆r tơmam soi 'buh păng tơmam soi pơyơ̆r hiôk-hian 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: And when David had finished offering the burnt offerings and the peace offerings, he blessed the people in the name of the LORD.
Bahnar: Đang kơ pơyơ̆r tơmam soi 'buh hăm tơmam soi pơyơ̆r tơdrong hiôk-hian, Đawit sư yua hăm anăn Kră Yang, sơkat pŭn hiôk ăn kơ kon pơlei pơla.

English: Then he distributed to everyone of Israel, both man and woman, to everyone a loaf of bread, a piece of meat, and a cake of raisins.
Bahnar: Na asong ăn kơ đĭ-đăng kon pơlei Isơrael drŏ-nglo drŏ-kăn rim 'nu minh pôm 'bĕng mi, minh kơnăt 'nhĕm, păng minh pôm 'bĕng plei hơmu kro.

English: And he appointed some of the Levites to minister before the ark of the LORD, to commemorate, to thank, and to praise the LORD God of Israel
Bahnar: Sư ăn mơ'nah lu bơngai Lêwi bơ̆jang awih awăn 'bơ̆t anăp Hom Pơgơ̆p Kră Yang, wă krao khan bơnê kơkuh kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Isơrael.

English: Asaph the chief, and next to him Zechariah, then Jeiel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Mattithiah, Eliab, Benaiah, and Obed-Edom: Jeiel with stringed instruments and harps, but Asaph made music with cymbals
Bahnar: Asap pơgơ̆r tơm Sachari kơiĕng tơgŭm sư, păng đei Jêiel, Sêmiramôt, Jêhiel, Mathihia, Êliap, Bênaia, Ôbêt, Êdôm hăm Jêiêl tơdrong jang sư reh brŏ reh tĭng-nĭng păng brŏ dung Asap preh chhar

English: Benaiah and Jahaziel the priests regularly blew the trumpets before the ark of the covenant of God.
Bahnar: Bênaia hăm Jahasiêl bre sư 'bok soi lu hlôm keng ling-lang 'bơ̆t anăp Hom Pơgơ̆p Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: On that day David first delivered this psalm into the hand of Asaph and his brethren, to thank the LORD
Bahnar: 'Bơ̆t năr noh Đawit pơjao ăn blŭng-a kơ Asap hăm lu 'nhŏng oh sư jang hơri bơnê kơ Kră Yang.

English: Oh, give thanks to the LORD! Call upon His name; Make known His deeds among the peoples!
Bahnar: Bơnê bĕ kơ Kră Yang, krao khan hăm anăn Sư. Roi tơbăt bĕ tơdrong jang Sư pơm boih lăm lu kon pơlei.

English: Sing to Him, sing psalms to Him; Talk of all His wondrous works!
Bahnar: Hơri bĕ kơ sư, hơri bơnê bĕ kơ sư. Ră roi bĕ dôm tơdrong jang hlĭch chrơp Sư!

English: Glory in His holy name; Let the hearts of those rejoice who seek the LORD!
Bahnar: Ư-ang bĕ anăn rơgoh 'lơ̆ng Sư; Ăn jơhngơ̆m lu đe bu chă Kră Yang đei tơdrong chhôk hơnôk.

English: Seek the LORD and His strength; Seek His face evermore!
Bahnar: Chă bĕ Kră Yang hăm tơdrong pran kơtang Sư. Chă bĕ muh măt Sư ling-lang!

English: Remember His marvelous works which He has done, His wonders, and the judgments of His mouth
Bahnar: 'Blŏk bĕ tơdrong jang hlĭch chrơp Sư đei pơm bơih. Tơdrong hlĭch chrơp Sư păng tơdrong Sư sek tơlang.

English: O seed of Israel His servant, You children of Jacob, His chosen ones!
Bahnar: Ơ adrĕch adrung Isơrael đĭch đam Sư, ơ lu kon sâu Jakôp mă sư rơih iŏk bơih!

English: He is the LORD our God; His judgments are in all the earth.
Bahnar: Sư boih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei bơ̆n; Sư sek tơlang jơ̆p-jang kơ teh đak.

English: Remember His covenant forever, The word which He commanded, for a thousand generations
Bahnar: Sư 'blŏk ling-lang tơdrong Sư pơgơ̆p, nơ̆r Sư pơkă truh tơ rơbâu jơhnơr

English: The covenant which He made with Abraham, And His oath to Isaac
Bahnar: Tơdrong Sư pơgơ̆p hăm Abraham, tơdrong sư pơkăm bơih hăm Isăk.

English: And confirmed it to Jacob for a statute, To Israel for an everlasting covenant
Bahnar: Tơdrong juăt Sư pơkăm pơkă bơih hăm Jakôp, tơdrong pơgơ̆p Sư ling-lang hăm Isơrael.

English: Saying, “To you I will give the land of Canaan As the allotment of your inheritance,”
Bahnar: Sư khan: “Inh gô ăn kơ lu iĕm char Kanaan. Jing teh lu iĕm jang sa.”

English: When you were few in number, Indeed very few, and strangers in it.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh lu sư oei tŏ sĕt đe jô̆ ưh kơ kăl ôh. Păng lu sư chă oei pơdơh tơ noh 'biơ̆ đĕch.

English: When they went from one nation to another, And from one kingdom to another people
Bahnar: Chă thông hoang đơ̆ng dêh char âu năm tơ teh đak to, đơ̆ng kon pơlei pơla âu, năm tơ pơlei pơla to.

English: He permitted no man to do them wrong; Yes, He rebuked kings for their sakes
Bahnar: Sư ưh kơ ăn bu pơjuă kơtĭt lu sư. Sư chrih hil kơ lu pơtao yua kơ lu sư.

English: Saying, “Do not touch My anointed ones, And do My prophets no harm.”
Bahnar: 'Nĕ hơtŭt kơ bơngai Inh đei tuh bơih đak rơmă 'bâu phu. “Păng 'nĕ pơm kơnê̆ kơ lu bơngai khan lê̆ adrol Inh!”

English: Sing to the LORD, all the earth; Proclaim the good news of His salvation from day to day.
Bahnar: Ơ đĭ-đăng bơngai kơpal teh đak, hơri bơnê bĕ kơ Kră Yang. Rim năr roi bĕ tơdrong Sư dŏng pơklaih.

English: Declare His glory among the nations, His wonders among all peoples.
Bahnar: Roi pơdah bĕ tơdrong ư-ang Sư tơ lăm lu adrĕch adrung bơngai. Tơdrong hlĭch Sư pơm bơih tơ lăm đĭ-đăng kon pơlei.

English: For the LORD is great and greatly to be praised; He is also to be feared above all gods.
Bahnar: Yua kơ Kră Yang tih krưp tơpă, trŏ kơkuh bơnê. Trŏ kơ hli pơyom hloh kơ đĭ-đăng lu yang.

English: For all the gods of the peoples are idols, But the LORD made the heavens.
Bahnar: Yua kơ đĭ-đăng yang lu kon pơlei chă pơm rup đĕch. Mă-lei Kră Yang pơjing lu tăl plĕnh.

English: Honor and majesty are before Him; Strength and gladness are in His place.
Bahnar: 'Bơ̆t anăp Sư noh rang mơnhal 'lơ̆ng rŏ krưp; lăm anih sư oei đei mơsêh mơyang pran kơtang hiôk chơt.

English: Give to the LORD, O families of the peoples, Give to the LORD glory and strength.
Bahnar: Ơ lu adrĕch adrung kon pơlei, pôk pơư bĕ kơ Kră Yang. Kră Yang ư-ang pran kơtang!

English: Give to the LORD the glory due His name; Bring an offering, and come before Him. Oh, worship the LORD in the beauty of holiness!
Bahnar: Pôk pơư bĕ kơ Kră Yang tơdrong ư-ang lăp kơ anăn Sư. Chĕp ba bĕ tơmam soi pơyơ̆r 'bơ̆t anăp Sư! Kơkuh pơyom bĕ kơ Kră Yang lăm tơdrong 'lơ̆ng rơgoh Sư.

English: Tremble before Him, all the earth. The world also is firmly established, It shall not be moved.
Bahnar: Hli tơtơ̆ bĕ 'bơ̆t anăp Sư, ơ đĭ-đăng teh đak; Tơpă, Sư pơjing teh đak oei kơjăp, ưh kơ đei tơdrŏ tơdrĕnh.

English: Let the heavens rejoice, and let the earth be glad; And let them say among the nations, “The LORD reigns.”
Bahnar: Ơ lu tăl plĕnh chơt hiôk bĕ, ơ teh đak 'nă hal bĕ. Ơ kon pơlei oei lăm teh đak roi pơdah bĕ. “Kră Yang tơ'ngla pơgơ̆r.”

English: Let the sea roar, and all its fullness; Let the field rejoice, and all that is in it.
Bahnar: Ăn kơ đak dơsĭ păng đĭ-đăng tơmam lăm dơsĭ ôr bĕ. Ăn kơ chŭn mir păng đĭ-đăng tơmam lăm noh hiôk chơt.

English: Then the trees of the woods shall rejoice before the LORD, For He is coming to judge the earth.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh đĭ-đăng 'long pơle lăm bri gô hơri hăm tơdrong chơt hiôk, 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang, Yua kơ Sư jur wă sek tơlang kơ teh đak.

English: Oh, give thanks to the LORD, for He is good! For His mercy endures forever.
Bahnar: Bơnê bĕ kơ Kră Yang, yua kơ Sư pơm 'lơ̆ng. Tơdrong Sư 'mêm mơnat oei ling-lang khŏm khŏm!

English: And say, “Save us, O God of our salvation; Gather us together, and deliver us from the Gentiles, To give thanks to Your holy name, To triumph in Your praise.”
Bahnar: Khan bĕ. “Pơklaih nhôn bĕ, ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Tơ'ngla dŏng pơklaih lu nhôn. Akŭm păng pơklaih bĕ lu nhôn đơ̆ng lăm lu dêh char wă kơ nhôn gơh hơri bơnê kơ anăn 'lơ̆ng rơgoh Ih. Na nhôn đei ư-ang kơ Ih lăm tơdrong hơri bơnê kơ Ih.”

English: Blessed be the LORD God of Israel From everlasting to everlasting! And all the people said, “Amen!” and praised the LORD.
Bahnar: Bơnê kơ Kră Yang, 'Bok Kei-Dei Isơrael. Trŏ hơri ư-ang ling-lang. Đĭ-đăng lu kon pơlei pơla khan bĕ: “A-men! Bơnê kơkuh kơ Kră Yang.”

English: So he left Asaph and his brothers there before the ark of the covenant of the LORD to minister before the ark regularly, as every day’s work required
Bahnar: Đawit pôk Asap hăm lu 'nhŏng oh sư oei kơtă tơ noh 'bơ̆t anăp hom pơgơ̆p Kră Yang wă bơ̆jang ling-lang 'bơ̆t anăp hom pơgơ̆p kiơ̆ trŏ thoi đêl hơgăt.

English: and Obed-Edom with his sixty-eight brethren, including Obed-Edom the son of Jeduthun, and Hosah, to be gatekeepers
Bahnar: Lei-lăi mơ̆n sư kư̆m pôk Ôbêt Eđôm hăm tơdrâu-jĭt tơhngam 'nu 'nhŏng oh sư Ôbêt Eđôm kon drŏ-nglo Jêđuthun hăm Hôsa ăn kơ sư wei gak 'măng dur.

English: and Zadok the priest and his brethren the priests, before the tabernacle of the LORD at the high place that was at Gibeon
Bahnar: Sư lê̆ Sađok 'bok soi hăm lu 'nhŏng oh sư pơm 'bok soi 'bơ̆t anăp bơsŭn anih akŭm Kră Yang lăm anih kơjung tơ pơlei Gibeôn.

English: to offer burnt offerings to the LORD on the altar of burnt offering regularly morning and evening, and to do according to all that is written in the Law of the LORD which He commanded Israel
Bahnar: Wă kơ pơyơ̆r tơmam soi 'buh kơ Kră Yang tơ kơpal chơnang soi 'buh ling-lang pơgê hăm kơsơ̆, kiơ̆ thoi đei chih lăm tơdrong juăt Kră Yang pơkă bơih kơ lu bơngai Isơrael.

English: and with them Heman and Jeduthun and the rest who were chosen, who were designated by name, to give thanks to the LORD, because His mercy endures forever
Bahnar: Hơdai hăm lu sư đei Hêman hăm Jêđuthun păng lu bơngai nai mă đei rơih hăm 'măn lu sư jang kơkuh bơnê kơ Kră Yang “kơ tơdrong sư 'mêm mơnat oei oei ling-lang khŏm khŏm.”

English: and with them Heman and Jeduthun, to sound aloud with trumpets and cymbals and the musical instruments of God. Now the sons of Jeduthun were gatekeepers.
Bahnar: Hêman hăm Jêđuthun hlôm keng, preh chhar, hăm yua lu tơmam nai wă hơri kơkuh kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei. Lu kon drŏ-nglo Jêduthun tơdrong jang lu sư wei gak 'măng jang.

English: Then all the people departed, every man to his house; and David returned to bless his house.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu kon pơlei wih brŏk tơ hnam lu sư kơdih; gah Đawit wih tơ hnam wă sơkat pŭn hiôk kơ hnam dơnŏ sư.

English: Now it came to pass, when David was dwelling in his house, that David said to Nathan the prophet, “See now, I dwell in a house of cedar, but the ark of the covenant of the LORD is under tent curtains.”
Bahnar: Lăp Đawit oei lăm hnam pơtao sư boih, Đawit khan kơ Nathan bơngai khan lê̆ adrol: “Âu inh oei lăm hnam pơtao pơm păng 'long hơngo, mă-lei Hom Pơgơ̆p Kră Yang tơ lăm bơsŭn.”

English: Then Nathan said to David, “Do all that is in your heart, for God is with you.”
Bahnar: Nathan tơl Đawit. “Pơm bĕ tơdrong kiơ ih wă, yua kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei oei hơdai hăm ih.”

English: But it happened that night that the word of God came to Nathan, saying
Bahnar: Lăm măng noh mơ̆n Kră Yang pơma dơnuh hăm Nathan na khan.

English: “Go and tell My servant David, ‘Thus says the LORD: “You shall not build Me a house to dwell in.
Bahnar: “Năm roi bĕ kơ đĭch đam Inh Đawit,” 'Nâu Kră Yang khan: Ih ưh kơ đei pơm ăn kơ Inh hnam wă oei ôh.

English: For I have not dwelt in a house since the time that I brought up Israel, even to this day, but have gone from tent to tent, and from one tabernacle to another.
Bahnar: Inh ưh tam mă oei ôh lăm hnam đơ̆ng năr Inh chông tơlĕch lu bơngai Isơrael đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ truh tơ năr âu, Inh năm đơ̆ng bơsŭn âu tơ bơsŭn nai, đơ̆ng anih oei âu tơ anih oei nai.

English: Wherever I have moved about with all Israel, have I ever spoken a word to any of the judges of Israel, whom I commanded to shepherd My people, saying, ‘Why have you not built Me a house of cedar–’ ” ’
Bahnar: Lăm jơ̆p-jang anih Inh năm hơdai hăm lu bơngai Isơrael bơih. Inh hăm lah pơma hăm kră pơgơ̆r Isơrael, bơngai mă Inh đei athei boih wei kon pơlei Inh khan: “Thoi yơ iĕm ưh kơ đei pơm kơ Inh minh pôm hnam hăm 'long hơngo?”

English: Now therefore, thus shall you say to My servant David, ‘Thus says the LORD of hosts: “I took you from the sheepfold, from following the sheep, to be ruler over My people Israel.
Bahnar: Na dang ei khan bĕ kơ Đawit đĭch đam Inh Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan: Inh iŏk ih đơ̆ng dơnih 'nhĕt, đơ̆ng bơngai wei triu wă kơ ih pơm kră wei-lăng pơgơ̆r kon pơlei Inh bơngai Isơrael.

English: And I have been with you wherever you have gone, and have cut off all your enemies from before you, and have made you a name like the name of the great men who are on the earth.
Bahnar: Inh đei oei hơdai hăm ih boih tơ rim anih ih năm păng Inh pơlôch đĭ-đăng lu ayăt 'bơ̆t anăp ih; păng Inh gô ăn anăn ih ư-ang nhen thoi anăn lu bơngai pơm tih hloh lăm teh đak

English: Moreover I will appoint a place for My people Israel, and will plant them, that they may dwell in a place of their own and move no more; nor shall the sons of wickedness oppress them anymore, as previously
Bahnar: Inh gô ăn anih kơ kon pơlei pơla Inh Isơrael. Inh gô pơtăm lu sư tơ noh, wă kơ lu sư đei pơlei oei wă kơ đe huay pă đei pơrŭng lu sư boih, hăm wă kơ lu bơngai kơnê̆ pă đei năm pơrăm lu sư dơ̆ng, thoi chăl adrol sơ̆

English: since the time that I commanded judges to be over My people Israel. Also I will subdue all your enemies. Furthermore I tell you that the LORD will build you a house.
Bahnar: đơ̆ng chăl Inh ăn đei kră pơgơ̆r wei-lăng kon pơlei pơla Inh Isơrael păng Inh gô ăn đĭ-đăng lu ayăt chu yom kiơ̆ ih. “Inh roi ăn kơ ih băt Kră Yang gô pơm ăn kơ dêh char pơtao ih kơjăp.

English: And it shall be, when your days are fulfilled, when you must go to be with your fathers, that I will set up your seed after you, who will be of your sons; and I will establish his kingdom.
Bahnar: Truh năr ih wă tôch lôch năm oei hơdai hăm lu 'bok ih, Inh gô pôk hơtŏk minh 'nu pơtrơp ih, minh 'nu lăm lu kon drŏ-nglo ih pơtrơp đơ̆ng ih, păng Inh gô ăn kơ dêh char sư kơjăp.

English: He shall build Me a house, and I will establish his throne forever.
Bahnar: Sư boih gô pơm minh pôm hnam kơ Inh păng Inh gô ăn tang-dŏ pơtao sư kơjăp ling-lang.

English: I will be his Father, and he shall be My son; and I will not take My mercy away from him, as I took it from him who was before you.
Bahnar: Inh jing 'bă sư păng sư jing kon drŏ-nglo Inh, Inh ưh kơ đei pơdrâu iŏk ôh tơdrong Inh 'mêm đơ̆ng sư, thoi inh pơdrâu iŏk đơ̆ng bơngai adrol kơ ih.

English: And I will establish him in My house and in My kingdom forever; and his throne shall be established forever.” ’ ”
Bahnar: Inh gô pơm kơ sư kơjăp lăm hnam Inh hăm lăm dêh char pơtao Inh ling-lang, tang-dŏ pơtao sư gô kơjăp ling-lang.”

English: According to all these words and according to all this vision, so Nathan spoke to David.
Bahnar: Nathan roi đĭ-đăng tơdrong tơ'bôh nơ̆r tơtă kơ Đawit.

English: Then King David went in and sat before the LORD; and he said: “Who am I, O LORD God? And what is my house, that You have brought me this far?
Bahnar: Na pơtao Đawit mơ̆t păng hơ-oei 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang păng khan: “Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei inh âu bu păng hnam dơnŏ inh liơ na Ih mah ba inh truh tơ âu?

English: And yet this was a small thing in Your sight, O God; and You have also spoken of Your servant’s house for a great while to come, and have regarded me according to the rank of a man of high degree, O LORD God.
Bahnar: Tơdrong âu Ih lăng thoi oei iĕ đĕch 'bơ̆t anăp Ih, Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, Ih kư̆m đei roi mơ̆n kơ dêh char pơtao đĭch đam Ih tơ anăp âu kơnh păng lăng inh thoi bơngai đei đe pơyom hloh, Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: What more can David say to You for the honor of Your servant? For You know Your servant.
Bahnar: “Đawit ưh pă băt wă bơnê kơ Kră Yang thoi yơ dơ̆ng, yua kơ đơ̆ng Ih pơyom kơ đĭch đam Ih? Yua kơ Ih băt nhen kơ đĭch đam Ih.

English: O LORD, for Your servant’s sake, and according to Your own heart, You have done all this greatness, in making known all these great things.
Bahnar: Yua kơ đĭch đam ih boih, Ơ Kră Yang, kiơ̆ thoi Ih wă, Ih đei pơm boih tơdrong tih âu ăn kơ inh băt đĭ-đăng tơdrong pơkă tih âu.

English: O LORD, there is none like You, nor is there any God besides You, according to all that we have heard with our ears.
Bahnar: Ưh kơ đei bu thoi Ih ôh, ơ Kră Yang păng ưh kơ đei Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei nai thoi Ih, kiơ̆ thoi đon lu nhôn đei kơtơ̆ng boih.

English: And who is like Your people Israel, the one nation on the earth whom God went to redeem for Himself as a people—to make for Yourself a name by great and awesome deeds, by driving out nations from before Your people whom You redeemed from Egypt?
Bahnar: Hăm đei kon pơlei ayơ lăm teh đak âu nhen thoi lu kon pơlei Ih Isơrael, Ih năm dơ̆ng pơklaih minh kon pơlei pơla kơ Ih kơdih pơm kơ anăn Ih kơdih tih-tin krưp tơpă trŏ kơ đe hli yom, kơplah Ih pơpuh tơweh lu adrĕch adrung nai 'bơ̆t anăp lu kon pơlei Ih, hăm tơdrong mơsêh mơyang kon pơlei Ih mă đei dŏng pơklaih boih đơ̆ng char Êyiptơ?

English: For You have made Your people Israel Your very own people forever; and You, LORD, have become their God.
Bahnar: Ih rơih boih kon pơlei Ih Isơrael jing kon pơlei pơla Ih kơdih ling-lang khŏm khŏm păng Ih boih ơ Kră Yang, 'Bok Kei-Dei lu sư.

English: “And now, O LORD, the word which You have spoken concerning Your servant and concerning his house, let it be established forever, and do as You have said.
Bahnar: Dang ei, ơ Kră Yang ăn kơ nơ̆r Ih pơkă pơ'ngam kơ đĭch đam Ih hăm hnam dơnŏ sư oei kơjăp ling-lang khŏm khŏm, apinh Ih pơm bĕ kiơ̆ thoi Ih đei pơkă boih

English: So let it be established, that Your name may be magnified forever, saying, ‘The LORD of hosts, the God of Israel, is Israel’s God.’ And let the house of Your servant David be established before You.
Bahnar: wă kơ Anăn Ih kơjăp tih hăm oei đei ling-lang khŏm khŏm. Đe gô khan: Kră Yang Tih Hloh, 'noh 'Bok Kei-Dei Isơrael, 'noh boih jing Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Isơrael păng ăn kơ hnam Đawit đĭch đam Ih, mă ih đei pơjing kơjăp ling-lang 'bơ̆t anăp Ih.

English: For You, O my God, have revealed to Your servant that You will build him a house. Therefore Your servant has found it in his heart to pray before You.
Bahnar: Ih boih Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei inh, tơ'bôh boih kơ đĭch đam Ih khan Ih gô pơm ăn kơ sư hnam, thoi noh đĭch đam Ih pơ̆n krao khan 'bơ̆t anăp Ih.

English: And now, LORD, You are God, and have promised this goodness to Your servant.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang, Ih boih 'Bok Kei-Dei, Ih pơkă boih tơdrong 'lơ̆ng âu kơ đĭch đam Ih.

English: Now You have been pleased to bless the house of Your servant, that it may continue before You forever; for You have blessed it, O LORD, and it shall be blessed forever.”
Bahnar: Ih hiôk ăn tơdrong pŭn hiôk kơ hnam đĭch đam Ih, wă kơ sư gơh oei đei ling-lang khŏm khŏm 'bơ̆t anăp Ih, yua kơ, ơ Kră Yang, tơmam kiơ ih ăn pŭn hiôk, gô đei pŭn hiôk ling-lang khŏm khŏm!”

English: After this it came to pass that David attacked the Philistines, subdued them, and took Gath and its towns from the hand of the Philistines.
Bahnar: Đang kơ noh Đawit tơblah hăm lu bơngai Philistin jei sư, păng lu sư chu kiơ̆, păng blah iŏk pơlei Gat hăm đĭ-đăng lu pơlei iĕ jum dăr đơ̆ng lu Philistin.

English: Then he defeated Moab, and the Moabites became David’s servants, and brought tribute.
Bahnar: Đawit tơblah hăm Môap jei sư, bơngai Môap chu kiơ̆ Đawit păng ra jên ăn kơ sư.

English: And David defeated Hadadezer king of Zobah as far as Hamath, as he went to establish his power by the River Euphrates.
Bahnar: Đawit tơblah hăm Hadadêser pơtao Sôba truh tơ pơlei Hamat, kơplah sư pơjing kơjăp tơdrong sư wei-lăng truh tơ đak Krong Ơphrat.

English: David took from him one thousand chariots, seven thousand horsemen, and twenty thousand foot soldiers. Also David hamstrung all the chariot horses, except that he spared enough of them for one hundred chariots.
Bahnar: Đawit blah tơgar iŏk minh-rơbâu tŏ gre aseh, tơpơh-rơbâu linh hao aseh păng 'bar-jĭt rơbâu linh yak jơ̆ng. Đawit chơ̆ng đĭ huan kơchôp jơ̆ng aseh dui gre, mă-lei oei lê̆ minh-hrĕng tŏ aseh.

English: When the Syrians of Damascus came to help Hadadezer king of Zobah, David killed twenty-two thousand of the Syrians.
Bahnar: Kơplah lu linh Siri đơ̆ng pơlei Đamas năm dŏng Hadadêser pơtao Sôba, Đawit pơlôch 'bar-jĭt 'bar-rơbâu linh Siri.

English: Then David put garrisons in Syria of Damascus; and the Syrians became David’s servants, and brought tribute. So the LORD preserved David wherever he went.
Bahnar: Đawit pơm kơđông linh lăm char Siri tơ pơlei Đamas hai păng lu bơngai Siri chu kiơ̆ Đawit păng ra jên ăn kơ sư Kră Yang ăn kơ Đawit truh tơ yơ tơblah jei sư tơ noh.

English: And David took the shields of gold that were on the servants of Hadadezer, and brought them to Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Đawit iŏk lu khêl maih đơ̆ng lu yŏng linh Hadadêser chĕp năm ba tơ pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: Also from Tibhath and from Chun, cities of Hadadezer, David brought a large amount of bronze, with which Solomon made the bronze Sea, the pillars, and the articles of bronze.
Bahnar: Đawit kư̆m blah iŏk mam kong lơ dêh, đơ̆ng pơlei Tiba hăm pơlei Kun lăm teh đak Hadadêser; mam kong noh pơtao Sôlômôn yua pơm bơng mong đak, jrăng păng lu tơmam yua nai.

English: Now when Tou king of Hamath heard that David had defeated all the army of Hadadezer king of Zobah
Bahnar: Lăp Tou pơtao Hamat, kơtơ̆ng Đawit blah pơrăm lu linh Hadadêser pơtao Sôba jei sư

English: he sent Hadoram his son to King David, to greet him and bless him, because he had fought against Hadadezer and defeated him (for Hadadezer had been at war with Tou); and Hadoram brought with him all kinds of articles of gold, silver, and bronze.
Bahnar: Tou pơtao Hamat wơh kon drŏ-nglo sư Hadôram năm tơ pơtao Đawit kơkuh bơnê kơ sư yua tơblah hăm Hadadêser jei sư; Hadadêser kư̆m ngăl tơblah hăm Tou ling-lang. Hadôram chĕp ba tôm tơmam pơm hăm maih, hăm hu, hăm kong kơ Đawit.

English: King David also dedicated these to the LORD, along with the silver and gold that he had brought from all these nations—from Edom, from Moab, from the people of Ammon, from the Philistines, and from Amalek.
Bahnar: Pơtao Đawit pơyơ̆r lu tơmam noh kơ Kră Yang hơdai hăm hu, maih mă sư đei blah iŏk đơ̆ng char Eđôm, char Môap char Ammôn, char Philistin, hăm char Amalek.

English: Moreover Abishai the son of Zeruiah killed eighteen thousand Edomites in the Valley of Salt.
Bahnar: Abisai kon drŏ-nglo Sêruia pơlôch mơjĭt-tơhngam rơbâu lu bơngai Eđôm lăm Thŭng dơnă 'Boh.

English: He also put garrisons in Edom, and all the Edomites became David’s servants. And the LORD preserved David wherever he went.
Bahnar: Sư pơm kơđông linh lăm char Eđôm; păng đĭ lu bơngai Eđôm chu kiơ̆ Đawit. Kră Yang ăn kơ Đawit tơblah jei sư ngăl tơ rim anih mă sư năm.

English: So David reigned over all Israel, and administered judgment and justice to all his people.
Bahnar: Đawit pơm pơtao pơgơ̆r đĭ-đăng bơngai Isơrael; sư pơm dôm tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt, tơdrong trŏ hăm đĭ-đăng lu kon pơlei sư.

English: Joab the son of Zeruiah was over the army; Jehoshaphat the son of Ahilud was recorder
Bahnar: Jôap kon drŏ-nglo Sêruia yŏng kơ đĭ-đăng lu linh, păng Jêhôsaphat, kon drŏ-nglo Ahilut jing tơ'ngla chih răk dôm tơdrong truh.

English: Zadok the son of Ahitub and Abimelech the son of Abiathar were the priests; Shavsha was the scribe
Bahnar: Sadok kon drŏ-nglo Ahitup păng Ahimalek kon drŏ-nglo Abiathar pơm 'bok soi, Sausa jing kră tơm chih hla bơar.

English: Benaiah the son of Jehoiada was over the Cherethites and the Pelethites; and David’s sons were chief ministers at the king’s side.
Bahnar: Bênaia kon drŏ-nglo Jêhôiada pơgơ̆r lu bơngai Kêrêthit hăm lu Pêlithit; lu kon drŏ-nglo Đawit jing yŏng pơgơ̆r lăm tơdrong jang pơtao.

English: It happened after this that Nahash the king of the people of Ammon died, and his son reigned in his place.
Bahnar: Đunh 'biơ̆ đơ̆ng noh Nahas pơtao Ammôn lôch. Kon drŏ-nglo sư pơm pơtao pơgơ̆r pơtrơp sư.

English: Then David said, “I will show kindness to Hanun the son of Nahash, because his father showed kindness to me.” So David sent messengers to comfort him concerning his father. And David’s servants came to Hanun in the land of the people of Ammon to comfort him.
Bahnar: Đawit khan: “Inh gô pơm 'lơ̆ng hăm Hanun kon drŏ-nglo Nahas, yua kơ 'bă sư pơm 'lơ̆ng hăm inh.” Na Đawit wơh lu bơngai năm hơpong wă pơlung sư, yua kơ đei tơdrong truh kơ 'bă sư. Lu jơ̆ng 'bang Đawit năm truh tơ Hanun lăm char Ammôn wă ngôi pơlung sư.

English: And the princes of the people of Ammon said to Hanun, “Do you think that David really honors your father because he has sent comforters to you? Did his servants not come to you to search and to overthrow and to spy out the land?”
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu yŏng linh Ammôn khan kơ Hanun: “Ih ngeh kơ Đawit wơh lu bơngai năm ngôi pơlung ih, wă pơyom kơ 'bă ih hă? Ưh kơ trŏ ôh hă lu jơ̆ng 'bang sư năm tơ ih chă chop lăng wă blơ̆ blah iŏk char âu?”

English: Therefore Hanun took David’s servants, shaved them, and cut off their garments in the middle, at their buttocks, and sent them away.
Bahnar: Thoi noh Hanun rôp lu jơ̆ng 'bang Đawit hơkôih lê̆ sŏk kang, hăm kăt lê̆ ao sư minh puăt truh tơ kơiĕng đang kơ noh tơbrŏk lu sư wih.

English: Then some went and told David about the men; and he sent to meet them, because the men were greatly ashamed. And the king said, “Wait at Jericho until your beards have grown, and then return.”
Bahnar: Đe roi kơ Đawit tơdrong truh kơ đe noh, sư wơh bơngai năm sơng lu đe noh, yua kơ lu đe noh mơlâu dêh păng pơtao khan: “Lu iĕm oei tơ pơlei Jêrikô dĭng sŏk kang iĕm bluh 'mơ̆i na lu iĕm brŏk.”

English: When the people of Ammon saw that they had made themselves repulsive to David, Hanun and the people of Ammon sent a thousand talents of silver to hire for themselves chariots and horsemen from Mesopotamia, from Syrian Maacah, and from Zobah.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Ammôn băt tơdrong sư pơm ăn kơ Đawit 'bâu chhok. Hanun păng lu bơngai Ammôn gơih minh-rơbâu talâng jên hu wă apah gre aseh păng lu linh hao gre aseh đơ̆ng char Aram Naharaim, Aram Maaka, đơ̆ng char Sôba.

English: So they hired for themselves thirty-two thousand chariots, with the king of Maacah and his people, who came and encamped before Medeba. Also the people of Ammon gathered together from their cities, and came to battle.
Bahnar: Lu sư apah pêng-jĭt 'bar-rơbâu gre aseh, bơngai chĕp gre aseh, pơtao Maaka hăm lu linh sư; lu sư năm pơm kơđông jê̆ tơ pơlei Mêdêba, lu đe Ammôn đơ̆ng lu pơlei lu sư năm akŭm băl păng lĕch năm tơblah.

English: Now when David heard of it, he sent Joab and all the army of the mighty men.
Bahnar: Đawit kơtơ̆ng thoi noh na sư wơh Jôap hăm đĭ-đăng lu linh nuih pran sư.

English: Then the people of Ammon came out and put themselves in battle array before the gate of the city, and the kings who had come were by themselves in the field.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Ammôn lĕch năm tơblah 'bơ̆t 'măng jang pơlei, lu pơtao nai sư oei dan linh sư tơ lăm bri tơmăn.

English: When Joab saw that the battle line was against him before and behind, he chose some of Israel’s best and put them in battle array against the Syrians.
Bahnar: Jôap 'bôh đe dă linh gah anăp gah rŏng sư, sư rơih lu linh hơgei đơ̆ng lăm bơngai Isơrael, năm găn tơblah hăm lu linh Siri.

English: And the rest of the people he put under the command of Abishai his brother, and they set themselves in battle array against the people of Ammon.
Bahnar: Oei đei lu linh sư pơjao ăn kơ oh sư Abisai răp tơblah hăm lu bơngai Ammôn.

English: Then he said, “If the Syrians are too strong for me, then you shall help me; but if the people of Ammon are too strong for you, then I will help you.
Bahnar: Jôap khan: “Mưh linh Siri pran hloh kơ ĭnh, ih năm dŏng inh; mă-lei mưh linh Ammôn pran hloh kơ ih, inh gô năm dŏng ih.

English: Be of good courage, and let us be strong for our people and for the cities of our God. And may the LORD do what is good in His sight.”
Bahnar: Athei mă nuih pran kơtang bĕ tơblah ăn kơ kon pơlei pơla bơ̆n păng kơ pơlei Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei bơ̆n, Kră Yang gô pơm tơdrong kiơ 'lơ̆ng kiơ̆ thoi măt sư lăng lăp.”

English: So Joab and the people who were with him drew near for the battle against the Syrians, and they fled before him.
Bahnar: Thoi noh Jôap hăm lu linh hơdai sư năm blah lu linh Siri; lu linh Siri kơdâu đĭ 'bơ̆t anăp lu sư.

English: When the people of Ammon saw that the Syrians were fleeing, they also fled before Abishai his brother, and entered the city. So Joab went to Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Khŭl linh Ammôn 'bôh lu linh Siri kơdâu boih, lu sư kư̆m kơdâu đơ̆ng anăp Abisai oh Jôap, lu sư mơ̆t lăm pơlei, na Jôap brŏk tơ pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: Now when the Syrians saw that they had been defeated by Israel, they sent messengers and brought the Syrians who were beyond the River, and Shophach the commander of Hadadezer’s army went before them.
Bahnar: Wă lu bơngai Siri 'bôh jei linh Isơrael lu sư thuơ boih, lu sư wơh bơngai năm sơng lu linh Siri gah to đak Krong Ơphrat đei Sophach yŏng linh Hadadêser jing bơngai ba trong lu sư.

English: When it was told David, he gathered all Israel, crossed over the Jordan and came upon them, and set up in battle array against them. So when David had set up in battle array against the Syrians, they fought with him.
Bahnar: Mưh đe roi kơ Đawit tơdrong noh sư pơpôi akŭm đĭ-đăng lu linh bơngai Isơrael tŏk kơ đak Krong Jôrđăn năm tơblah, pơrĕng lu linh sư tơklă lu linh wă tơblah lu ayăt. Mưh Đawit pơrĕng lu linh sư hăm lu linh Siri, lu linh Siri blah plơ̆ hloi.

English: Then the Syrians fled before Israel; and David killed seven thousand charioteers and forty thousand foot soldiers of the Syrians, and killed Shophach the commander of the army.
Bahnar: Lu linh Siri kơdâu kơ lu linh Isơrael Đawit pơlôch tơpơh-rơbâu 'nu linh hao gre aseh, puăn-jĭt rơbâu 'nu linh Siri yak jơ̆ng, pơlôch hloi Sôphach yŏng linh lu sư.

English: And when the servants of Hadadezer saw that they were defeated by Israel, they made peace with David and became his servants. So the Syrians were not willing to help the people of Ammon anymore.
Bahnar: Mưh lu pơtao kiơ̆ Hadadêser 'bôh lu sư thuơ kơ lu bơngai Isơrael, lu sư apinh pơgơ̆p hiôk-hian hăm Đawit kiơ̆ sư. Lu bơngai Siri ưh kơ wă dŏng lu bơngai Ammôn dơ̆ng.

English: It happened in the spring of the year, at the time kings go out to battle, that Joab led out the armed forces and ravaged the country of the people of Ammon, and came and besieged Rabbah. But David stayed at Jerusalem. And Joab defeated Rabbah and overthrew it.
Bahnar: Bơyan choh pơtăm lăm sơnăm noh kơplah lu pơtao lĕch năm wă tơblah, Jôap ba lu linh pơrăm lăm char Ammôn, sư năm wang pơlei Rapba mă-lei Đawit oei tơ pơlei Jêrusalem. Jôap blah pơlei Rapba păng pơrăm đĭ-đăng.

English: Then David took their king’s crown from his head, and found it to weigh a talent of gold, and there were precious stones in it. And it was set on David’s head. Also he brought out the spoil of the city in great abundance.
Bahnar: Đawit plôh iŏk môk pơtao đơ̆ng kơ̆l pơtao lu sư, trăp pêng-jĭt puăn kĭ maih, yơ̆l kơpal kơ̆l pơtao lăm môk pơtao noh tah găr tơmo gĭt, đe pơyơ̆l môk pơtao noh tơ kơpal kơ̆l Đawit, sư đei blah tơgar iŏk tơmam đơ̆ng lăm pơlei lơ dêh.

English: And he brought out the people who were in it, and put them to work with saws, with iron picks, and with axes. So David did to all the cities of the people of Ammon. Then David and all the people returned to Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Sư chông ba lu kon pơlei đơ̆ng pơlei noh, ăn kơ lu sư bơ̆jang hăm hơnuă, hăm hơbol bơsei păng sung bơsei. Đawit pơm thoi noh kơ đĭ-đăng pơlei lu bơngai Ammôn. Đang kơ noh Đawit hăm đĭ-đăng kon pơlei sư wơ̆t brŏk tơ pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: Now it happened afterward that war broke out at Gezer with the Philistines, at which time Sibbechai the Hushathite killed Sippai, who was one of the sons of the giant. And they were subdued.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ noh đei tơdrong tơblah hăm lu bơngai Philistin tơ pơlei Geser. Sêbêkai bơngai Husatit pơlôch Sipai minh 'nu lăm lu kon sâu bơngai Rephait, hăm lu Philistin mơ̆t kiơ̆ bơ̆jang kơ lu sư.

English: Again there was war with the Philistines, and Elhanan the son of Jair killed Lahmi the brother of Goliath the Gittite, the shaft of whose spear was like a weaver’s beam.
Bahnar: Păng đei tơblah dơ̆ng hăm lu bơngai Philistin; Êlhanan kon drŏ-nglo Jair pơlôch Lahmi oh drŏ-nglo Gôliat minh 'nu bơngai Gitit. Gơ̆r tơju sư tih tŏ 'long không đe tanh brai.

English: Yet again there was war at Gath, where there was a man of great stature, with twenty-four fingers and toes, six on each hand and six on each foot; and he also was born to the giant.
Bahnar: Đei minh tơdrong tơblah dơ̆ng tơ pơlei Gat. Tơ noh đei minh 'nu drŏ-nglo akâu jăn tih kơjung, đei tơdrâu tŏ hơnglâu ti păng đei tơdrâu tŏ hơnglâu jơ̆ng. Hơnglâu sư đei đĭ-đăng 'bar-jĭt puăn tŏ sư kư̆m kon sâu bơngai Rapha.

English: So when he defied Israel, Jonathan the son of Shimea, David’s brother, killed him.
Bahnar: Sư blei hiap bơngai Isơrael mă-lei Jônathan kon drŏ-nglo Simêa 'nhŏng Đawit pơlôch sư.

English: These were born to the giant in Gath, and they fell by the hand of David and by the hand of his servants.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai 'nâu lu kon sâu bơngai Rapha lăm pơlei Gat. Lu sư lôch kơ Đawit păng lu linh sư pơlôch.

English: Now Satan stood up against Israel, and moved David to number Israel.
Bahnar: Yang Satan iung pơm kơ Isơrael păng pơdrŭt Đawit wă kơ jô̆ kơ̆l bơngai Isơrael.

English: So David said to Joab and to the leaders of the people, “Go, number Israel from Beersheba to Dan, and bring the number of them to me that I may know it.”
Bahnar: Đawit khan kơ Jôap păng lu yŏng pơgơ̆r linh sư: Năm jô̆ bĕ đĭ lu bơngai Isơrael, đơ̆ng pơlei Bêrsêba truh tơ char Đan. Brŏk roi kơ inh. Wă kơ inh băt dôm yơ lu sư.

English: And Joab answered, “May the LORD make His people a hundred times more than they are. But, my lord the king, are they not all my lord’s servants? Why then does my lord require this thing? Why should he be a cause of guilt in Israel?”
Bahnar: Mă-lei Jôap khan: “Apinh Kră Yang pơthim kon pơlei pơla Sư minh-hrĕng wơ̆t lơ hloh! Ơ yŏng pơtao inh, ưh kơ trŏ đĭ-đăng lu sư jing kon pơlei ih hă? Yua kơ kiơ ih wă pơm tơdrong âu? Ih wă kơ bơngai Isơrael pơm yoch hă?”

English: Nevertheless the king’s word prevailed against Joab. Therefore Joab departed and went throughout all Israel and came to Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Mă-lei jei nơ̆r pơtao tơtă hloh kơ nơ̆r Jôap găn, na Jôap năm tơ jơ̆p-jang kơ dêh char Isơrael wơ̆t brŏk dơ̆ng tơ pơlei Jêrusalem

English: Then Joab gave the sum of the number of the people to David. All Israel had one million one hundred thousand men who drew the sword, and Judah had four hundred and seventy thousand men who drew the sword.
Bahnar: Jôap roi ăn gơsô̆ kơ̆l kon bơngai kơ pơtao Đawit. Đĭ kơ bơngai Isơrael đei minh-triê̆u minh-hrĕng rơbâu bơngai drŏ-nglo gơh chĕp đao hơlă lăm noh bơngai Juđa đei puăn-hrĕng tơpơh-jĭt rơbâu 'nu bơngai gơh chĕp đao hơlă.

English: But he did not count Levi and Benjamin among them, for the king’s word was abominable to Joab.
Bahnar: Mă-lei tam mă đei jô̆ ôh bơngai Lêwi hăm Bênjamin yua kơ Jôap lăng krưp dêh kơ nơ̆r pơtao tơtă.

English: And God was displeased with this thing; therefore He struck Israel.
Bahnar: Nơ̆r tơtă âu jơ̆ minh nơ̆r tơtă kơnê̆ dêh 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei na sư phak pơmat lu bơngai Isơrael.

English: So David said to God, “I have sinned greatly, because I have done this thing; but now, I pray, take away the iniquity of Your servant, for I have done very foolishly.”
