Bahnar: Đawit hơdrĭ 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei na khan: “Inh pơm yoch tih dêh bơih inh pơm tơdrong âu. Apinh ih 'nĕ jô̆ kơ tơdrong yoch đơ̆ng đĭch đam Ih, yua kơ inh pơm hăm tơdrong kơhlôh dêh.”

English: Then the LORD spoke to Gad, David’s seer, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Gat, bơngai khan lê̆ adrol kơ Đawit.

English: “Go and tell David, saying, ‘Thus says the LORD: “I offer you three things; choose one of them for yourself, that I may do it to you.” ’ ”
Bahnar: “Năm khan bĕ kơ Đawit: Kră Yang khan thoi âu. Inh ăn kơ ih pêng tơdrong: Rơih iŏk bĕ minh lăm pêng tơdrong noh wă kơ Inh pơm.”

English: So Gad came to David and said to him, “Thus says the LORD: ‘Choose for yourself
Bahnar: Gat năm roi kơ Đawit. Kră Yang khan. ‘Ih athei rơih iŏk.’

English: either three years of famine, or three months to be defeated by your foes with the sword of your enemies overtaking you, or else for three days the sword of the LORD—the plague in the land, with the angel of the LORD destroying throughout all the territory of Israel.’ Now consider what answer I should take back to Him who sent me.”
Bahnar: Pêng sơnăm pơngot rơwĕt dah pêng khei đei lu ayăt blah pơrăm đĭ, dah pêng năr đei đao gưm Kră Yang phak, đei tơdrong jĭ lôch hơbuh lăm char ih, linh jang 'lơ̆ng đơ̆ng Kră Yang pơrăm jơ̆p-jang dêh char Isơrael. Dang ei ih rơih iŏk ayơ wă kơ inh wih roi kơ Tơ'ngla mă wơh inh năm.

English: And David said to Gad, “I am in great distress. Please let me fall into the hand of the LORD, for His mercies are very great; but do not let me fall into the hand of man.”
Bahnar: “Đawit khan kơ Gat. Inh glăi dêh; ăn kơ inh huŏng lăm tơpang ti Kră Yang yua kơ tơdrong Sư 'mêm mơnat tih dêh; 'nĕ ăn kơ inh huŏng lăm ti kon bơngai.”

English: So the LORD sent a plague upon Israel, and seventy thousand men of Israel fell.
Bahnar: Na Kră Yang ăn tơdrong jĭ lôch hơbuh truh tơ lu bơngai Isơrael; đei tơpơh-jĭt rơbâu 'nu drŏ-nglo Isơrael lôch.

English: And God sent an angel to Jerusalem to destroy it. As he was destroying, the LORD looked and relented of the disaster, and said to the angel who was destroying, “It is enough; now restrain your hand.” And the angel of the LORD stood by the threshing floor of Ornan the Jebusite.
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei wơh linh jang 'lơ̆ng năm pơrăm pơlei Jêrusalem. Mă-lei kơplah lu linh jang 'lơ̆ng oei năm pơrăm pơlei Jêrusalem, Kră Yang sơ'ngon 'bôh kơ tơdrong pơrăm tih 'nâu; sư khan kơ linh jang 'lơ̆ng mă oei pơrăm: “Dôm bơih, gơ̆t ti ih.” Kơplah noh linh jang 'lơ̆ng dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anih preh 'ba Ôrnan bơngai Jêbus.

English: Then David lifted his eyes and saw the angel of the LORD standing between earth and heaven, having in his hand a drawn sword stretched out over Jerusalem. So David and the elders, clothed in sackcloth, fell on their faces.
Bahnar: Đawit lăng 'bôh linh jang 'lơ̆ng Kră Yang dơ̆ng tŏk-bŏk teh hăm plĕnh. Ti sư chĕp đao yơ̆r tơ gah pơlei Jêrusalem. Kơplah noh Đawit hăm kră pơlei hrŭk 'bi sơtơ̆p kŭl-tăng kŭp muh măt tơ teh.

English: And David said to God, “Was it not I who commanded the people to be numbered? I am the one who has sinned and done evil indeed; but these sheep, what have they done? Let Your hand, I pray, O LORD my God, be against me and my father’s house, but not against Your people that they should be plagued.”
Bahnar: Đawit Krao Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei: “Hăm trŏ inh athei đe jô̆ kon pơlei? Inh bơih pơm tơdrong yoch kơnê̆ dêh? Bĕ lu triu âu hăm đei pơm kiơ ưh? Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei inh, apinh ih phak inh păng hnam dơnŏ inh, 'nĕ ăn tơdrong jĭ lôch hơbuh pơm kơ kon pơlei pơla Ih.”

English: Therefore, the angel of the LORD commanded Gad to say to David that David should go and erect an altar to the LORD on the threshing floor of Ornan the Jebusite.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh linh jang 'lơ̆ng Kră Yang khan kơ Gat athei khan kơ Đawit: Ih athei năm pơm minh pôm chơnang soi kơ Kră Yang tơ anih pơjuă 'ba Ôrnan bơngai Jêbus.”

English: So David went up at the word of Gad, which he had spoken in the name of the LORD.
Bahnar: Thoi noh Đawit tŏk năm kiơ̆ thoi Gat khan hăm anăn Kră Yang.

English: Now Ornan turned and saw the angel; and his four sons who were with him hid themselves, but Ornan continued threshing wheat.
Bahnar: Ôrnan oei pơjuă 'ba, sư lăng tơ rŏng 'bôh linh jang 'lơ̆ng, puăn 'nu kon drŏ-nglo sư oei kơdâu ôn.

English: So David came to Ornan, and Ornan looked and saw David. And he went out from the threshing floor, and bowed before David with his face to the ground.
Bahnar: Đawit năm tơ Ôrnan, Ôrnan lăng wă 'bôh Đawit sư lĕch đơ̆ng anih pơjuă 'ba păng drap bon kơkuh kơ Đawit.

English: Then David said to Ornan, “Grant me the place of this threshing floor, that I may build an altar on it to the LORD. You shall grant it to me at the full price, that the plague may be withdrawn from the people.”
Bahnar: Đawit khan kơ Ôrnan: “Tĕch ăn kơ inh anih pơjuă 'ba âu, inh wă man chơnang soi kơ Kră Yang 'bơ̆t âu wă kơ tơdrong lôch hơbuh huay pă truh kơ kon pơlei pơla. Inh răt kiơ̆ kơ ih lăp.”

English: But Ornan said to David, “Take it to yourself, and let my lord the king do what is good in his eyes. Look, I also give you the oxen for burnt offerings, the threshing implements for wood, and the wheat for the grain offering; I give it all.”
Bahnar: Ôrnan drơ̆ng Đawit: “Iŏk wăi. Apinh yŏng tơ'ngla inh iŏk pơm bĕ kiơ̆ thoi Kră Yang lăp đon Inh kư̆m ăn rơmo pơm tơmam soi pơyơ̆r 'buh tơ̆r lơ̆k pơjuă 'ba pơm 'long ŭnh, 'ba mi pơm tơmam soi phe 'ba, inh gô pơyơ̆r đĭ-đăng.”

English: Then King David said to Ornan, “No, but I will surely buy it for the full price, for I will not take what is yours for the LORD, nor offer burnt offerings with that which costs me nothing.”
Bahnar: Pơtao Đawit tơl Ôrnan. “Ưh ôh inh ưh kơ wă ôh iŏk tơmam ih wă pơyơ̆r kơ Kră Yang inh gô ăn jên tôm, inh ưh kơ gơh ôh gô pơyơ̆r tơmam soi 'buh mă ưh kơ huach kiơ.”

English: So David gave Ornan six hundred shekels of gold by weight for the place.
Bahnar: Thoi noh Đawit ăn tơdrâu-hrĕng Seikơl maiha wă răt anih noh.

English: And David built there an altar to the LORD, and offered burnt offerings and peace offerings, and called on the LORD; and He answered him from heaven by fire on the altar of burnt offering.
Bahnar: Đawit pơm minh pôm chơnang soi kơ Kră Yang tơ noh păng pơyơ̆r tơmam soi 'buh păng pơyơ̆r tơmam soi apinh hiôk hiam, krao apinh Kră Yang, Kră Yang tơl tơwih kơ sư hăm ŭnh đơ̆ng plĕnh huŏng 'bơ̆t kơpal chơnang soi pơyơ̆r tơmam soi 'buh.

English: So the LORD commanded the angel, and he returned his sword to its sheath.
Bahnar: Kră Yang athei linh jang 'lơ̆ng, tah lê̆ đao lăm hơnglop sư.

English: At that time, when David saw that the LORD had answered him on the threshing floor of Ornan the Jebusite, he sacrificed there.
Bahnar: Kơplah Đawit 'bôh Kră Yang tơl tơwih boih nơ̆r sư krao apinh tơ anih pơjuă 'ba Ôrnan bơngai Jêbus, sư pơyơ̆r tơmam soi tơ noh.

English: For the tabernacle of the LORD and the altar of the burnt offering, which Moses had made in the wilderness, were at that time at the high place in Gibeon.
Bahnar: Yua kơ lăm chăl noh bơsŭn anih akŭm Kră Yang mă Môis đei pơm tơ lăm char glă, păng chơnang soi tơmam soi 'buh tơ anih kơjung tơ pơlei Gibeôn

English: But David could not go before it to inquire of God, for he was afraid of the sword of the angel of the LORD.
Bahnar: Đawit ưh kơ gơh năm tơ noh wă krao apinh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei yua kơ sư hli kơ đao gưm linh jang 'lơ̆ng Kră Yang.

English: Then David said, “This is the house of the LORD God, and this is the altar of burnt offering for Israel.”
Bahnar: Na Đawit khan. “'Bơ̆t âu gô pơm hnam Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei; păng 'bơ̆t âu boih anih chơnang soi 'buh kơ lu bơngai Isơrael.”

English: So David commanded to gather the aliens who were in the land of Israel; and he appointed masons to cut hewn stones to build the house of God.
Bahnar: Đawit krao akŭm lu bơngai tơmoi oei lăm char Isơrael sư pơkă kơ lu bơngai teh blah tơmo wă pơm hnam Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: And David prepared iron in abundance for the nails of the doors of the gates and for the joints, and bronze in abundance beyond measure
Bahnar: Pơtao Đawit ăn lơ bơsei wă pơm kơđĭnh pơm, măng jang, pơm lu gơwŏk sư ăn kong đei lơlap ưh kơ kĕ jô̆.

English: and cedar trees in abundance; for the Sidonians and those from Tyre brought much cedar wood to David.
Bahnar: Sư ăn 'long hơngo kư̆m ưh kơ kĕ jô̆ ôh yua kơ lu bơngai Siđôn hăm lu bơngai Tirơ chơ ba lơ dêh 'long hơngo ăn kơ Đawit.

English: Now David said, “Solomon my son is young and inexperienced, and the house to be built for the LORD must be exceedingly magnificent, famous and glorious throughout all countries. I will now make preparation for it.” So David made abundant preparations before his death.
Bahnar: Đawit khan: Sôlômôn kon drŏ-nglo inh oei tơdăm tam mă gơh jang ôh, mă pơm hnam Kră Yang athei pơm 'lơ̆ng rŏ krưp tơpă, đei tơdrong ư-ang, tơ jơ̆p-jang char, na inh gô chă hơmet lê̆ adrol. Thoi noh. Đawit chă hơmet tôm tơmam adrol kơ sư lôch.

English: Then he called for his son Solomon, and charged him to build a house for the LORD God of Israel.
Bahnar: Sư krao Sôlômôn kon drŏ-nglo sư păng pơkă kơ sư athei pơm hnam kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Isơrael.

English: And David said to Solomon: “My son, as for me, it was in my mind to build a house to the name of the LORD my God
Bahnar: Đawit khan kơ Sôlômôn: “Ơ dăm, jơhngơ̆m inh 'maih pơm hnam kơ Anăn Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei inh.

English: but the word of the LORD came to me, saying, ‘You have shed much blood and have made great wars; you shall not build a house for My name, because you have shed much blood on the earth in My sight.
Bahnar: Mă-lei nơ̆r Kră Yang khan kơ inh: Ih pơlôch tuh pham lơ boih păng ih đei tơblah tih; ih ưh kơ gơh pơm hnam kơ Anăn Inh ôh, yua kơ ih pơlôch tuh pham lơ dêh 'bơ̆t anăp Inh lăm teh đak âu.

English: Behold, a son shall be born to you, who shall be a man of rest; and I will give him rest from all his enemies all around. His name shall be Solomon, for I will give peace and quietness to Israel in his days.
Bahnar: Ih gô đei minh 'nu kon drŏ-nglo; sư gô jing minh 'nu bơngai drŏ-nglo hiôk rơnŭk, inh gô ăn kơ sư rơnŭk rơnua păng ăn pơdơh đơ̆ng đĭ-đăng ayăt tăp dăr kơ sư. Krao anăn sư Sôlômôn, Inh gô ăn tơdrong hiôk rơnŭk kơ lu bơngai Isơrael lăm chăl sư pơgơ̆r.

English: He shall build a house for My name, and he shall be My son, and I will be his Father; and I will establish the throne of his kingdom over Israel forever.’
Bahnar: Sư boih gô pơm hnam kơ Anăn Inh. Sư gô jing kon drŏ-nglo Inh, păng Inh gô jing 'bă sư. Inh gô pơm tang-dŏ pơtao sư lăm char Isơrael ling-lang khŏm khŏm.

English: Now, my son, may the LORD be with you; and may you prosper, and build the house of the LORD your God, as He has said to you.
Bahnar: Dang ei ơ dăm ăn kơ Kră Yang oei hơdai hăm ih, tơgŭm ih lăm tơdrong pơm hnam kơkuh kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ih, kiơ̆ thoi Sư đei khan boih gah ih.

English: Only may the LORD give you wisdom and understanding, and give you charge concerning Israel, that you may keep the law of the LORD your God.
Bahnar: Apinh Kră Yang ăn kơ ih tơdrong gơh hơgei hlôh wao wă kơ ih pơgơ̆r wei-lăng lu bơngai Isơrael wă kơ ih răk kiơ̆ tơdrong juăt Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ih.

English: Then you will prosper, if you take care to fulfill the statutes and judgments with which the LORD charged Moses concerning Israel. Be strong and of good courage; do not fear nor be dismayed.
Bahnar: Thoi noh ih gô đei tơdrong kĕ jei, tơdah ih pơ'lơ̆ng wei răk pơm kiơ̆ tơdrong juăt păng nơ̆r tơtă Kră Yang athei Môis khan ăn kơ lu bơngai Isơrael. Pran kơjăp, păng nuih kơtang bĕ 'nĕ kơ hli, 'nĕ kơ tơrơ.

English: Indeed I have taken much trouble to prepare for the house of the LORD one hundred thousand talents of gold and one million talents of silver, and bronze and iron beyond measure, for it is so abundant. I have prepared timber and stone also, and you may add to them.
Bahnar: 'Nâu inh gleh hrat chă wă kơ đei tơmam pơm Hnam Kră Yang, pêng-rơbâu puăn-hrĕng pơđăm-jĭt tân maih, pêng-jĭt puăn-rơbâu tân hu, kong hăm bơsei ưh kơ kĕ jô̆ ôh, inh kư̆m chă 'long lơ păng tơmo. Ăn kơ lu iĕm chă thim dơ̆ng.

English: Moreover there are workmen with you in abundance: woodsmen and stonecutters, and all types of skillful men for every kind of work.
Bahnar: Ih kư̆m gô đei lơ bơngai jang, bơngai teh tơmo, lu bơngai man, lu bơngai jang 'long păng lu bơngai gơh jang tôm tơdrong jang

English: Of gold and silver and bronze and iron there is no limit. Arise and begin working, and the LORD be with you.”
Bahnar: hăm maih, hu, kong, păng bơsei, lơlap lơlang ưh kơ kĕ jô̆: Iung pơm bĕ! Apinh Kră Yang oei hơdai hăm ih!”

English: David also commanded all the leaders of Israel to help Solomon his son, saying
Bahnar: Đawit khan pơkă kơ đĭ-đăng lu kră pơgơ̆r Isơrael athei tơgŭm kon drŏ-nglo sư Sôlômôn.

English: “Is not the LORD your God with you? And has He not given you rest on every side? For He has given the inhabitants of the land into my hand, and the land is subdued before the LORD and before His people.
Bahnar: Đawit khan: “Ưh kơ trŏ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei iĕm oei hơdai hăm lu iĕm hă? Sư ăn kơ iĕm tơdrong rơnŭk rơnua puăn pah yua kơ Sư ăn kơ inh kon pơlei oei lăm char 'nâu păng tơring 'nâu, chu kiơ̆ 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang păng 'bơ̆t anăp lu kon pơlei pơla Sư.

English: Now set your heart and your soul to seek the LORD your God. Therefore arise and build the sanctuary of the LORD God, to bring the ark of the covenant of the LORD and the holy articles of God into the house that is to be built for the name of the LORD.”
Bahnar: Dang ei đĭ jơhngơ̆m, đĭ bơhngol chơchă bĕ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm; iung bĕ păng pơm minh pôm anih 'lơ̆ng rơgoh kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, lu iĕm tung ba bĕ Hom pơgơ̆p Kră Yang păng lu tơmam rơgoh 'lơ̆ng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei tơmơ̆t lăm hnam mă lu iĕm pơm boih hăm Anăn Kră Yang.”

English: So when David was old and full of days, he made his son Solomon king over Israel.
Bahnar: Đawit đĭ kră, sơnăm sư đĭ sot bơih, na sư pơchĕp ăn kơ kon drŏ-nglo sư Sôlômôn pơm pơtao Isơrael.

English: And he gathered together all the leaders of Israel, with the priests and the Levites.
Bahnar: Sư krao akŭm đĭ lu kră pơgơ̆r bơngai Isơrael, lu 'bok soi păng bơngai Lêwi.

English: Now the Levites were numbered from the age of thirty years and above; and the number of individual males was thirty-eight thousand.
Bahnar: Bơngai Lêwi iŏk đơ̆ng pêng-jĭt sơnăm tơ kơpal, đe kư̆m jô̆ đĭ, đĭ-đăng đei pêng-jĭt tơhngam-rơbâu 'nu.

English: Of these, twenty-four thousand were to look after the work of the house of the LORD, six thousand were officers and judges
Bahnar: Đawit khan. “Lăm lu bơngai noh, đei 'bar-jĭt puăn-rơbâu 'nu bơngai wei-lăng tơdrong jang lăm hnam Kră Yang; tơdrâu 'nu bơngai pơm bơngai wei-lăng păng pơm kră sek tơlang.

English: four thousand were gatekeepers, and four thousand praised the LORD with musical instruments, “which I made,” said David, “for giving praise.”
Bahnar: Na puăn-rơbâu 'nu bơngai jang gak wei-lăng 'măng jang; păng puăn-rơbâu 'nu bơngai hơri ư-ang kơ Kră Yang păng brŏ inh ăn kơ bơngai hơri bơnê ư-ang.

English: Also David separated them into divisions among the sons of Levi: Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.
Bahnar: Đawit asong lu sư kiơ̆ kơ khŭl lăm pêng 'nu kon drŏ-nglo Lêwi, noh Gersôm, Kôhat păng Mêrari.

English: Of the Gershonites: Laadan and Shimei.
Bahnar: Gah kon sâu Gersôm đei: Lađan păng Simêi.

English: The sons of Laadan: the first Jehiel, then Zetham and Joel—three in all.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Lađan noh: Jêhiêl pơm yŏng kơdră, Sêtham păng Jôel đei pêng 'nu.

English: The sons of Shimei: Shelomith, Haziel, and Haran—three in all. These were the heads of the fathers’ houses of Laadan.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Simei noh: Sêlômôt, Hasiel păng Haran pêng 'nu. Noh lu yŏng kơdră adrĕch adrung Lađan.

English: And the sons of Shimei: Jahath, Zina, Jeush, and Beriah. These were the four sons of Shimei.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Simêi noh: Jahat, Sisa, Jêrus păng Bêria. Noh jơ̆ puăn 'nu kon drŏ-nglo Simêi.

English: Jahath was the first and Zizah the second. But Jeush and Beriah did not have many sons; therefore they were assigned as one father’s house.
Bahnar: Jahat pơm yŏng mă minh, na Sisa mă 'bar; mă-lei Jêrus păng Bêria, ưh kơ đei kon drŏ-nglo; na đe jô̆ lu sư thoi minh pôm hnam dơnŏ đĕch.

English: The sons of Kohath: Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel—four in all.
Bahnar: Kon sâu Kôhat kon drŏ-nglo Kôhat noh: Amram, Ishar, Hêbrôn, Usiet, đei puăn 'nu.

English: The sons of Amram: Aaron and Moses; and Aaron was set apart, he and his sons forever, that he should sanctify the most holy things, to burn incense before the LORD, to minister to Him, and to give the blessing in His name forever.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Amram noh: Arôn păng Môis; Arôn păng kon sâu sư klah asong băl, wă pơyơ̆r lu tơmam soi 'lơ̆ng rơgoh păng ling-lang pơyơ̆r tơmam soi ăn kơ Kră Yang, bơ̆jang 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang hăm yua anăn Kră Yang sơkat ăn pŭn hiôk kơ kon pơlei pơla ling-lang.

English: Now the sons of Moses the man of God were reckoned to the tribe of Levi.
Bahnar: Lu drŏ-nglo Môis, bơngai Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, chih tơmơ̆t jô̆ lăm adrĕch adrung Lêwi.

English: The sons of Moses were Gershon and Eliezer.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Môis noh Gersôm păng Êliêser.

English: Of the sons of Gershon, Shebuel was the first.
Bahnar: Kon kơdră Gersôm noh: Subael.

English: Of the descendants of Eliezer, Rehabiah was the first. And Eliezer had no other sons, but the sons of Rehabiah were very many.
Bahnar: Kon sâu Êliêser noh: Rehabia kon kơdră; Êliêser ưh kơ đei kon drŏ-nglo dơ̆ng; mă-lei kon drŏ-nglo Rêhabia lơ dêh.

English: Of the sons of Izhar, Shelomith was the first.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Ishar noh: Sêlômit kon kơdră.

English: Of the sons of Hebron, Jeriah was the first, Amariah the second, Jahaziel the third, and Jekameam the fourth.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Hêbrôn noh: Jêria kon kơdră, Amaria kon mă 'bar, Jahasiêl mă pêng; păng Jêkamêam mă puăn.

English: Of the sons of Uzziel, Michah was the first and Jesshiah the second.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Usiêl noh: Mika kon kơdră păng Isia kon mă 'bar.

English: The sons of Merari were Mahli and Mushi. The sons of Mahli were Eleazar and Kish.
Bahnar: Kon sâu Mêrari kon drŏ-nglo Mêrari noh: Mahli păng Musi. Kon drŏ-nglo Mahli noh: Êlêasar păng Kis.

English: And Eleazar died, and had no sons, but only daughters; and their brethren, the sons of Kish, took them as wives.
Bahnar: Êlêasar lôch, ưh kơ đei kon drŏ-nglo, đei lu kon drŏ-kăn đĕch: Lu kon drŏ-nglo Kis 'nhŏng oh lu sư, na iŏk oei kơ lu sư pơm akăn.

English: The sons of Mushi were Mahli, Eder, and Jeremoth—three in all.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Musi noh: Mahli, Êder păng Jêremôt đei pêng 'nu.

English: These were the sons of Levi by their fathers’ houses—the heads of the fathers’ houses as they were counted individually by the number of their names, who did the work for the service of the house of the LORD, from the age of twenty years and above.
Bahnar: Noh lu kon sâu Lêwi kiơ̆ kơ adrĕch 'bă lu sư đe đei chih anăn lu yŏng kơdră păng rim 'nu kiơ̆ kơ adrĕch 'bă lu sư, bơngai drŏ-nglo iŏk đơ̆ng 'bar-jĭt sơnăm tơ kơpal, bơ̆jang lăm hnam Kră Yang.

English: For David said, “The LORD God of Israel has given rest to His people, that they may dwell in Jerusalem forever”
Bahnar: Yua kơ noh Đawit đei khan: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Isơrael đei ăn tơdrong hiôk-hian kơ kon pơlei Sư păng Kră Yang oei tơ Jêrusalem ling-lang.

English: and also to the Levites, “They shall no longer carry the tabernacle, or any of the articles for its service.”
Bahnar: Bơngai Lêwi kư̆m ưh pă kăl tung tôi bơsŭn dah lu tơmam gah tơdrong jang bơsŭn dơ̆ng.

English: For by the last words of David the Levites were numbered from twenty years old and above
Bahnar: Kiơ̆ nơ̆r tơtă tuch-luch Đawit, đe jô̆ pơnhen kon pơlei bơngai Lêwi, iŏk đơ̆ng 'bar-jĭt sơnăm, tơ kơpal.

English: because their duty was to help the sons of Aaron in the service of the house of the LORD, in the courts and in the chambers, in the purifying of all holy things and the work of the service of the house of God
Bahnar: Tơdrong jang lu bơngai Lêwi tơgŭm kon sâu Arôn, wă bơ̆jang lăm hnam Kră Yang, wei-lăng lu cham hnam, păng lu anih cheng, pơm rơgoh lu tơmam 'lơ̆ng rơgoh păng lăng awih awăn lăm hnam Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: both with the showbread and the fine flour for the grain offering, with the unleavened cakes and what is baked in the pan, with what is mixed and with all kinds of measures and sizes
Bahnar: Lu sư kư̆m wei-lăng gah dan pôk 'bĕng tơ kơpal gơ'bang, tơpŭng 'ba mi wă pơyơ̆r phe 'ba wă yua pơm tơmam sa sap, 'bĕng klang ưh kơ đei 'buh pông, 'buih phang 'bĕng pơjrâu hăm đak rơmă păng kŏng pơtŏ tih iĕ.

English: to stand every morning to thank and praise the LORD, and likewise at evening
Bahnar: Rim pơgê păng rim kơsơ̆, lu bơngai Lêwi athei dơ̆ng tơ noh kơkuh bơnê păng hơri ư-ang kơ Kră Yang

English: and at every presentation of a burnt offering to the LORD on the Sabbaths and on the New Moons and on the set feasts, by number according to the ordinance governing them, regularly before the LORD
Bahnar: păng mưh wă pơyơ̆r tơmam soi 'buh kơ Kră Yang lăm năr Sa'bat, năr Khei Tơ'bang păng năr pơm giĕng tih, kiơ̆ kơ đei hơgăt hơdôm 'nu athei ling-lang dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang.

English: and that they should attend to the needs of the tabernacle of meeting, the needs of the holy place, and the needs of the sons of Aaron their brethren in the work of the house of the LORD.
Bahnar: Thoi noh bơngai Lêwi lu sư kư̆m hiơ̆k wei-lăng bơsŭn anih akŭm păng anih rơgoh, pơm kiơ̆ kơ kon sâu Arôn, 'nhŏng oh lu sư, wă bơ̆jang lăm hnam Kră Yang.

English: Now these are the divisions of the sons of Aaron. The sons of Aaron were Nadab, Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.
Bahnar: 'Nâu khŭl kon sâu Arôn: Kon drŏ-nglo Arôn noh Nađap, Abihu, Êlêasar păng Ithamar.

English: And Nadab and Abihu died before their father, and had no children; therefore Eleazar and Ithamar ministered as priests.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Nađap păng Abihu lôch adrol kơ 'bă lu sư păng ưh kơ đei kon; na Êlêasar păng Ithamar pơm 'bok soi.

English: Then David with Zadok of the sons of Eleazar, and Ahimelech of the sons of Ithamar, divided them according to the schedule of their service.
Bahnar: Sađôk kon sâu Êlêasar păng Ahimelek kon sâu Ithamar tơgŭm Đawit klah asong khŭl 'bok soi ăn kơ lu sư kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong jang.

English: There were more leaders found of the sons of Eleazar than of the sons of Ithamar, and thus they were divided. Among the sons of Eleazar were sixteen heads of their fathers’ houses, and eight heads of their fathers’ houses among the sons of Ithamar.
Bahnar: Lăm lu kon sâu Êlêasar đei lơ bơngai pơgơ̆r lăm adrĕch adrung hloh kơ lăm kon sâu Ithamar; lei na lu sư asong khŭl thoi âu: Gah kon sâu Êlêasar đei mơjĭt-tơdrâu 'nu bơngai pơgơ̆r lăm adrĕch adrung; na gah kon sâu Ithamar đei tơhngam 'nu bơngai pơgơ̆r lăm adrĕch adrung sư.

English: Thus they were divided by lot, one group as another, for there were officials of the sanctuary and officials of the house of God, from the sons of Eleazar and from the sons of Ithamar.
Bahnar: Đe asong lu sư kiơ̆ kơ đe hlang lăng lei-lăi yua kơ lu sư đei bơngai wei-lăng lăm anih rơgoh păng lu sư bơngai bơ̆jang kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lăm kon sâu Êlêasar păng kon sâu Ithamar.

English: And the scribe, Shemaiah the son of Nethanel, one of the Levites, wrote them down before the king, the leaders, Zadok the priest, Ahimelech the son of Abiathar, and the heads of the fathers’ houses of the priests and Levites, one father’s house taken for Eleazar and one for Ithamar.
Bahnar: Sêmaia bơngai chih hla bơar, kon drŏ-nglo Nethanel, sư lăm adrĕch adrung Lêwi, chih anăn lu sư tơmơ̆t lăm sơ̆p hla bơar 'bơ̆t anăp pơtao, lu yŏng pơgơ̆r noh 'bok soi Sađôk, Ahimelek, kon drŏ-nglo Abiathar, lu bơngai yŏng kơdră lăm adrĕch 'bă 'bok soi păng bơngai Lêwi; kư̆ rim adrĕch kon sâu Êlêasar hlang iŏk minh 'nu, đơ̆ng adrĕch kon sâu Ithamar kư̆m hlang iŏk minh 'nu.

English: Now the first lot fell to Jehoiarib, the second to Jedaiah
Bahnar: Hlang mă mônh 'bơm trŏ kơ Jêhôiarip; hlang mă 'bar trŏ kơ Jêđaia.

English: the third to Harim, the fourth to Seorim
Bahnar: Hlang mă pêng trŏ kơ Harim; hlang mă puăn trŏ kơ Sêôrim.

English: the fifth to Malchijah, the sixth to Mijamin
Bahnar: Hlang mă pơđăm trŏ kơ Malkija; Hlang mă tơdrâu trŏ kơ Mijamin

English: the seventh to Hakkoz, the eighth to Abijah
Bahnar: hlang mă tơpơh trŏ kơ Hakkôs; hlang mă tơhngam trŏ kơ Abija

English: the ninth to Jeshua, the tenth to Shecaniah
Bahnar: hlang mă tơsĭn trŏ kơ Jêsua; hlang mă mơjĭt trŏ kơ Sêkania

English: the eleventh to Eliashib, the twelfth to Jakim
Bahnar: hlang mă mơjĭt-mônh trŏ kơ Êliasip; hlang mă mơjĭt-'bar trŏ kơ Jakim.

English: the thirteenth to Huppah, the fourteenth to Jeshebeab
Bahnar: Hlang mă mơjĭt-pêng trŏ kơ Huppa; hlang mă mơjĭt-puăn trŏ kơ Jêsebeap

English: the fifteenth to Bilgah, the sixteenth to Immer
Bahnar: hlang mă mơjĭt-pơđăm trŏ kơ Bilga; hlang mă mơjĭt-tơdrâu trŏ kơ Immer

English: the seventeenth to Hezir, the eighteenth to Happizzez
Bahnar: hlang mă mơjĭt-tơpơh trŏ kơ Hêsir; hlang mă mơjĭt-tơhngam trŏ kơ Happiser

English: the nineteenth to Pethahiah, the twentieth to Jehezekel
Bahnar: hlang mă mơjĭt-tơsĭn trŏ kơ Pêthahia, hlang mă 'bar-jĭt trŏ kơ Jêheskel

English: the twenty-first to Jachin, the twenty-second to Gamul
Bahnar: hlang mă 'bar-jĭt mônh trŏ kơ Jakin; hlang mă 'bar-jĭt 'bar trŏ Gamul

English: the twenty-third to Delaiah, the twenty-fourth to Maaziah.
Bahnar: hlang mă 'bar-jĭt pêng trŏ kơ Đêlaia; hlang mă 'bar-jĭt puăn trŏ kơ Maasia.

English: This was the schedule of their service for coming into the house of the LORD according to their ordinance by the hand of Aaron their father, as the LORD God of Israel had commanded him.
Bahnar: 'Nâu bơih khŭl bơngai bơ̆jang lăm hnam Kră Yang, kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong juăt 'bok lu sư Arôn pơkă bơtho ăn kiơ̆ thoi nơ̆r Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Isơrael pơkă ăn kơ sư.

English: And the rest of the sons of Levi: of the sons of Amram, Shubael; of the sons of Shubael, Jehdeiah.
Bahnar: 'Nâu bơih kon sâu Lêwi mă oei đei: Đơ̆ng kon sâu Amram đei Subael; kon sâu Subăl đei Jêđeia.

English: Concerning Rehabiah, of the sons of Rehabiah, the first was Isshiah.
Bahnar: Gah kon sâu Rêhabia đei: Ishia pơm yŏng kơdră.

English: Of the Izharites, Shelomoth; of the sons of Shelomoth, Jahath.
Bahnar: Lăm kon sâu Ishar đei Sêlômôt; gah kon sâu Sêlômôt đei Jahat.

English: Of the sons of Hebron, Jeriah was the first, Amariah the second, Jahaziel the third, and Jekameam the fourth.
Bahnar: Kon sâu Hêbrôn đei: Jêria kon kơdră; Amaria kon mă 'bar, Jahasiêl kon mă pêng, păng Jêkamêam kon mă puăn.

English: Of the sons of Uzziel, Michah; of the sons of Michah, Shamir.
Bahnar: Kon sâu Usiel đei Mika; gah kon sâu Mika đei Samir.

English: The brother of Michah, Isshiah; of the sons of Isshiah, Zechariah.
Bahnar: 'Nhŏng oh Mika noh Isia; gah kon sâu Ishia đei Sacharia.

English: The sons of Merari were Mahli and Mushi; the son of Jaaziah, Beno.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Mêrari noh: Mahli păng Musi; kon drŏ-nglo Jaasia noh Benô

English: The sons of Merari by Jaaziah were Beno, Shoham, Zaccur, and Ibri.
Bahnar: kon drŏ-nglo Mêrari đơ̆ng Jaasia: Benô, Sôham, Sakur, păng Ibri.

English: Of Mahli: Eleazar, who had no sons.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Mahli: Êlêasar, bơngai ưh kơ đei kon drŏ-nglo.

English: Of Kish: the son of Kish, Jerahmeel.
Bahnar: Kon sâu Kis đei: Jêrahmêel.

English: Also the sons of Mushi were Mahli, Eder, and Jerimoth. These were the sons of the Levites according to their fathers’ houses.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Musi: Mahli, Êder păng Jêrimôt. 'Noh bơih kon sâu Lêwi, kiơ̆ kơ adrĕch 'bă lu sư.

English: These also cast lots just as their brothers the sons of Aaron did, in the presence of King David, Zadok, Ahimelech, and the heads of the fathers’ houses of the priests and Levites. The chief fathers did just as their younger brethren.
Bahnar: Lu sư kư̆m hlang iŏk thoi lĕ kơ 'nhŏng oh lu sư, kon sâu Arôn đei hlang lăng 'bơ̆t anăp pơtao Đawit Sađôk păng Ahimelek, hăm 'bơ̆t anăp lu yŏng kơdră adrĕch 'bă lu 'bok soi păng lu bơngai Lêwi: Lu yŏng kơdră adrĕch 'bă kư̆m athei hlang lăng lei-lăi thoi lu oh sư kơdih.

English: Moreover David and the captains of the army separated for the service some of the sons of Asaph, of Heman, and of Jeduthun, who should prophesy with harps, stringed instruments, and cymbals. And the number of the skilled men performing their service was
Bahnar: Đawit păng lu yŏng pơgơ̆r linh 'măn lê̆ pha mơ'nah lu kon sâu Asap, Hêman păng Jêđuthun wă bơ̆jang, reh brŏ dung, tĭng-nĭng hăm preh chhar wă pơma khan lê̆ adrol. 'Nâu anăn lu bơngai bơ̆jang.

English: Of the sons of Asaph: Zaccur, Joseph, Nethaniah, and Asharelah; the sons of Asaph were under the direction of Asaph, who prophesied according to the order of the king.
Bahnar: Gah kon drŏ-nglo Asap, đei Sakur, Jôsep, Nêthania păng Asarêla. Kon drŏ-nglo Asap bơ̆jang ala Asap wei-lăng sư pơma khan lê̆ adrol mơ̆ng kiơ̆ kơ pơtao pơgơ̆r.

English: Of Jeduthun, the sons of Jeduthun: Gedaliah, Zeri, Jeshaiah, Shimei, Hashabiah, and Mattithiah, six, under the direction of their father Jeduthun, who prophesied with a harp to give thanks and to praise the LORD.
Bahnar: Gah kon drŏ-nglo Jêđuthun đei Gêđalia, Sêri, Jêsaia, Simêi, Hasabia păng Matithia, lu sư tơdrâu 'nu bơ̆jang ala kơ 'bă lu sư wei-lăng, krao Jêđuthun, yua brŏ dung na pơma khan lê̆ adrol bơyong bơnê păng hơri ư-ang kơ Kră Yang.

English: Of Heman, the sons of Heman: Bukkiah, Mattaniah, Uzziel, Shebuel, Jerimoth, Hananiah, Hanani, Eliathah, Giddalti, Romamti-Ezer, Joshbekashah, Mallothi, Hothir, and Mahazioth.
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Hêman đei Bukkia, Mathania, Usiel, Subael Jêrimôt, Hanania, Hanani, Êliatha, Giđalti, Rômamti Êser, Jôsbêkasa, Malôthi, Hôthir păng Mahasiôt.

English: All these were the sons of Heman the king’s seer in the words of God, to exalt his horn. For God gave Heman fourteen sons and three daughters.
Bahnar: Dôm lu bơngai 'nâu kon drŏ-nglo Hêman ngăl, bơngai khan lê̆ adrol ăn kơ pơtao, kiơ̆ kơ nơ̆r Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei đei pơkă. Wă kơ lu sư bơnê ư-ang kơ Kră Yang, Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ Hêman đei puăn-jĭt 'nu kon drŏ-nglo păng pêng 'nu kon drŏ-kăn.

English: All these were under the direction of their father for the music in the house of the LORD, with cymbals, stringed instruments, and harps, for the service of the house of God. Asaph, Jeduthun, and Heman were under the authority of the king.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu bơngai noh tă kơ bơngai Jang ala kơ 'bă lu sư kơdih wei-lăng gah tơdrong hơri wă hơri lăm hnam Kră Yang, hăm chhar brŏ dung păng tĭng-nĭng bơ̆jang tơ lăm hnam Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei. Asap, Jêđuthun păng Hêman kiơ̆ kơ pơtao athei.

English: So the number of them, with their brethren who were instructed in the songs of the LORD, all who were skillful, was two hundred and eighty-eight.
Bahnar: Hơdai hăm 'nhŏng oh sư đĭ-đăng đei pơhrăm hơgei lăm tơdrong hơri ăn kơ Kră Yang, lu sư đei 'bar-hrĕng tơhngam-jĭt tơhngam 'nu bơngai.

English: And they cast lots for their duty, the small as well as the great, the teacher with the student.
Bahnar: Lu sư hlang lăng wă kơ bơ̆jang. Bơngai 'lŏ thoi lĕ bơngai 'lơ̆p, 'bok thây kư̆m thoi bơngai pơhrăm.

English: Now the first lot for Asaph came out for Joseph; the second for Gedaliah, him with his brethren and sons, twelve
Bahnar: Lăm adrĕch adrung Asap hlang lăng mă minh trŏ kơ Jôsep kon drŏ-nglo sư hăm lu 'nhŏng oh sư. Đĭ-đăng mơjĭt-'bar 'nu. Hlang lăng mă 'bar trŏ kơ Gêđalia 'nhŏng oh păng kon drŏ-nglo sư, đĭ-đăng đei mơjĭt-'bar 'nu.

English: the third for Zaccur, his sons and his brethren, twelve
Bahnar: Hlang lăng mă pêng trŏ kơ Sakur, lu kon drŏ-nglo păng 'nhŏng oh sư, đĭ-đăng đei mơjĭt-'bar 'nu.

English: the fourth for Jizri, his sons and his brethren, twelve
Bahnar: Hlang lăng mă puăn trŏ kơ Isri, lu kon drŏ-nglo păng 'nhŏng oh sư, đĭ-đăng đei mơjĭt-'bar 'nu.

English: the fifth for Nethaniah, his sons and his brethren, twelve
Bahnar: Hlang lăng mă pơđăm trŏ Nêthania, lu kon drŏ-nglo păng 'nhŏng oh sư, đĭ-đăng đei mơjĭt-'bar 'nu

English: the sixth for Bukkiah, his sons and his brethren, twelve
Bahnar: hlang lăng mă tơdrâu trŏ kơ Bukkia, lu kon drŏ-nglo păng 'nhŏng oh sư, đĭ-đăng đei mơjĭt-'bar 'nu

English: the seventh for Jesharelah, his sons and his brethren, twelve
Bahnar: Hlang lăng mă tơpơh trŏ kơ Jêsarêla, lu kon drŏ-nglo păng lu 'nhŏng oh sư, đĭ-đăng đei mơjĭt-'bar 'nu

English: the eighth for Jeshaiah, his sons and his brethren, twelve
Bahnar: Hlang lăng mă tơhngam trŏ Jêsaia, lu kon drŏ-nglo păng lu 'nhŏng oh sư, đĭ-đăng đei mơjĭt-'bar 'nu.

English: the ninth for Mattaniah, his sons and his brethren, twelve
Bahnar: Hlang lăng mă tơsĭn trŏ kơ Mathania, lu kon drŏ-nglo păng 'nhŏng oh sư, đĭ-đăng đei mơjĭt-'bar 'nu

English: the tenth for Shimei, his sons and his brethren, twelve
Bahnar: Hlang lăng mă mơjĭt trŏ kơ Simêi, lu kon drŏ-nglo păng 'nhŏng oh sư, đĭ-đăng đei mơjĭt-'bar 'nu.

English: the eleventh for Azarel, his sons and his brethren, twelve
Bahnar: Hlang lăng mă mơjĭt-mônh trŏ kơ Asarel, lu kon drŏ-nglo păng 'nhŏng oh sư, đĭ-đăng đei mơjĭt-'bar 'nu

English: the twelfth for Hashabiah, his sons and his brethren, twelve
Bahnar: Hlang lăng mă mơjĭt-'bar trŏ Hasabia, lu kon drŏ-nglo păng 'nhŏng oh sư, đĭ-đăng đei mơjĭt-'bar 'nu.

English: the thirteenth for Shubael, his sons and his brethren, twelve
Bahnar: Hlang lăng mă mơjĭt-pêng trŏ kơ Subăl, lu kon drŏ-nglo păng 'nhŏng oh sư, đĭ-đăng đei mơjĭt-'bar 'nu.

English: the fourteenth for Mattithiah, his sons and his brethren, twelve
Bahnar: Hlang lăng mă mơjĭt-puăn trŏ kơ Matithia, lu kon drŏ-nglo păng 'nhŏng oh sư, đĭ-đăng đei mơjĭt-'bar 'nu

English: the fifteenth for Jeremoth, his sons and his brethren, twelve
Bahnar: Hlang lăng mă mơjĭt-pơđăm trŏ kơ Jêremôt, lu kon drŏ-nglo păng 'nhŏng oh sư, đĭ-đăng đei mơjĭt-'bar 'nu.

English: the sixteenth for Hananiah, his sons and his brethren, twelve
Bahnar: Hlang lăng mă mơjĭt-tơdrâu trŏ kơ Hanania, lu kon drŏ-nglo păng 'nhŏng oh sư, đĭ-đăng đei mơjĭt-'bar 'nu.

English: the seventeenth for Joshbekashah, his sons and his brethren, twelve
Bahnar: Hlang lăng mă mơjĭt-tơpơh trŏ kơ Jôsbêkasa, lu kon drŏ-nglo păng 'nhŏng oh sư, đĭ-đăng đei mơjĭt-'bar 'nu.

English: the eighteenth for Hanani, his sons and his brethren, twelve
Bahnar: Hlang lăng mă mơjĭt-tơhngam trŏ kơ Hanani, lu kon drŏ-nglo păng 'nhŏng oh sư, đĭ-đăng đei mơjĭt-'bar 'nu.

English: the nineteenth for Mallothi, his sons and his brethren, twelve
Bahnar: Hlang lăng mă mơjĭt-tơsĭn trŏ kơ Malôthi, lu kon drŏ-nglo păng 'nhŏng oh sư, đĭ-đăng đei mơjĭt-'bar 'nu.

English: the twentieth for Eliathah, his sons and his brethren, twelve
Bahnar: Hlang lăng mă 'bar-jĭt trŏ kơ Êliatha, lu kon drŏ-nglo păng 'nhŏng oh sư, đĭ-đăng đei mơjĭt-'bar 'nu

English: the twenty-first for Hothir, his sons and his brethren, twelve
Bahnar: hlang lăng mă 'bar-jĭt mônh trŏ kơ Hôthir, lu kon drŏ-nglo păng 'nhŏng oh sư, đĭ-đăng đei mơjĭt-'bar 'nu.

English: the twenty-second for Giddalti, his sons and his brethren, twelve
Bahnar: Hlang lăng mă 'bar-jĭt 'bar trŏ kơ Giđalti, lu kon drŏ-nglo păng 'nhŏng oh sư, đĭ-đăng đei mơjĭt-'bar 'nu.

English: the twenty-third for Mahazioth, his sons and his brethren, twelve
Bahnar: Hlang lăng mă 'bar-jĭt pêng trŏ kơ Mahasiôt, lu kon drŏ-nglo păng 'nhŏng oh sư, đĭ-đăng đei mơjĭt-'bar 'nu

English: the twenty-fourth for Romamti-Ezer, his sons and his brethren, twelve.
Bahnar: Hlang lăng mă 'bar-jĭt puăn trŏ kơ Rômamti Êser, lu kon drŏ-nglo păng 'nhŏng oh sư, đĭ-đăng đei mơjĭt-'bar 'nu.

English: Concerning the divisions of the gatekeepers: of the Korahites, Meshelemiah the son of Kore, of the sons of Asaph.
Bahnar: Dôm lu khŭl bơngai gak 'măng jang thoi âu: Lu bơngai Kôrahit đei Mêsêlêmia, kon drŏ-nglo Asap.

English: And the sons of Meshelemiah were Zechariah the firstborn, Jediael the second, Zebadiah the third, Jathniel the fourth
Bahnar: Kon drŏ-nglo Mêsêlêmia đei: Secharia kon kơdră sư Jêđiael kon mă 'bar, Sêbađia kon mă pêng, Jatniêl kon mă puăn

English: Elam the fifth, Jehohanan the sixth, Eliehoenai the seventh.
Bahnar: Êlam kon mă pơđăm, Jehôhanan kon mă tơdrâu, păng Êliehôenai kon mă tơpơh.

English: Moreover the sons of Obed-Edom were Shemaiah the firstborn, Jehozabad the second, Joah the third, Sacar the fourth, Nethanel the fifth
Bahnar: Lu kon drŏ-nglo Ôbêt Eđôm: Sêmaia kon kơdră sư, Jêhôsabat kon mă 'bar, Jôa kon mă pêng, Sakar kon mă puăn, Nêthanel kon mă pơđăm.

English: Ammiel the sixth, Issachar the seventh, Peulthai the eighth; for God blessed him.
Bahnar: Ammiel mă tơdrâu, Isakar mă tơpơh păng Phêulêthai mă tơhngam yua kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei đei tuh tơdrong pŭn hiôk kơ Ôbêt Eđôm ăn đei kon lơ.

English: Also to Shemaiah his son were sons born who governed their fathers’ houses, because they were men of great ability.
Bahnar: Sêmêia, kon drŏ-nglo Ôbêt Eđôm, kư̆m pơjing lu kon drŏ-nglo, đei wei-lăng adrĕch 'bă yua kơ lu sư tă kơ bơngai gơh hơgei ngăl.

English: The sons of Shemaiah were Othni, Rephael, Obed, and Elzabad, whose brothers Elihu and Semachiah were able men.
Bahnar: Lu kon drŏ-nglo Sêmaia noh Ôtni, Rêphăl, Ôbêt păng Êlsabat; 'nhŏng oh lu sư Êlihu păng Sêmakia, lu bơngai nuih gơh hơgei ngăl.

English: All these were of the sons of Obed-Edom, they and their sons and their brethren, able men with strength for the work: sixty-two of Obed-Edom.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu bơngai 'nâu kon sâu Ôbêt Eđôm; lu sư, hăm lu kon drŏ-nglo păng 'nhŏng oh lu sư tă kơ bơngai nuih gơh hơgei tơdrong jang đei tơdrâu-jĭt 'bar 'nu bơngai lu sư gah adrĕch adrung Ôbêt Eđôm.

English: And Meshelemiah had sons and brethren, eighteen able men.
Bahnar: Mêsêlêmia đei lu kon drŏ-nglo păng 'nhŏng oh sư tă kơ bơngai nuih gơh hơgei, đĭ-đăng đei mơjĭt-tơhngam 'nu.

English: Also Hosah, of the children of Merari, had sons: Shimri the first (for though he was not the firstborn, his father made him the first)
Bahnar: Hôsa, adrĕch adrung Mêrari, kư̆m đei lu kon drŏ-nglo; Simri kon mă mônh mă khan sư ưh kơ trŏ kon kơdră ră, 'bă sư pôk sư pơm kon kơdră.

English: Hilkiah the second, Tebaliah the third, Zechariah the fourth; all the sons and brethren of Hosah were thirteen.
Bahnar: Hilkia kon mă 'bar, Têbalia kon mă pêng păng Sacharia kon mă puăn. Đĭ-đăng kon drŏ-nglo păng 'nhŏng Hôsa đei mơjĭt-pêng 'nu.

English: Among these were the divisions of the gatekeepers, among the chief men, having duties just like their brethren, to serve in the house of the LORD.
Bahnar: 'Nâu lu khŭl bơngai gak 'măng jang kiơ̆ kơ yŏng pơgơ̆r lu sư, kư̆m bơ̆jang lăm hnam Kră Yang lei-lăi thoi lu 'nhŏng oh sư.

English: And they cast lots for each gate, the small as well as the great, according to their father’s house.
Bahnar: Lu sư kiơ̆ kơ adrĕch adrung kơdih na hlang lăng iŏk 'măng jang bơngai 'lơ̆p thoi bơngai 'lŏ.

English: The lot for the East Gate fell to Shelemiah. Then they cast lots for his son Zechariah, a wise counselor, and his lot came out for the North Gate
Bahnar: Hlang lăng 'măng jang hơlĕch trŏ kơ Sêlêmia. Hlang lăng 'măng jang yă-nơ̆m, trŏ kơ Sacharia kon drŏ-nglo Sêlêmia, bơngai gơh hơgei tơgŭm chă đon.

English: to Obed-Edom the South Gate, and to his sons the storehouse.
Bahnar: Hlang lăng 'măng jang gơal trŏ kơ Ôbêt Eđôm; hlang lăng trŏ kơ lu kon drŏ-nglo sư, wei-lăng hnam 'măn tơmam.

English: To Shuppim and Hosah the lot came out for the West Gate, with the Shallecheth Gate on the ascending highway—watchman opposite watchman.
Bahnar: Suppim păng Hôsa hlang lăng trŏ 'măng jang Bơmơ̆t, 'măng jang Salêket, 'bơ̆t trong suăn năm tơ 'bar tŏ anih gak.

English: On the east were six Levites, on the north four each day, on the south four each day, and for the storehouse two by two.
Bahnar: Rim năr 'măng jang Hơlĕch đei tơdrâu 'nu bơngai Lêwi gak 'măng jang gah yă-nơ̆m đei puăn 'nu bơngai Lêwi gak, 'măng jang Gơal đei puăn 'nu bơngai gak, păng hnam 'măn tơmam, rim 'măng đei 'bar 'nu bơngai.

English: As for the Parbar on the west, there were four on the highway and two at the Parbar.
Bahnar: Tơ 'bar tŏ anih gah Bơmơ̆t đei puăn 'nu 'bơ̆t 'nguaih kơ trong păng đei 'bar 'nu bơngai 'bơ̆t lăm cham.

English: These were the divisions of the gatekeepers among the sons of Korah and among the sons of Merari.
Bahnar: 'Noh lu bơngai gak 'măng jang, kon sâu Kôra păng kon sâu Mêrari.

English: Of the Levites, Ahijah was over the treasuries of the house of God and over the treasuries of the dedicated things.
Bahnar: Lăm lu bơngai Lêwi mơ'nah wei-lăng hnam 'măn tơmam, hnam Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei păng anih tah lu tơmam rơgoh.

English: The sons of Laadan, the descendants of the Gershonites of Laadan, heads of their fathers’ houses, of Laadan the Gershonite: Jehieli.
Bahnar: Kon sâu Lađan lăm bơngai Gersôn pơm yŏng kơdră lăm bơngai Gersôn noh Jehieli.

English: The sons of Jehieli, Zetham and Joel his brother, were over the treasuries of the house of the LORD.
Bahnar: Lu kon drŏ-nglo Jehieli noh Sêtham, păng Jôel oh sư đĭ-đăng lu sư jang wei-lăng hnam tah tơmam lăm hnam Kră Yang.

English: Of the Amramites, the Izharites, the Hebronites, and the Uzzielites
Bahnar: Lăm bơngai Amram bơngai Ishar, bơngai Hêbrôn păng bơngai Usiêlit.

English: Shebuel the son of Gershom, the son of Moses, was overseer of the treasuries.
Bahnar: Noh Subael, kon sâu Gersôm, kon drŏ-nglo Môis, pơm yŏng wei-lăng hnam tah tơmam gĭt.

English: And his brethren by Eliezer were Rehabiah his son, Jeshaiah his son, Joram his son, Zichri his son, and Shelomith his son.
Bahnar: 'Nhŏng oh, kiơ̆ adrĕch Êliêser noh Rêhabia, kon drŏ-nglo sư Jêsaia, kon drŏ-nglo sư Jôram, kon drŏ-nglo sư Sikri, kon drŏ-nglo sư Sêlômit.

English: This Shelomith and his brethren were over all the treasuries of the dedicated things which King David and the heads of fathers’ houses, the captains over thousands and hundreds, and the captains of the army, had dedicated.
Bahnar: Sêlômit păng 'nhŏng oh sư wei-lăng hnam 'măn lu tơmam gĭt đơ̆ng pơtao Đawit, lu bơngai yŏng kơdră adrĕch adrung, yŏng pơgơ̆r minh-rơbâu linh păng minh-hrĕng linh, hăm lu yŏng linh nai đei pơyơ̆r.

English: Some of the spoils won in battles they dedicated to maintain the house of the LORD.
Bahnar: Kŭm đei lu tơmam đơ̆ng blah iŏk kơplah tơblah băl, wă yua ming hơmet hnam Kră Yang.

English: And all that Samuel the seer, Saul the son of Kish, Abner the son of Ner, and Joab the son of Zeruiah had dedicated, every dedicated thing, was under the hand of Shelomith and his brethren.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu tơmam mă Samuel, bơngai khan lê̆ adrol đơ̆ng Sôl, kon drŏ-nglo Kis, Apner, kon drŏ-nglo Nêr păng Jôap, kon drŏ-nglo Sêruia, păng lu bơngai nai đei pơyơ̆r Sêlômit păng lu 'nhŏng oh sư wei-lăng ngăl.

English: Of the Izharites, Chenaniah and his sons performed duties as officials and judges over Israel outside Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng lăm bơngai Ishar đei Kênania păng lu kon drŏ-nglo sư đe pôk pơm yŏng păng 'bok sek tơlang kơ bơngai Isơrael, lu sư athei wei-lăng tơdrong jang noh 'nguaih kơ hnam akŭm.

English: Of the Hebronites, Hashabiah and his brethren, one thousand seven hundred able men, had the oversight of Israel on the west side of the Jordan for all the business of the LORD, and in the service of the king.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng lăm bơngai Hêbrôn đei Hasabia păng 'nhŏng oh sư, tă kơ bơngai nuih gơh hơgei ngăl, lu sư đei minh-rơbâu tơpơh-hrĕng 'nu; lu sư wei-lăng pơgơ̆r kon pơlei Isơrael gah bơmơ̆t kơ đak Krong Jôrđăn, wei-lăng tơdrong jang Kră Yang kư̆m bơ̆jang tơgŭm pơtao.

English: Among the Hebronites, Jerijah was head of the Hebronites according to his genealogy of the fathers. In the fortieth year of the reign of David they were sought, and there were found among them capable men at Jazer of Gilead.
Bahnar: Lăm bơngai Hêbrôn đei Jêrija pơm yŏng kơdră lăm adrĕch adrung sư. Lăm sơnăm mă puăn-jĭt lăm chăl Đawit pơgơ̆r đe chă lăng 'bôh lăm bơngai Hêbrôn, đei lu bơngai nuih gơh hơgei lăm pơlei Jaser lăm dêh Gileat.

English: And his brethren were two thousand seven hundred able men, heads of fathers’ houses, whom King David made officials over the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh, for every matter pertaining to God and the affairs of the king.
Bahnar: Jêrija đei 'bar-rơbâu tơpơh-hrĕng 'nu 'nhŏng oh sư, nuih gơh hơgei pơm yŏng kơdră wei-lăng hnam dơnŏ 'bă; pơtao Đawit pôk lu sư wă kơ pơgơ̆r bơngai Rubên păng bơngai Gat păng kơ minh puăt bơngai Manase, lăm tơdrong jang Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei păng tơdrong jang pơtao.

English: And the children of Israel, according to their number, the heads of fathers’ houses, the captains of thousands and hundreds and their officers, served the king in every matter of the military divisions. These divisions came in and went out month by month throughout all the months of the year, each division having twenty-four thousand.
Bahnar: 'Nâu chih anăn lu bơngai Isơrael: Lu yŏng kơdră lăm adrĕch 'bă sư lu yŏng pơgơ̆r minh-rơbâu 'nu păng pơgơ̆r minh-hrĕng 'nu păng lu bơngai yŏng bơ̆jang ăn kơ pơtao, wei-lăng đĭ-đăng khŭl linh oei bơ̆jang dah khŭl lu linh oei pơdơh rim khei lăm minh sơnăm đei 'bar-jĭt puăn-rơbâu 'nu bơngai lăm minh khŭl.

English: Over the first division for the first month was Jashobeam the son of Zabdiel, and in his division were twenty-four thousand
Bahnar: Yŏng pơgơ̆r khŭl linh mă mônh, lăm khei mônh, noh Jahôbêam, kon drŏ-nglo Sapđiêl. Lăm khŭl sư đei 'bar-jĭt puăn-rơbâu 'nu bơngai.

English: he was of the children of Perez, and the chief of all the captains of the army for the first month.
Bahnar: Sư adrĕch Pêres, pơm yŏng linh lăm khei mônh.

English: Over the division of the second month was Dodai an Ahohite, and of his division Mikloth also was the leader; in his division were twenty-four thousand.
Bahnar: Yŏng pơgơ̆r khŭl linh khei 'bar noh Đôđai, bơngai Ahôhi; Miklôt pơm yŏng pơgơ̆r lăm khŭl sư; đei 'bar-jĭt puăn-rơbâu 'nu bơngai.

English: The third captain of the army for the third month was Benaiah, the son of Jehoiada the priest, who was chief; in his division were twenty-four thousand.
Bahnar: Yŏng pơgơ̆r khŭl linh mă pêng, lăm khei pêng, noh Bênaia, kon drŏ-nglo 'bok soi Jêhôiada; lăm khŭl sư đei 'bar-jĭt rơbâu 'nu bơngai.

English: This was the Benaiah who was mighty among the thirty, and was over the thirty; in his division was Ammizabad his son.
Bahnar: Bênaia 'nâu bơngai nuih pran kơtang pêng-jĭt 'nu bơngai nuih kơtang noh sư pơgơ̆r. Ammisabat kon drŏ-nglo sư kư̆m oei lăm khŭl sư.

English: The fourth captain for the fourth month was Asahel the brother of Joab, and Zebadiah his son after him; in his division were twenty-four thousand.
Bahnar: Yŏng pơgơ̆r khŭl linh mă puăn, lăm khei puăn, noh Asahel, oh Jôap. Sêbapđia, kon drŏ-nglo sư, pơm yŏng pơtrơp sư lăm khŭl sư đei 'bar-jĭt puăn-rơbâu 'nu bơngai.

English: The fifth captain for the fifth month was Shamhuth the Izrahite; in his division were twenty-four thousand.
Bahnar: Yŏng pơgơ̆r khŭl linh mă pơđăm lăm khei pơđăm, noh Samhut, bơngai Israhit, lăm khŭl sư đei 'bar-jĭt puăn-rơbâu 'nu bơngai.

English: The sixth captain for the sixth month was Ira the son of Ikkesh the Tekoite; in his division were twenty-four thousand.
Bahnar: Yŏng pơgơ̆r khŭl linh mă tơdrâu lăm khei tơdrâu, noh Ira, kon drŏ-nglo Ikes, oei đơ̆ng pơlei Têkôit; lăm khŭl sư đei 'bar-jĭt puăn-rơbâu 'nu bơngai.

English: The seventh captain for the seventh month was Helez the Pelonite, of the children of Ephraim; in his division were twenty-four thousand.
Bahnar: Yŏng pơgơ̆r khŭl linh mă tơpơh lăm khei tơpơh, noh Hêles, bơngai adrĕch adrung Êphraim oei tơ pơlei Pelôn; lăm khŭl sư đei 'bar-jĭt puăn-rơbâu 'nu bơngai.

English: The eighth captain for the eighth month was Sibbechai the Hushathite, of the Zarhites; in his division were twenty-four thousand.
Bahnar: Yŏng pơgơ̆r khŭl linh mă tơhngam lăm khei tơhngam, noh Sibêkai, oei tơ pơlei Husa, gah adrĕch adrung Sêra, lăm khŭl sư đei 'bar-jĭt puăn-rơbâu 'nu bơngai.

English: The ninth captain for the ninth month was Abiezer the Anathothite, of the Benjamites; in his division were twenty-four thousand.
Bahnar: Yŏng pơgơ̆r khŭl linh mă tơsĭn, lăm khei tơsĭn, noh Abiaser, bơngai adrĕch adrung Bênjamin, oei tơ Anathôt; lăm khŭl sư đei 'bar-jĭt puăn-rơbâu 'nu bơngai.

English: The tenth captain for the tenth month was Maharai the Netophathite, of the Zarhites; in his division were twenty-four thousand.
Bahnar: Yŏng pơgơ̆r khŭl linh mă mơjĭt, lăm khei mơjĭt, noh Maharai, adrĕch adrung Sêra, oei tơ pơlei Netôpha; lăm khŭl sư đei 'bar-jĭt puăn-rơbâu 'nu bơngai.

English: The eleventh captain for the eleventh month was Benaiah the Pirathonite, of the children of Ephraim; in his division were twenty-four thousand.
Bahnar: Yŏng pơgơ̆r khŭl linh mă mơjĭt-mônh lăm khei mơjĭt-mônh, noh Bênaia, bơngai adrĕch adrung Êphraim, oei tơ pơlei Pirathôn; lăm khŭl sư đei 'bar-jĭt puăn-rơbâu 'nu bơngai.

English: The twelfth captain for the twelfth month was Heldai the Netophathite, of Othniel; in his division were twenty-four thousand.
Bahnar: Yŏng pơgơ̆r khŭl linh mă mơjĭt-'bar, lăm khei mơjĭt-'bar, noh Helđai, adrĕch adrung Ôtniêl, oei tơ pơlei Nêtôpha; lăm khŭl sư đei 'bar-jĭt puăn 'nu bơngai.

English: Furthermore, over the tribes of Israel: the officer over the Reubenites was Eliezer the son of Zichri; over the Simeonites, Shephatiah the son of Maachah
Bahnar: 'Nâu lu bơngai wei-lăng lu adrĕch adrung Isơrael: Êliêser kon drŏ-nglo Sikri, wei-lăng adrĕch Rubên; bơngai wei-lăng adrĕch Simêôn noh Sêphatia, kon drŏ-nglo Maaka

English: over the Levites, Hashabiah the son of Kemuel; over the Aaronites, Zadok
Bahnar: Hasabia kon drŏ-nglo Kêmuel bơngai wei-lăng adrĕch adrung Lêwi: Sađôk sư wei-lăng kon sâu Arôn

English: over Judah, Elihu, one of David’s brothers; over Issachar, Omri the son of Michael
Bahnar: Êlihu, 'nhŏng Đawit bơngai wei-lăng adrĕch Juđa; Ômri kon drŏ-nglo Mikael, wei-lăng adrĕch Isakar

English: over Zebulun, Ishmaiah the son of Obadiah; over Naphtali, Jerimoth the son of Azriel
Bahnar: Ismaia kon drŏ-nglo Ôbadia; bơngai wei-lăng adrĕch Sabulun. Jêremôt kon drŏ-nglo Asriel, bơngai wei-lăng adrĕch Neptali.

English: over the children of Ephraim, Hoshea the son of Azaziah; over the half-tribe of Manasseh, Joel the son of Pedaiah
Bahnar: Hôsêa, kon drŏ-nglo Asasia; bơngai wei-lăng adrĕch adrung Êphraim, Jôel kon drŏ-nglo Pêđaia, bơngai wei-lăng minh puăt adrĕch Manase.

English: over the half–tribe of Manasseh in Gilead, Iddo the son of Zechariah; over Benjamin, Jaasiel the son of Abner
Bahnar: Iđô, kon drŏ-nglo Sachari bơngai wei-lăng minh puăt adrĕch adrung Manase tơ dêh Gileat. Jaasiel kon drŏ-nglo Apner bơngai wei-lăng adrĕch Bênjamin.

English: over Dan, Azarel the son of Jeroham. These were the leaders of the tribes of Israel.
Bahnar: Asarel, kon drŏ-nglo Jêrôham bơngai wei-lăng adrĕch Đan. 'Noh lu bơngai pơgơ̆r wei-lăng lu adrĕch adrung Isơrael.

English: But David did not take the number of those twenty years old and under, because the LORD had said He would multiply Israel like the stars of the heavens.
Bahnar: Đawit ưh kơ đei iŏk bơngai Isơrael đơ̆ng 'bar-jĭt sơnăm tơ ala, yua kơ Kră Yang đei pơkă Sư gô ăn kơ kon pơlei Isơrael lơlap lơlang thoi sơnglŏng kơpal plĕnh.

English: Joab the son of Zeruiah began a census, but he did not finish, for wrath came upon Israel because of this census; nor was the number recorded in the account of the chronicles of King David.
Bahnar: Jôap kon drŏ-nglo Sêruia pơtơm jô̆ kon pơlei, mă-lei ưh kơ keh đang. Yua kơ tơdrong noh, na Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei hil mĭl truh kơ Isơrael păng lu kon pơlei mă ưh tam jô̆ 'noh ưh kơ đei chih tơmơ̆t lăm Sơ̆p hla bơar tơdrong hơ'mon pơtao Đawit.

English: And Azmaveth the son of Adiel was over the king’s treasuries; and Jehonathan the son of Uzziah was over the storehouses in the field, in the cities, in the villages, and in the fortresses.
Bahnar: Asmawet, kon drŏ-nglo Ađiêl, wei-lăng lu hnam tah tơmam pơtao; Jônathan kon drŏ-nglo Usia, wei-lăng lu hnam tah tơmam pơlei tih, lăm rim pơlei iĕ păng lăm rim kơđông linh 'nguaih kơ pơlei Jêrusalem

English: Ezri the son of Chelub was over those who did the work of the field for tilling the ground.
Bahnar: Êsri, kon drŏ-nglo Kêlup, wei-lăng lu bơngai jang mir na

English: And Shimei the Ramathite was over the vineyards, and Zabdi the Shiphmite was over the produce of the vineyards for the supply of wine.
Bahnar: Simei, bơngai Rama wei-lăng lu pơgar hơmu; Sapđi bơngai Sipha, wei-lăng hnam hmĕt sik hơmu đơ̆ng pơgar hơmu

English: Baal-Hanan the Gederite was over the olive trees and the sycamore trees that were in the lowlands, and Joash was over the store of oil.
Bahnar: Baal Hanan bơngai Gêđer, wei-lăng lu 'long ôliwơ păng 'long hơra lăm tơring Sephela gah bơmơ̆t; Jôas sư wei-lăng lu hnam tah đak rơmă ôliwơ

English: And Shitrai the Sharonite was over the herds that fed in Sharon, and Shaphat the son of Adlai was over the herds that were in the valleys.
Bahnar: Sitrai, bơngai Sarôn, wei-lăng lu khŭl rơmo lăm tơmăn glă Sarôn. Saphat kon drŏ-nglo Attai wei-lăng khŭl rơmo lăm thŭng dơnă

English: Obil the Ishmaelite was over the camels, Jehdeiah the Meronothite was over the donkeys
Bahnar: Ôbil, bơngai Ismael, wei-lăng khŭl aseh lăk-đa; Jêđeia, bơngai Mêranôt, wei-lăng Aseh iĕ

English: and Jaziz the Hagrite was over the flocks. All these were the officials over King David’s property.
Bahnar: Jasis, bơngai Hagrit, wei-lăng khŭl triu. Đĭ-đăng lu bơngai 'nâu lu bơngai pơm yŏng wei-lăng lu mŭk tơmam pơtao Đawit.

English: Also Jehonathan, David’s uncle, was a counselor, a wise man, and a scribe; and Jehiel the son of Hachmoni was with the king’s sons.
Bahnar: Jônathan, ma kơ Đawit, bơngai đei đon gơh hơgei hlôh wao chih hla bơar tơgŭm chă đon pơđâu; Jêhiêl kon drŏ-nglo Hakmôni pơm bơngai wei rong lu kon drŏ-nglo pơtao.

English: Ahithophel was the king’s counselor, and Hushai the Archite was the king’s companion.
Bahnar: Ahithôphel pơm bơngai chă đon pơđâu hăm pơtao; Husai, bơngai Arkit, buăl juăt pơtao.

English: After Ahithophel was Jehoiada the son of Benaiah, then Abiathar. And the general of the king’s army was Joab.
Bahnar: Ahithôphel, Jêhôiada, kon drŏ-nglo Bênaia păng Abiathar pơtrơp đơ̆ng Ahithôphel. Jôap pơm yŏng tih hloh pơgơ̆r linh pơtao.

English: Now David assembled at Jerusalem all the leaders of Israel: the officers of the tribes and the captains of the divisions who served the king, the captains over thousands and captains over hundreds, and the stewards over all the substance and possessions of the king and of his sons, with the officials, the valiant men, and all the mighty men of valor.
Bahnar: Đawit krao akŭm đĭ-đăng lu bơngai pơgơ̆r Isơrael, brŏk tơ pơlei Jêrusalem. Lu bơngai yŏng kơdră lăm adrĕch adrung, lu bơngai pơgơ̆r lăm khŭl mă bơ̆jang kơ pơtao, lu yŏng wei-lăng minh-rơbâu păng minh-hrĕng linh, lu bơngai wei-lăng mŭk tơmam lu sem dơrong pơtao hăm lu kon drŏ-nglo sư, hơdai hăm lu bơngai bơ̆jang lăm hnam pơtao păng đĭ-đăng lu bơngai gơh hơgei nuih pran kơtang.

English: Then King David rose to his feet and said, “Hear me, my brethren and my people: I had it in my heart to build a house of rest for the ark of the covenant of the LORD, and for the footstool of our God, and had made preparations to build it.
Bahnar: Pơtao Đawit iung pơma khan: “Ơ lu 'nhŏng oh păng kon pơlei inh, mơ̆ng bĕ inh! Inh đei đon tơchĕng pơm minh pôm hnam Hom Pơgơ̆p Kră Yang, anih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei sư dan jơ̆ng, inh chă đon hơmet lê̆ tơmam tôm boih wă pơm.

English: But God said to me, ‘You shall not build a house for My name, because you have been a man of war and have shed blood.’
Bahnar: Mă-lei Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei pơma hăm inh khan: ‘Ih ưh kơ pơm hnam ăn kơ anăn inh ôh, yua kơ ih minh 'nu bơngai tơblah pơlôch tuh pham lơ boih.’

English: However the LORD God of Israel chose me above all the house of my father to be king over Israel forever, for He has chosen Judah to be the ruler. And of the house of Judah, the house of my father, and among the sons of my father, He was pleased with me to make me king over all Israel.
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Isơrael đei rơih boih inh đơ̆ng lăm hnam dơnŏ 'bă inh, wă pơm pơtao Isơrael ling-lang. Tơpă sư đei rơih boih adrĕch Juđa pơgơ̆r wei-lăng; đơ̆ng lăm adrĕch Juđa sư rơih iŏk hnam dơnŏ 'bă inh; lăm lu kon drŏ-nglo 'bă inh, Kră Yang lăp đon rơih iŏk inh, pôk inh pơm pơtao kơ đĭ-đăng lu bơngai Isơrael.

English: And of all my sons (for the LORD has given me many sons) He has chosen my son Solomon to sit on the throne of the kingdom of the LORD over Israel.
Bahnar: Lăm lu kon drŏ-nglo inh, tơpă Kră Yang ăn kơ inh đei lơ kon drŏ-nglo Sư rơih iŏk Sôlômôn, kon drŏ-nglo inh, pơm pơtao lăm dêh char pơtao Kră Yang pơgơ̆r wei-lăng Isơrael.

English: Now He said to me, ‘It is your son Solomon who shall build My house and My courts; for I have chosen him to be My son, and I will be his Father.
Bahnar: Sư khan kơ Inh: Sôlômôn kon drŏ-nglo ih, gô pơm hnam păng cham Inh yua kơ Inh rơih iŏk boih sư pơm kon drŏ-nglo Inh, păng Inh gô pơm 'bă sư.

English: Moreover I will establish his kingdom forever, if he is steadfast to observe My commandments and My judgments, as it is this day.’
Bahnar: Inh gô ăn kơ dêh char pơtao sư kơjăp ling-lang tơdah sư đei jơhngơ̆m đon kơjăp wei răk dôm nơ̆r Inh păng tơdrong juăt Inh nhen thoi dang ei.

English: Now therefore, in the sight of all Israel, the assembly of the LORD, and in the hearing of our God, be careful to seek out all the commandments of the LORD your God, that you may possess this good land, and leave it as an inheritance for your children after you forever.
Bahnar: Na dang ei, 'bơ̆t anăp đĭ-đăng bơngai Isơrael kon pơlei Kră Yang păng đei Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu bơ̆n mơ̆ng, lu iĕm wei răk bĕ dôm khôi juăt nơ̆r tơtă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm lei na lu iĕm gơh đei iŏk dêh char 'lơ̆ng rŏ 'nâu păng 'măn ăn kơ kon sâu đơ̆ng rŏng bơ̆jang sa ling-lang.

English: “As for you, my son Solomon, know the God of your father, and serve Him with a loyal heart and with a willing mind; for the LORD searches all hearts and understands all the intent of the thoughts. If you seek Him, He will be found by you; but if you forsake Him, He will cast you off forever.
Bahnar: Bĕ ih, ơ! Sôlômôn, kon drŏ-nglo inh, athei băt kơ Sư Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei inh 'bă ih, athei đĭ jơhngơ̆m đĭ bơhngol bơ̆jang kơ Kră Yang yua kơ Kră Yang băt hlôh 'bôh nhen lăm jơhngơ̆m klơm klak, păng băt dôm đon tơchĕng. Tơdah ih chă Kră Yang, kon gô tơ'bơ̆p; mă-lei tơdah ih achăng lê̆ Kră Yang, sĭt Kră Yang gô achăng lê̆ ih ling-lang.

English: Consider now, for the LORD has chosen you to build a house for the sanctuary; be strong, and do it.”
Bahnar: Dang ei, lăng bĕ yua kơ Kră Yang rơih iŏk ih boih wă pơm tơiung minh pôm hnam 'măn anih 'lơ̆ng rơgoh. Nuih pran kơtang bĕ na pơm.”

English: Then David gave his son Solomon the plans for the vestibule, its houses, its treasuries, its upper chambers, its inner chambers, and the place of the mercy seat
Bahnar: Đawit pơjao ăn kơ Sôlômôn kon drŏ-nglo sư, hla bơar rup chhơ̆ tơ'bôh anih trong lăm hnam Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, hnam tah tơmam, anih tơ kơpal, anih lăm hnam Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei păng anih rơgoh hloh.

English: and the plans for all that he had by the Spirit, of the courts of the house of the LORD, of all the chambers all around, of the treasuries of the house of God, and of the treasuries for the dedicated things
Bahnar: Pơtao kư̆m pơjao dơ̆ng đĭ-đăng rup đơ̆ng Yang Bơhngol mă đei ăn lăm kơ̆l đon sư, gah hnam Kră Yang păng gah lu anih puăn pah, gah hnam tah tơmam Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei păng gah lu hnam 'măn tơmam pơyơ̆r

English: also for the division of the priests and the Levites, for all the work of the service of the house of the LORD, and for all the articles of service in the house of the LORD.
Bahnar: gah lu 'bok soi păng bơngai Lêwi kơ tơdrong jang lăm hnam Kră Yang păng gah lu tơmam yua lăm hnam Kră Yang

English: He gave gold by weight for things of gold, for all articles used in every kind of service; also silver for all articles of silver by weight, for all articles used in every kind of service
Bahnar: Pơtao kŏng ăn dôm yơ maih gah lu tơmam păng maih yua lăm lu tơdrong jang, kŏng ăn dôm yơ hu kơ lu tơmam wă pơm păng hu, wă yua lăm lu tơdrong jang.

English: the weight for the lampstands of gold, and their lamps of gold, by weight for each lampstand and its lamps; for the lampstands of silver by weight, for the lampstand and its lamps, according to the use of each lampstand.
Bahnar: Kŏng ăn dôm yơ maih wă pơm lu jơ̆ng ŭnh kơđeng păng akâu kơđeng, kŏng ăn maih kơ rim jơ̆ng ŭnh kơđeng păng akâu sư. Kŏng ăn dôm yơ hu wă pơm jơ̆ng păng akâu ŭnh kơđeng; kŏng ăn tôm kơ wă pơm jơ̆ng păng akâu ŭnh kơđeng păng hu.

English: And by weight he gave gold for the tables of the showbread, for each table, and silver for the tables of silver
Bahnar: Sư kư̆m kŏng ăn kơsô̆ maih kơ lu gơ'bang 'măn 'bĕng, kơ gơ'bang 'măn 'bĕng 'lơ̆ng rơgoh păng kŏng ăn hu kơ lu gơ'bang pơm păng hu

English: also pure gold for the forks, the basins, the pitchers of pure gold, and the golden bowls—he gave gold by weight for every bowl; and for the silver bowls, silver by weight for every bowl
Bahnar: Kŏng ăn maih wă pơm chơ'mŏng chơkrơ, pơnhan, kơthao, 'bĭnh păng chhĕr păng maih păng kŏng dôm yơ maih kơ ăn rim pơnhan chhĕr maih păng kŏng ăn hu ăn kơ rim pơnhan chhĕr păng hu.

English: and refined gold by weight for the altar of incense, and for the construction of the chariot, that is, the gold cherubim that spread their wings and overshadowed the ark of the covenant of the LORD.
Bahnar: Kŭm kŏng maih se wă pơm chơnang soi soh tơmam 'bâu phu păng kŏng ăn maih pơm tơnglơ̆p đei chêrubim hăm maih bơyar pơnăr klơ̆p kơpal Hom Pơgơ̆p Kră Yang.

English: “All this,” said David, “the LORD made me understand in writing, by His hand upon me, all the works of these plans.”
Bahnar: Đawit pơma khan: “Đĭ-đăng lu 'nâu, inh đei đơ̆ng ti Kră Yang tơhlâu, păng ăn kơ inh hlôh băt đĭ-đăng rim tơdrong wă pơm.”

English: And David said to his son Solomon, “Be strong and of good courage, and do it; do not fear nor be dismayed, for the LORD God—my God—will be with you. He will not leave you nor forsake you, until you have finished all the work for the service of the house of the LORD.
Bahnar: Đawit khan kơ Sôlômôn kon drŏ-nglo sư: “Mă pran kơjăp jơhngơ̆m đon na bơ̆jang; 'nĕ kơ hli, 'nĕ kơ bơ̆l hăl, yua kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei 'bă oei hơdai hăm kon; Sư ưh kơ đei layơ achăng hŭt kon, dĭng truh tơ tơiung hnam Kră Yang keh đang.

English: Here are the divisions of the priests and the Levites for all the service of the house of God; and every willing craftsman will be with you for all manner of workmanship, for every kind of service; also the leaders and all the people will be completely at your command.”
Bahnar: Đei lu 'bok soi păng bơngai Lêwi, wă jang pơm hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei; đei lu sư gơh hơgei dôm tơdrong jang tơgŭm noh; lu 'bok pơgơ̆r păng đĭ-đăng kon pơlei, lu sư gô chu yom pơm kiơ̆ nơ̆r kon pơkă ngăl.”

English: Furthermore King David said to all the assembly: “My son Solomon, whom alone God has chosen, is young and inexperienced; and the work is great, because the temple is not for man but for the LORD God.
Bahnar: Đawit khan kơ đĭ-đăng tơpôl akŭm: “Sôlômôn, kon drŏ-nglo inh mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei đei rơih iŏk, oei hơ'lơ̆p, sư tam mă biơh băt tơdrong jang âu tih dêh, yua kơ pơm hnam ưh kơ trŏ pơm kơ bơngai ôh, mă-lei hnam 'noh pơm ăn kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: Now for the house of my God I have prepared with all my might: gold for things to be made of gold, silver for things of silver, bronze for things of bronze, iron for things of iron, wood for things of wood, onyx stones, stones to be set, glistening stones of various colors, all kinds of precious stones, and marble slabs in abundance.
Bahnar: Inh đĭ jơhngơ̆m klơm klak hơmet tơmam wă pơm hnam Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei bơ̆n, maih kơ tơmam kiơ pơm hăm maih, hu kơ tơmam kiơ pơm hăm hu, kong kơ tơmam kiơ pơm hăm kong, bơsei kơ tơmam kiơ pơm hăm bơsei 'long kơ tơmam păng 'long tơmo rang păng lu tơmo gĭt hăm tơmo kok jơk tôm tĕch đak gôh găm.

English: Moreover, because I have set my affection on the house of my God, I have given to the house of my God, over and above all that I have prepared for the holy house, my own special treasure of gold and silver
Bahnar: Yua kơ đei jơhngơ̆m 'mêm kơ hnam Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei bơ̆n, na 'nguaih kơ dôm tơmam inh ăn wă pơm hnam 'lơ̆ng rơgoh, inh kư̆m pơyơ̆r ăn kơ pơm hnam Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei inh lu tơmam maih hu đơ̆ng hnam tah tơmam inh kơdih.

English: three thousand talents of gold, of the gold of Ophir, and seven thousand talents of refined silver, to overlay the walls of the houses
Bahnar: Inh đei pơyơ̆r boih minh-hrĕng tân maih Ôphir păng 'bar-hrĕng puăn-jĭt tân hu rơgoh, wă lom klơ̆p kơ tơnăr hnam akŭm wă pơm.

English: the gold for things of gold and the silver for things of silver, and for all kinds of work to be done by the hands of craftsmen. Who then is willing to consecrate himself this day to the LORD?”
Bahnar: Maih wă yua kơ lu tơmam pơm hăm maih, hu wă yua kơ lu tơmam pơm hăm hu păng wă yua lơ tơdrong jang bơngai gơh hơgei wă pơm. Dang ei, bu wă 'maih pơyơ̆r kơdih ăn kơ Kră Yang?”

English: Then the leaders of the fathers’ houses, leaders of the tribes of Israel, the captains of thousands and of hundreds, with the officers over the king’s work, offered willingly.
Bahnar: Thoi noh lu bơngai pơgơ̆r lăm adrĕch adrung, lu bơngai pơgơ̆r lăm adrĕch adrung Isơrael, lu yŏng pơgơ̆r minh-rơbâu linh păng minh-hrĕng linh, lu bơngai pơgơ̆r lăm tơdrong jang hnam pơtao lăp đon kơ pơyơ̆r.

English: They gave for the work of the house of God five thousand talents and ten thousand darics of gold, ten thousand talents of silver, eighteen thousand talents of bronze, and one hundred thousand talents of iron.
Bahnar: Lu sư pơyơ̆r gah tơdrong jang pơm hnam Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, minh-hrĕng tơpơh-jĭt tân maih mơjĭt-rơbâu jên maih, darik, pêng-hrĕng puăn-jĭt pơđăm tân hu, tơdrâu-hrĕng mơjĭt tân kong, păng pêng-rơbâu puăn-hrĕng pơđăm-jĭt tân bơsei.

English: And whoever had precious stones gave them to the treasury of the house of the LORD, into the hand of Jehiel the Gershonite.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu đei tơmo gĭt, lei pơjao ăn kơ Jêhiêl adrĕch Gersôn, mă pơgơ̆r lăm hnam tah tơmam Kră Yang.

English: Then the people rejoiced, for they had offered willingly, because with a loyal heart they had offered willingly to the LORD; and King David also rejoiced greatly.
Bahnar: Kon pơlei chơt hiôk gah tơdrong lu sư kơdih akâu đei pơyơ̆r, lu sư đĭ jơhngơ̆m pơyơ̆r kơ Kră Yang; păng pơtao Đawit kư̆m chơt hiôk dêh.

English: Therefore David blessed the LORD before all the assembly; and David said: “Blessed are You, LORD God of Israel, our Father, forever and ever.
Bahnar: 'Bơ̆t anăp đĭ-đăng tơpôl, Đawit bơnê kơ Kră Yang khan: Hơri bơnê kơ Ih ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Isơrael 'bok lu nhôn, đơ̆ng dang ei truh tơ ning-mônh ưh kơ đei layơ tôch!

English: Yours, O LORD, is the greatness, The power and the glory, The victory and the majesty; For all that is in heaven and in earth is Yours; Yours is the kingdom, O LORD, And You are exalted as head over all.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang Ih bơih, tih hloh mơsêh mơyang pran kơtang trŏ kơ hơri ư-ang, krưp rang mơnhal. Ơ Kră Yang đĭ-đăng kơpal plĕnh ala teh gah Ih ngăl. Dêh char pơtao gah Ih păng Ih boih yŏng kơ đĭ-đăng.

English: Both riches and honor come from You, And You reign over all. In Your hand is power and might; In Your hand it is to make great And to give strength to all.
Bahnar: Tơdrong mơdrŏng mơng, păng tơdrong pơyom lĕch đơ̆ng Ih ngăl, Ih boih wei-lăng đĭ-đăng; tơdrong mơsêh mơyang pran kơtang lăm ti Ih; Ih pơm ăn đei tơdrong pơyom păng ăn jơhngơ̆m pran kơ rim 'nu bơngai.

English: “Now therefore, our God, We thank You And praise Your glorious name.
Bahnar: Dang ei, ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu nhôn, lu nhôn bơnê kơ Ih păng hơri ư-ang anăn Ih.

English: But who am I, and who are my people, That we should be able to offer so willingly as this? For all things come from You, And of Your own we have given You.
Bahnar: Mă-lei inh bu, păng kon pơlei inh kiơ, na mă gơh đei jơhngơ̆m pơyơ̆r thoi noh? Đĭ-đăng dôm tơmam tă kơ đơ̆ng Ih ăn ngăl păng dôm tơmam mă lu nhôn pơyơ̆r ăn kơ Ih noh tă kơ lĕch đơ̆ng ti Ih ngăl.

English: For we are aliens and pilgrims before You, As were all our fathers; Our days on earth are as a shadow, And without hope.
Bahnar: Yua kơ 'bơ̆t anăp Ih lu nhôn păng lu yă 'bok nhôn jơ̆ bơngai tơmoi, chăl arih lu nhôn tơ kơpal teh nhen thoi ngôi ưh kơ đei anih wă hơmĕng.

English: “O LORD our God, all this abundance that we have prepared to build You a house for Your holy name is from Your hand, and is all Your own.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu nhôn, dôm lu tơmam mă lu nhôn đei pơyơ̆r wă pơm hnam kơ Anăn 'Lơ̆ng Rơgoh Ih, tă kơ lĕch đơ̆ng ti Ih păng đĭ-đăng tă kơ tơmam ih ngăl.

English: I know also, my God, that You test the heart and have pleasure in uprightness. As for me, in the uprightness of my heart I have willingly offered all these things; and now with joy I have seen Your people, who are present here to offer willingly to You.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei inh, inh băt kơ Ih 'bôh nhen lăm jơhngơ̆m klơm klak kon bơngai păng Ih hiôk gah tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt. Gah inh kư̆m kiơ̆ tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt lăm jơhngơ̆m hiôk pơyơ̆r ăn kơ ih lu tơmam 'nâu. Dang ei inh hiôk dêh inh 'bôh kon pơlei Ih oei tơ âu kư̆m đei pơyơ̆r ăn kơ Ih hăm jơhngơ̆m hiôk.

English: O LORD God of Abraham, Isaac, and Israel, our fathers, keep this forever in the intent of the thoughts of the heart of Your people, and fix their heart toward You.
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Abraham, Isăk păng Isơrael, yă 'bok lu nhôn apinh Ih ăn kơ kon pơlei ih wei răk ling-lang lăm Jơhngơ̆m đon 'lơ̆ng păng pơm ăn lăm Jơhngơ̆m lu sư chu kiơ̆ Ih.

English: And give my son Solomon a loyal heart to keep Your commandments and Your testimonies and Your statutes, to do all these things, and to build the temple for which I have made provision.”
Bahnar: Apinh Ih ăn kơ Sôlômôn, kon drŏ-nglo inh, đĭ jơhngơ̆m wei răk lu nơ̆r tơtă khôi juăt păng nơ̆r Ih pơkă pơkăm kư̆m pơm tôm tơdrong jang wă, man tơiung hnam mă inh đei chă hơmet lê̆ tơmam bơih.”

English: Then David said to all the assembly, “Now bless the LORD your God.” So all the assembly blessed the LORD God of their fathers, and bowed their heads and prostrated themselves before the LORD and the king.
Bahnar: Đawit khan kơ đĭ-đăng tơpôl: “Iĕm athei hơri bơnê kơkuh kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm.” Na đĭ-đăng khŭl tơpôl hơri bơnê hloi kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei yă 'bok lu sư, lu sư kŭp kơ̆l drap kơkuh kơ Kră Yang, păng kơkuh kơ pơtao.

English: And they made sacrifices to the LORD and offered burnt offerings to the LORD on the next day: a thousand bulls, a thousand rams, a thousand lambs, with their drink offerings, and sacrifices in abundance for all Israel.
Bahnar: Năr đơ̆ng rŏng, lu sư pơyơ̆r tơmam soi 'buh ăn kơ Kră Yang. Minh-rơbâu rơmo tơno, minh-rơbâu triu tơno păng minh-rơbâu tŏ triu kon, hơdai hăm tơmam soi et păng lơ tơmam soi pơyơ̆r nai kơ đĭ-đăng kon pơlei Isơrael

English: So they ate and drank before the LORD with great gladness on that day. And they made Solomon the son of David king the second time, and anointed him before the LORD to be the leader, and Zadok to be priest.
Bahnar: lăm năr noh, lu sư sa et hiôk chơt 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang. Đơ̆ng rŏng noh wơ̆t mă 'bar lu sư pôk pơyom Sôlômôn kon drŏ-nglo Đawit pơm pơtao, lu sư tuh đak pơgang 'bâu phu kơ sư 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang, păng pôk ăn Sađôk pơm 'bok soi.

English: Then Solomon sat on the throne of the LORD as king instead of David his father, and prospered; and all Israel obeyed him.
Bahnar: Sôlômôn iung pơm pơtao Kră Yang pơtrơp kơ Đawit, 'bă Sư mơdrŏng tih; đĭ-đăng Isơrael chu kiơ̆ nơ̆r sư.

English: All the leaders and the mighty men, and also all the sons of King David, submitted themselves to King Solomon.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu yŏng pơgơ̆r, păng lu bơngai nuih pran kơtang păng đĭ kơ lu kon drŏ-nglo pơtao Đawit pơkă wă chu yom pơm kiơ̆ pơtao Sôlômôn.

English: So the LORD exalted Solomon exceedingly in the sight of all Israel, and bestowed on him such royal majesty as had not been on any king before him in Israel.
Bahnar: Kră Yang pơm ăn kơ Sôlômôn đei pơyom 'bơ̆t anăp đĭ-đăng kon pơlei Isơrael; Sư ăn kơ dêh char Sôlômôn pơtao 'lơ̆ng rŏ hơbŏ krưp, ưh tam đei minh 'nu pơtao Isơrael ayơ adrol kơ sư mă đei thoi noh.

English: Thus David the son of Jesse reigned over all Israel.
Bahnar: Pơtao Đawit kon drŏ-nglo Jese, pơm pơtao pơgơ̆r đĭ-đăng lu bơngai Isơrael.

English: And the period that he reigned over Israel was forty years; seven years he reigned in Hebron, and thirty-three years he reigned in Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Sư pơgơ̆r lu bơngai Isơrael lăm puăn-jĭt sơnăm, sư pơgơ̆r tơpơh sơnăm tơ Hêbrôn păng sư pơgơ̆r pêng-jĭt pêng sơnăm tơ Jêrusalem.

English: So he died in a good old age, full of days and riches and honor; and Solomon his son reigned in his place.
Bahnar: Sư lôch, sơnăm sư đĭ kơjung, sư arih hrăp jơnap mơdrŏng tih păng đe pơyom. Sôlômôn, kon drŏ-nglo sư, pơtrơp sư pơm pơtao.

English: Now the acts of King David, first and last, indeed they are written in the book of Samuel the seer, in the book of Nathan the prophet, and in the book of Gad the seer
Bahnar: Dôm tơdrong hơ'mon kơ pơtao Đawit đơ̆ng blŭng-a truh tơ tôch, đei chih răk tơ lăm Sơ̆p hla bơar Samuel, 'bok khan lê̆ adrol lăm Sơ̆p hla bơar Nathan, 'bok khan lê̆ adrol păng lăm Sơ̆p hla bơar Gat, 'bok khan lê̆ adrol.

English: with all his reign and his might, and the events that happened to him, to Israel, and to all the kingdoms of the lands.
Bahnar: Kŭm đei chih tơdrong sư pơgơ̆r tơdrong nuih pran kơtang sư, dôm tơdrong truh kơ sư, lăm kon pơlei Isơrael păng dôm lu dêh char nai. 11-Nov-2014@18:29, Backup Description=
